jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Account Manager will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You must be comfortable with travel, working with administrative and executive level contacts, and public speaking. The Account Manager will work closely with regional customers, National Account Executives (NAE), and executive management to maintain existing business and increase sales of products/services. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role The Account Manager reports to the Director of Sales. The responsibilities include but are not limited to: Develop and maintain relationships with existing clients Establish regular office visits and ensure customer satisfaction Assist the Director of Sales & Vice President. Maintaining and developing relationships. Enter daily activities through Salesforce.com Stay closely in touch with clients and the market overall to provide critical feedback on marketing, product strategy, client support, and other operational areas to maintain our competitive edge and advantage in the market Represent the sales organization at national conferences, client meetings, and other public forums Understand customer needs and requirements Route qualified opportunities to the appropriate NAE for further development and closure Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest Maintain and expand database of prospects Identify potential areas for product development based on customer interactions Updating self with all the latest information and technological developments of the organization and industry Questioning, studying, and examining the customers of the company to know their needs and generate sales Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role 1-3 years of relevant sales, insurance, or customer service experience High level of accuracy and attention to detail Demonstrated skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) High degree of personal integrity Ability to collaborate with others in a fast-paced, action-oriented, collaborative environment Excellent time management, communication, decision-making, human relations, presentation, and organizational skills The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here represent those an employee encounters while performing this job's essential functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Extensive Travel required Regular presence at In-Person Meetings and Conferences Must be able to manage multiple priorities in a team environment effectively Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Job Description Partners with sales executive and acts as liaison and advocate between accounts (small to mid-sized) and Xactware at all levels. (requesting all config account changes) Ensure proper entitlement for customer contacts (key codes, XA accounts, eSC accounts, profiles, training, closing accounts etc..) Gain knowledge of clients’ processes, procedures, infrastructure and support needs. Ensure customer satisfaction and resolution of all post-implementation Send monthly reports: support issues, tips & tricks, and market trends. Promote custom projects that improve client’s workflow efficiencies and increase Xactware revenue. Some travel required to visit assigned accounts when appropriate. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 4+ years as Professional Services - Product Specialist or comparable experience Met or exceeded customer satisfaction scores while working in similar role BA/BS in business or related technical field and/or equivalent experience preferred 2+ years maintaining customer relationships as Product Specialist and/or applicable experience 3+ years assisting with and/or managing projects, a portfolio of accounts and/or equivalent work related experience Strong organizational, planning and coordination skills Ability to manage priorities, work independently, meet tight deadlines and achieve targets Ability to manage and motivate personnel who may or may not be direct reports Strong communication and interpersonal skills Strong customer service, follow through and focus skills Exceptional problem solving and analysis skills Proficient with MS Office, MS Project, Visio, Excel, MS PowerPoint & Internet technologies Knowledge of property insurance claims processes Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. jobTitle: Actuarial – 2023 Early Career Foundations Program (US) - CR
jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk’s Early Career Foundations Program (ECFP) is the perfect place for you to launch your career. When you join Verisk in your first professional role, you become part of an ECFP cohort with other recent grads working across several of our businesses around the globe. During your first year with Verisk, you will get to experience a special developmental journey in which you’ll have access to senior leaders, job shadowing assignments, stretch opportunities, and learning and development programming designed to fully acclimate you into the Verisk community. This is an opportunity for May/June 2023 graduates to begin their career. The start date for this position is July 2023. Actuarial Analyst Responsibilities Prepare products for regulators and internal & external customers in a timely and accurate manner. Products may include loss cost reviews, filings, circulars, annual statistical filings, and customized data products to meet customer needs. Work on other projects such as class plan reviews, territorial reviews, regulatory reports and fulfilling contractual obligations. Writing and running computer programs to extract data for review and report compilation. Review the quality of data submitted by insurance companies both on transactional and aggregate levels. Develop more efficient, automated ways to improve processing including data quality and error detection processes. This can include providing suggestions for improvements in ratemaking and data quality review procedures. Help respond to questions from regulators and insurers on filings, circulars and other products. Contact ISO’s insurer customers and other organizations regarding the reasonableness of reported data. Make actuarial and data management presentations to Insurer Panels, insurers who report data to us and ISO users of data. Collaborate with other ISO divisions (actuarial, analytical and technology) on improving data, products and procedures. Become a subject matter expert on one or more lines of property-casualty insurance business. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications Graduate or Bachelor's degree with a major in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Risk Management, Operational Research or related discipline. Passing of at least one actuarial exam is preferred. Data management skills or knowledge of insurance data management principles is a plus. Experience in quantitative and qualitative data analysis. Some familiarity with insurance coverages, actuarial methodologies and quality control. Technical background should include a working knowledge of MS Office applications and understanding of computer programming concepts. Knowledge of SQL, SAS, R, ETL tools or Business Rules Engines is a plus Background experience in Tableau, Spotfire, COGNOS, or other data visualization software would be advantageous. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to work under time constraints, multi-task, and adjust plans in the face of changing priorities. Continued desire and ability to learn. Ability to perform essential job duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The ISO Commercial Property Actuarial Product team is seeking an Actuarial Analyst Sr. to join the Commercial Property Actuarial Product team. The Commercial Property Product team is responsible for Commercial Property, Commercial Inland Marine, Equipment Breakdown, and a few minor property lines. The team is responsible for analyzing and creating pricing for new and emerging insurance risks; performing deep dives into pricing methodologies with the goals to enhance and innovate pricing of existing products and coverages; leading efforts in secure filing of pricing changes; providing supports for filings of coverage changes; and maintaining customer focus in all their work. The successful candidate shall enjoy identifying and solving complex actuarial problems, be comfortable working with team members in high-profile projects and own part of the processes, and have the ability to explain work in non-technical contexts to internal and external customers. The role will require frequent communication with many of the functional areas of the ISO Underwriting organization. Responsibilities Work on projects independently that target on developing enhancements and innovations to actuarial products and procedures for CP Collaborate closely with other ISO divisions on new products that may be actuarial or underwriting focused Maintain a high level of customer engagement through product presentations and responses to customer inquiries Provide actuarial analyses in supporting, maintaining and enhancing existing CP actuarial products Be a key contributor in the effort to develop a more modern rating infrastructure for class rated and specifically rated property risks Analyze market, industry, competitor, legal, and regulatory trends and use these to provide actionable insights that drive the business of both the company and its customers Interact with regulatory authorities to support filings of loss cost reviews and new/enhanced products Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science or related majors Passing of one or more actuarial exams. Striving to attain ACAS or FCAS 3+ years’ experience working on team(s) and or projects, with strong records of building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on gaining actionable insights and forming collaborative partnerships with the goal of innovation, product improvement, or ease of use Demonstrated ability to lead initiatives, work independently and as part of a team Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, including presentation skills Knowledge of market, industry, customer, and competitor trends Familiarity with predictive analytics modeling preferred but not required Strong computing skills desired, such as SAS, SQL, Python,, Access, and Excel Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering & Analytics Lab (DEAL) is responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Actuarial Associate, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, line of business experience, and communication skills. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 15-17. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting a wide array of internal customers. The role will have responsibility for managing all aspects of a line of business's data-infrastructure from ingestion to analytic frameworks to content generation. Some Anticipated Work Assignments Include Build and maintain robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data Support product implementation on a new and innovative technology platform with product requirements, actuarial calculations, methods, and validation Design, build and launch extremely efficient & reliable data pipelines to move data (both large and small amounts) in/out of our Snowflake Data Lake Assist with product development and implementation including modeling and assumption development Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team Perform other tasks on R&D, data governance, system infrastructure, and other cross team functions, on an as-needed basis Adopt an agile framework to schedule work, adjust as needed and continuously improve performance Communicate performance with relevant internal stakeholders Work with data analysts to develop reports and visualizations Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering Completion of CAS Exam 5 (Basic Ratemaking), ACAS or higher preferred Minimum 4 years of experience working with property & casualty insurance data, preferably supporting an actuarial/data-science function in one of the following lines of business (Commercial Property, General Liability, Commercial Auto, Personal Auto) Highly proficient with SQL and database concepts Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data Experience in preparing and conducting extensive business analysis and studies, process assessments, data analysis, and requirement specification Proficiency in Python, object-oriented programming, and data structures Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Job Description Collaborate with other ISO/Verisk divisions (Actuarial Operations, Compliance and Product Services, Government Relations, etc.) to maintain, enhance, and develop our products that respond to the current market, competitive, and technological landscape, and integrate them into ISO's Programs. Be one of the key ambassadors for your line(s) of business and its products. Conduct and sometimes lead research on new modeling techniques and new data sources to help support and enhance our current products and develop new products. Drive quality results and customer focus into everyday operation. Support our products by responding to customer and regulatory inquiries; providing expert advice to customers; and developing marketing material, publications, and other documents to support such efforts. Build and maintain a network of contacts within and outside Verisk to keep up with market trends and customer needs Be part of the team that leads the innovation and update of the ISO Personal Auto insurance program and other programs in response to the changing business environment. Utilize your line of business expertise to analyze market, industry, competitor, legal and regulatory trends to provide actionable insights that drive the business of both the company and its customers. Satisfy customer specifications and requirements and meet contractual deadlines. Drive quality results and customer focus into everyday operations. Analyze market, industry, competitor, legal, and regulatory trends and use these to provide actionable insights that drive the business of both the company and its customers. Interact with regulatory authorities to present updates and innovations nd support filings of loss cost reviews and related products, including, at times, representing ISO at meetings with state insurance departments and industry groups. Occasional travel required for industry conferences, customer visits, etc. Collaborate with other ISO/Verisk divisions (Actuarial Operations, Compliance and Product Services, Government Relations, etc.) to maintain, enhance, and develop our products that respond to the current market, competitive, and technological landscape, and integrate them into ISO's Programs. Interact with regulatory authorities to present updates and innovations and support filings of loss cost reviews and related products, including, at times, representing ISO at meetings with state insurance departments and industry groups. Occasional travel required for industry conferences, customer visits, etc. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. Additional relevant education or degrees are a plus. Computer skills: Strong Excel skills are required. Programming skills or willingness to develop programming skills required, particularly SQL, Python, R, and/or other programming languages are a plus. Predictive modeling and/or data analysis experience desirable. Minimum 5 years insurance experience desired (personal auto experience preferred). Deep knowledge of market, industry, customer, competition, etc. desired. Strong record of building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Product development experience and experience working with customers desired. Strong project management skills to take ownership and execute on high quality and timely deliverables. Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, including presentation skills. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team. FCAS, ACAS, or at least 5 CAS exams with commitment to attaining CAS membership is essential to role. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The new Special Projects team in the Personal Lines Actuarial Products (PLAP) division will support key special projects, as related to our rating products. Projects will dynamically span across all of the lines of business for which PLAP is responsible (all Personal Lines plus Farm). Just some examples of major projects this team may work on include territory definitions, rating relativity analyses, and reimagining our various rating plans and their components. The Special Projects area will also be on the ready to pitch in when more hands are needed for critical developments in the insurance environment, such as responses to regulations and laws or new products urgently needed in the marketplace. Responsibilities Collaborate with other ISO/Verisk divisions (Actuarial Operations, Analytic Data Management, Compliance and Product Services, Government Relations, etc.) to maintain, enhance, and develop products that respond to the current market, competitive, and technological landscape, and integrate them into ISO's Personal Lines and Farm programs. Conduct and sometimes lead research on new modeling techniques and new data sources to help support and enhance our current products and develop new products. Drive quality results and customer focus into everyday operations. Be part of the team that leads the innovation and update of insurance programs in response to the changing business environment. Utilize your actuarial and insurance expertise to analyze market, industry, competitor, legal and regulatory trends. Provide actionable insights that drive the business of both the company and its customers. Support our products by responding to customer and regulatory inquiries; providing expert advice to customers; and developing marketing material, publications, and other documents to support such efforts. Build and maintain a network of contacts within and outside Verisk to keep up with market trends and customer needs. Occasional travel required for industry conferences, customer visits, etc. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. Additional relevant education or degrees are a plus. Strong Excel skills are required. Programming skills or willingness to develop programming skills required, particularly SQL, Python, R, and/or other programming languages a plus. Predictive modeling and/or data analysis experience desired. 5 years or more of insurance analytics experience desired (personal lines and/or Farm experience preferred). Deep knowledge of market, industry, customer, competition, etc. desired. Strong record of building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Product development experience desired. Strong project management skills to take ownership and execute on high quality and timely deliverables. Proven communication and presentation skills a must. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team. FCAS, ACAS, or significant exam progress with commitment to attaining CAS membership is essential to the role.   Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering & Analytics Lab (DEAL) is responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Actuarial Associate, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, line of business experience, and communication skills. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 15-17. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting a wide array of internal customers. The role will have responsibility for managing all aspects of a line of business's data-infrastructure from ingestion to analytic frameworks to content generation. Some Anticipated Work Assignments Include Build and maintain robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data Support product implementation on a new and innovative technology platform with product requirements, actuarial calculations, methods, and validation Design, build and launch extremely efficient & reliable data pipelines to move data (both large and small amounts) in/out of our Snowflake Data Lake Assist with product development and implementation including modeling and assumption development Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team Perform other tasks on R&D, data governance, system infrastructure, and other cross team functions, on an as-needed basis Adopt an agile framework to schedule work, adjust as needed and continuously improve performance Communicate performance with relevant internal stakeholders Work with data analysts to develop reports and visualizations Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering Completion of CAS Exam 5 (Basic Ratemaking), ACAS or higher preferred Minimum 4 years of experience working with property & casualty insurance data, preferably supporting an actuarial/data-science function in one of the following lines of business (Commercial Property, General Liability, Commercial Auto, Personal Auto) Highly proficient with SQL and database concepts Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data Experience in preparing and conducting extensive business analysis and studies, process assessments, data analysis, and requirement specification Proficiency in Python, object-oriented programming, and data structures Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering & Analytics Lab (DEAL) is responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Actuarial Associate, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, line of business experience, and communication skills. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 15-17. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting a wide array of internal customers. The role will have responsibility for managing all aspects of a line of business's data-infrastructure from ingestion to analytic frameworks to content generation. Some Anticipated Work Assignments Include Build and maintain robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data Support product implementation on a new and innovative technology platform with product requirements, actuarial calculations, methods, and validation Design, build and launch extremely efficient & reliable data pipelines to move data (both large and small amounts) in/out of our Snowflake Data Lake Assist with product development and implementation including modeling and assumption development Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team Perform other tasks on R&D, data governance, system infrastructure, and other cross team functions, on an as-needed basis Adopt an agile framework to schedule work, adjust as needed and continuously improve performance Communicate performance with relevant internal stakeholders Work with data analysts to develop reports and visualizations Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering Completion of CAS Exam 5 (Basic Ratemaking), ACAS or higher preferred Minimum 4 years of experience working with property & casualty insurance data, preferably supporting an actuarial/data-science function in one of the following lines of business (Commercial Property, General Liability, Commercial Auto, Personal Auto) Highly proficient with SQL and database concepts Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data Experience in preparing and conducting extensive business analysis and studies, process assessments, data analysis, and requirement specification Proficiency in Python, object-oriented programming, and data structures Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description API architects will collaborate with other teams at Verisk to define new APIs that follow Verisk Standards (https://apicatalog.verisk.com). During This Collaboration, Architects Will Understand product requirements and define an Open API Spec that meets those requirements. If this API connects to a legacy API, design a transformation layer architecture in the cloud that allows that conversion. If it is a new service, collaborate with other teams proposing cloud architectures that can improve the product. Define development standards so transformation layers can be implemented by an external team. Validate that code generated by an external team follows the spec designed by our team. Design and implement internal tools for supporting API Strategy (Okta integration, StopLight integration, publish process, self-serve credentials, etc.) Train teams in Verisk Standards Study and create Proof of Concepts for new technologies and collaborate to create more standards (GraphQL, gRPC, async API) Design proposals for concepts like unique authentication, self-manage credentials, API economy, API quality of service, etc. This Position Requires a Candidate That Would Like To Invest time learning about cloud architectures so we can help teams providing new ideas. Study new API technologies that can provide better service to our customers. Be able to collaborate with other engineers, business managers to create standards. Enjoy doing training or workshops to other teams so we can expand our API Strategy culture. Define software standards so we can delegate implementation to an external team and validate that the work done meets Verisk quality standards. Investigate new ideas that can improve user experience (internal developers, customers, or business managers) Investigate new tools that can improve our internal processes. Requirements Qualifications 5+ years development experience Fluent in C# with .NET Core, with demonstrated experience creating Web APIs. 3+ years working with AWS. Cloud design patterns Good understanding of API Design First and Open API Spec 3 Understand OpenId & OAuth2 concepts Good communication skills Ability to collaborate with other architects and business managers. Think out of the box. We will always try to improve our business. Nice to Have GraphQL AsyncAPI gRPC. Kong plugin development. Experience with Splunk search / Dashboards Experience doing Okta integrations Familiar with Agile/Scrum development methodologies Experience with Verisk Standard Pipelines and Verisk CDK Networking knowledge Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are seeking an experienced Application Support Engineer to support our core business application (Crosspoint) and satellite applications. In this role you will be responsible for managing the support queue, triaging incoming tickets, and handling first and second level tickets as required. Second level tickets require a solid understanding of T-SQL and query design concepts. Applicant should be able to perform complex root cause analysis and approach problems using advanced deductive reasoning skills to rule out potential causes. The Application Support Engineer will also work closely with our development teams to support the application infrastructure and associated environments. This involves troubleshooting environmental issues related to security, hardware, storage, and OS. The engineer will also be responsible for documenting systems and support concepts as required. This role will also require some PowerShell/command line scripting to support dev team data migrations and DevOps build/deployment automation. Job Responsibilities Managing incoming tickets from our help desk system, prioritizing issues as necessary and ensuring timely resolution for user issues. Learning the core SQL application logic and the application modules and touchpoints. Developing a solid understanding of Crosspoint’s core concepts and logging mechanisms. Resolving first level tickets and performing root cause analysis on 2nd/3rd level issues to provide detailed info to development/QA. Communicating with end users when tickets are escalated. Handling communication with business users and management when ticket(s) requires development work and working with the development team to plan patches as necessary. Working closely with our software development teams to monitor the health of the application infrastructure and help resolve any issues that arise. Documenting support processes, common support topics and resolutions and application infrastructure/security frameworks. Engage in light project work to clean up/organize application security components (NTFS, Active Directory groups, SQL security etc.). Assisting the application AWS migration as required, supporting the application on EC2 instances with S3 storage. Scripting task automation as required (Powershell, cmd line etc.). Qualifications Key Competencies: Strong working knowledge of Windows OS/hardware. Strong knowledge of NTFS security and networking concepts. Some knowledge of Powershell/command line scripting. Some knowledge of SQL Queries. Ability to perform complex root cause analysis and determine the root cause of issues. Ability to learn proprietary application logic and modules quickly. Ability to take ownership of the support queue and see tickets through to resolution. Ability to take ownership of light projects when required. Ability to effectively communicate with end users and management. Ability to resolve complex application and infrastructure issues. Ability to document core concepts effectively. Required Skills & Certifications Bachelors Degree. 3-4 years experience Application Support. Strong working knowledge of Windows OS/hardware. Strong knowledge of NTFS security and networking concepts. Some knowledge of Powershell/command line scripting. Ability to perform complex root cause analysis and determine the root cause of issues. Ability to learn proprietary application logic and modules quickly. Ability to take ownership of the support queue and see tickets through to resolution. Ability to effectively communicate with end users and management. Ability to resolve complex application and infrastructure issues. Ability to document core concepts effectively. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Applied Statistician: Atmospheric Perils Modeling Come join the Stochastic Atmospheric Perils Modeling Team in Verisk Extreme Event Solution’s Boston-based Research Department, and contribute to building the next generation of probabilistic catastrophe models for assessing the risk of extreme weather. Our team’s projects offer opportunities for creative problem-solving on a boundless set of interesting statistical problems at the interface of extreme weather, climate change, and risk. Catastrophe models depend fundamentally on hierarchical modeling of space-time physical processes, inference from heterogeneous and incomplete calibration data, and use of ensemble techniques to quantify uncertainties. We learn continuously through interdisciplinary collaborations with a diverse team of meteorologists, applied mathematicians, climate scientists, engineers, and hydrologists. As such, this is a fantastic position for a curious statistician with an interest in modeling atmospheric processes! In addition to possessing sharp technical skills, we also hope you will bring a practical, applied mindset to the role. Our team’s work contributes toward building tools that enable the (re)insurance sector to make sound decisions to enhance social resilience to natural catastrophes. Day To Day Responsibilities First projects are likely to be contributing collaboratively to model formulation, improvement, and implementation for building Verisk’s next generation tropical cyclone models. Work with domain-area experts in meteorology, hydrology, and engineering to understand relevant data sets and translate model calibration and validation needs into statistical analysis and models. Analyze and validate Verisk Extreme Event Solution’s simulated hurricane track sets against observational data to ensure statistical robustness. Perform validation exercises to demonstrate statistical rigor of models, sometimes as part of regulatory requirements. As part of a team, defend the statistical analysis on behalf of Verisk Extreme Event Solutions to external clients and reviewers. Contribute to identification, inference, and modeling of significant non-stationarities in tropical cyclone data, including those that may be due to climate change. Help formulate answers to client questions related to the statistical aspects of Verisk Extreme Event Solution’s tropical cyclone models. Soundboard modeling problems of fellow statistician team members working on other projects, and contribute to a team culture of mutual support, respect, and continued learning. Qualifications Advanced degree in statistics or equivalent statistical modeling experience required (PhD in statistics preferred; position can be flexed for early or mid-career applicants for candidates with a great fit in skills and interests.) Theoretical and applied command of time-series and/or spatial and/or spatio-temporal statistical modeling techniques. Comfort with Bayesian hierarchical modeling required. Excellent communication in both technical and non-technical contexts Ability to present and defend statistical results on behalf of the organization in front of external statisticians and regulators. Willingness and confidence to provide statistical leadership and guidance to team members and senior management. Motivated to contribute creative technical solutions to collaborative team projects, and to implement solutions reproducibly in robust and well-tested code Fluency in R programming language is a necessity Programming in other languages (python, Matlab, Fortran, C, C++, Java) would be a plus, as would be proficiency in shell scripting and cluster computing Expertise in any of the following topics would be a bonus: data assimilation, extreme value theory, Gaussian process emulation of high-dimensional computer models Experience modeling atmospheric or climatic phenomena, or interpreting statistical inference in terms of physical systems, would be a significant advantage. Experience with R package development and version control would also strengthen candidacy. Strong organizational skills that promote reproducible research workflows are also desired. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The ISO Commercial Property Actuarial Product team is seeking an Associate Actuarial Consultant to join the Commercial Property Actuarial Product team. The Commercial Property Product team is responsible for Commercial Property, Commercial Inland Marine, Equipment Breakdown, and a few minor property lines. The team is responsible for analyzing and creating pricing for new and emerging insurance risks; performing deep dives into pricing methodologies with the goals to enhance and innovate pricing of existing products and coverages; leading efforts to secure filing approval of pricing changes; providing supports for filings of coverage changes; and maintaining customer focus in all their work. The successful candidate shall enjoy identifying and solving complex actuarial problems, be comfortable working with team members in high-profile projects and own part of the processes and have the ability to explain work in non-technical contexts to internal and external customers. The successful candidate will also have the programming skills to work with large datasets, fit curves to data, and other use other data science / modeling techniques to support and update the Commercial Property rating plans. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting all aspects of Commercial Property rating. A remote placing is an option for the exceptional candidate, ability to commute to the Jersey City office is a large positive. Some anticipated work assignments include:  Provide actuarial analyses in supporting, maintaining, and enhancing existing CP actuarial products. Revision of rating and ratemaking factors, including deductibles, using both traditional and predictive modeling methods. Support product implementation through creation of rules, documentation and filing support that implement actuarial analyses. Supporting customer questions, regulator questions, and additional projects as they arise. You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities.  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or work equivalent in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering.  Predictive modeling experience (ex. GLM or similar) required. ACAS preferred, CSPA a plus. We support both CAS and CSPA designations. Highly proficient with SQL and Python / R. Proficiency in Power BI or similar a plus. Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data.  Experience in preparing and conducting extensive data analysis. Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.  Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Create, manage, and support all administrative functions associated with the Atlassian product suite (JIRA, Confluence, Crowd, Bamboo, Bitbucket) and Sonar. Maintain JIRA projects, advanced custom workflows, and permissions Create comprehensive JIRA workflows permission schemes, and notification schemes. Test new versions of the tools and plug-ins to ensure compatibility. Provide Subject Matter Expert advice for the Atlassian toolset. Create and manage security schemes, custom fields, and configurations. Develop metrics dashboards and advanced filters in JIRA to provide end-users and business leadership with meaningful operational/performance metrics and status reports. Partner with other IT staff to coordinate infrastructure maintenance and system migrations. Maintain best practices. Ability to use monitoring and other tools to diagnose performance issues Provide user management and support for local and remote users Interact with vendors for support and troubleshooting. Ability and willingness to work a flexible schedule as needed including occasional weekends and evenings. Work on other duties as assigned. Some travel as required. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field experience 5+ years of experience in the design, development, and implementation of JIRA customizations Working experience with Advanced Roadmaps, eazyBI, Automation Rules, and JEMH a plus Working experience with JIRA Service Management a plus Working experience with Jira and Confluence Cloud a plus One or more of the following Atlassian Certifications is a plus: Atlassian Certified Jira Administrator, Atlassian Certified Confluence Administrator, Atlassian Certified JIRA Service Desk Administrator, Atlassian Certified Systems Administrator Experience with AWS is a plus Experience with Ansible automation framework and/or Ansible Tower is a plus Administration experience of Linux and Windows is a plus Working experience with Postgres database is a plus Ability to manage multiple responsibilities with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment Team player, detailed oriented, with strong interpersonal skills Ability to effectively communicate and share knowledge with the team Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Join the Mid-latitude Atmospheric Perils research team at Verisk Extreme Event Solutions in the Boston-based Research Department. You will be responsible for providing a process level understanding of extratropical cyclones/winter storms and the processes or conditions that lead to extreme winds, snowfall accumulations, and freezing rain in the historic, near present, and future climates. As a research scientist, you will be applying your scientific and technical knowledge to represent the observed damage-causing characteristics of extratropical cyclones within catastrophe (CAT) models. You will also support and validate Verisk CAT models for regions around the globe within client-facing meetings and as part of the shared responsibilities of the Mid-latitude Atmospheric Perils research team. The results of your work will be used by industry and governments to assess the risks from extreme weather events. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Provide domain knowledge and modeling (e.g. WRF) or observational expertise for building scientifically sound representations of extreme weather events. Collect and analyze a wide range of in-situ and remote sensing observations. Develop code and apply statically robust methods for model development and evaluation. Engage with clients about validating and using Verisk’s CAT models to assess risks from extreme weather events. Qualifications M.S. with 4+ years professional experience in a technical environment, or Ph.D. degree in meteorology, geoscience, or related fields required Knowledge of atmospheric dynamics is required. Background and experience in extratropical cyclone modeling would be considered a significant advantage. Experience with statistical analysis and data science is desired. Ability to gather, integrate, and critically analyze data from all relevant sources. Strong skills gained through practical experience using high-level language and tools such as Python, R, NCL, Git and Linux environment. Familiarity with C++, MATLAB, FORTRAN Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated record of scientific excellence (e.g., software deliverables/products, publications, presentations) Open to mid-career scientists. Early-career scientist preferred Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Description Join the Verisk corporate Internal Audit team and take your Audit career to the next level. This is a cross functional team working with all areas of the company with high potential for career growth. Performs professional auditing work of low to moderate complexity. Work involves conducting operational, financial and compliance audit projects. Maintains all organizational and professional ethical standards. Works under general supervision with some latitude for initiative and independent judgment. Performs risk based audit procedures, including identifying and defining issues, developing criteria, reviewing and analyzing evidence, and documenting client processes and procedures. Identifies, develops, and documents (using electronic workpapers) audit issues and recommendations using independent judgment concerning areas being reviewed. Develops and maintains productive client and staff relationships through individual contacts and group meetings. Pursues professional development opportunities, including external and internal training and professional association memberships, and shares information gained with co-workers. Actively contributes to continuous improvement of audit tools & techniques consistent with world class internal audit functions Qualifications Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university (accounting or related financial discipline preferred) 0 - 2 years Internal Audit and/or practical experience Certification or working toward certification as a CPA or CIA preferred, MBA a plus Knowledge of and ability to apply internal auditing principles and practices, and management principles and preferred business practices. Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities Ability in collecting and analyzing complex data, evaluating information and systems, and drawing logical conclusions Ability to negotiate issues and resolve problems. Considerable skill in using Microsoft Office Suite products including Word, and Excel. Ability to use automated audit tools as utilized by IAD is a plus Ability to develop effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills and skill in presenting findings and recommendations Ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, staff and external contacts, and to work effectively in a professional team environment Up to 25% travel required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Ability to use automated audit tools as utilized by IAD is a plus Ability to develop effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills and skill in presenting findings and recommendations Ability to establish and maintain harmonious working relationships with co-workers, staff and external contacts, and to work effectively in a professional team environment Up to 25% travel required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. jobTitle: BCEGS Field Representative IV - Charlotte, NC
jobDescription: Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and enjoy working in the field and meeting people, then we have a position for you as a BCEGS Field Representative. ISO’s Building Code Effectiveness Grading Schedule (BCEGS®) assesses the building codes in effect in a particular community and how the community enforces its building codes, with special emphasis on mitigation of losses from natural hazards. Your Major Responsibilities Will Involve Consults with clients to conduct, analyze and document results of communities’ adoption of building and other construction codes and amendments, building plan review, policies and procedures and building department operations, staffing, training, workload and staff certification. Manages verifications in the office and in the field and plans trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Maintains corporate standards of quality, timeliness, productivity and customer service. Preparing a comprehensive report via a computer program on the results of the study. Preparing appropriate reports in accordance with established standards. Planning trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Representing ISO at meetings involving community officials. Maintaining corporate standards of quality, timeliness and customer service. Reporting other information as directed, and performing other duties as assigned. Qualifications We are looking for individuals who possess some of the following knowledge and skills, and/or experience: Field experience in performing surveys involving detailed analyses. Knowledge of building codes, building department operations and building construction is preferred. College degree in a technical discipline is preferred but not required. Excellent customer service, math, and verbal/written communication skills are essential. Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Word and Excel is required. Must be self-motivated, detail oriented, possess a strong work ethic and able to demonstrate the ability to work independently. Valid driver’s license and overnight travel. This position requires a valid driver’s license and some overnight travel, and you will work from your home office to complete all work assignments. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.
