And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and enjoy working in the field and meeting people, then we have a position for you as a BCEGS Field Representative. ISO’s Building Code Effectiveness Grading Schedule (BCEGS®) assesses the building codes in effect in a particular community and how the community enforces its building codes, with special emphasis on mitigation of losses from natural hazards. Your Major Responsibilities Will Involve Consults with clients to conduct, analyze and document results of communities’ adoption of building and other construction codes and amendments, building plan review, policies and procedures and building department operations, staffing, training, workload and staff certification. Manages verifications in the office and in the field and plans trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Maintains corporate standards of quality, timeliness, productivity and customer service. Preparing a comprehensive report via a computer program on the results of the study. Preparing appropriate reports in accordance with established standards. Planning trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Representing ISO at meetings involving community officials. Maintaining corporate standards of quality, timeliness and customer service. Reporting other information as directed, and performing other duties as assigned. Qualifications We are looking for individuals who possess some of the following knowledge and skills, and/or experience: Field experience in performing surveys involving detailed analyses. Knowledge of building codes, building department operations and building construction is preferred. College degree in a technical discipline is preferred but not required. Excellent customer service, math, and verbal/written communication skills are essential. Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Word and Excel is required. Must be self-motivated, detail oriented, possess a strong work ethic and able to demonstrate the ability to work independently. Valid driver’s license and overnight travel. This position requires a valid driver’s license and some overnight travel, and you will work from your home office to complete all work assignments. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

jobTitle: BCEGS Field Representative IV - Springfield, IL
jobDescription: Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Team is responsible for domestic and international benefits including insured benefits (health and welfare); risk benefits, time off policies and retirement. This role will contribute to all areas as needed. Conducts research and comprehensive analysis of benefits data and trends, new approaches with direct access to data and in collaboration with partners and brokers. Evaluate global benefits policies and programs and make recommendations to ensure that programs are current, competitive, and aligned with fit for future strategy; Develops recommendations on benefit program design, strategic projects and initiatives. Provided comprehensive analysis and supporting market review to Total Rewards leadership in regular and project based management of plans that will support global and local improvements to deliver against company goals and objectives. Manage all benefits systems. (System stands for all automations offered by an aggregated system such as Businessolver in US; Vendor or Broker partial automations or internal automations potentially to platforms such as People Portal) Explore/ RFP; Set up and manage all stakeholders contribution to set up; Plan for future development; maintain view over risk and case management working with relevant parties for improvement) Implement compliance requirements and recommended changes to plans and administration systems . Agree with internal and external participants on roles and responsibilities and maintain accurate process maps Work with internal and external partners to ensure implementation of agreed automation and audit principles Handle case escalations and support employees, PL&C BP and Business in understanding benefits process delivery Overview outsourced service (to HR Ops or BU teams as dictated by the current process). Role includes review, benchmark and test current operations to ensure they are fit for purpose and they respect the overall benefits delivery principles. Support global projects and programs focused Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures with focus on international benefits solutions. Offer cover within the team as required Qualifications 5+ years of experience in benefits delivery (experience in benefits management will be a plus) BA in a relevant field, or equivalent (i.e. Human Resources, Management, Business Administration or Data Analytics) Excel advanced skills with sound analytical skills and attention to details Inquisitive personality and continuous improvement orientation Track record of building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders such as HR business partners and HRIS Experience preparing effective communications/PowerPoints to various audiences Ability to assist in the design of health & welfare benefit programs for the US; prior international experience (Americas) is a plus. Experience in implementation, monitoring, and managing benefits administrative systems – US and international. Experience partnering with external benefit carriers, broker/consultants, and technology providers to deliver good quality analysis that informs business decision. General analytical abilities, with strength in Excel-based cost/impact modeling Proven critical thinking and problem-solving skills Experience in delivering executive / board presentations or complex communication packs is a plus Build and maintain relationship with key stakeholders such as HR business partners, HRIS, and HR shared services with as proactive / client facing mindset Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for working with the product teams and development teams to develop and continuously improve the data analytics business intelligence tools provided to our customers. The successful candidate will have experience in data analytics and developing dashboards using a variety of business intelligence tools to design and maintain external facing reporting tools. At times the role may include gathering and analysis of the business requirements and translating them into meaningful specifications. You will also be tasked with research and analysis of customer data. The ideal candidate would be able to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy and efficiency while communicating the information proficiently across different organizational levels. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will design and create visualizations and analytics that meet customer specifications. You will access source data in Microsoft SQL Server environment and play a key role in data modeling and evaluating data integrity You will Maintain and improve existing reporting solutions and data sources, identifying source data issues and concerns and working with appropriate personnel to address these issues. You will perform data analysis and research. You must possess ability to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy, and efficiency. You will Interact with all levels of internal users to gain understanding and translate business requirements into sustainable and efficient visualizations You will communicate testing progress and results, and other relevant information to project stakeholders and management. You may create documentation for training purposes, and support client training initiatives Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Proficiency in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Spotfire. The ideal candidate will have experience in EDI claims compliance reporting and a good understanding of the FROI/SROI transactional data and the corresponding compliance reporting outputs. Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of dimensional modeling preferred. 1-2 years of experience in Dashboard Development and/or Development preferred. Data processing experience preferred Excellent troubleshooting ability required Proficiency in Microsoft Office Experience/knowledge of exploratory data analysis techniques. Strong data analysis, data verification, and problem-solving skills Able to "time-box" and balance multiple responsibilities concurrently with efficiency. Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for working with the product teams and development teams to develop and continuously improve the data analytics business intelligence tools provided to our customers. The successful candidate will have experience in data analytics and developing dashboards using a variety of business intelligence tools to design and maintain external facing reporting tools. At times the role may include gathering and analysis of the business requirements and translating them into meaningful specifications. You will also be tasked with research and analysis of customer data. The ideal candidate would be able to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy and efficiency while communicating the information proficiently across different organizational levels. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will design and create visualizations and analytics that meet customer specifications. You will access source data in Microsoft SQL Server environment and play a key role in data modeling and evaluating data integrity You will Maintain and improve existing reporting solutions and data sources, identifying source data issues and concerns and working with appropriate personnel to address these issues. You will perform data analysis and research. You must possess ability to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy, and efficiency. You will Interact with all levels of internal users to gain understanding and translate business requirements into sustainable and efficient visualizations You will communicate testing progress and results, and other relevant information to project stakeholders and management. You may create documentation for training purposes, and support client training initiatives Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Proficiency in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Spotfire. The ideal candidate will have experience in EDI claims compliance reporting and a good understanding of the FROI/SROI transactional data and the corresponding compliance reporting outputs. Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of dimensional modeling preferred. 1-2 years of experience in Dashboard Development and/or Development preferred. Data processing experience preferred Excellent troubleshooting ability required Proficiency in Microsoft Office Experience/knowledge of exploratory data analysis techniques. Strong data analysis, data verification, and problem-solving skills Able to "time-box" and balance multiple responsibilities concurrently with efficiency. Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Are you someone who is detail-oriented with great analytical and strong communication skills?  Are you looking to work in an environment that supports teamwork and collaboration, while allowing you an opportunity to grow as an individual? If so, our Product Specialist position in our VINMASTER team might be for you.  An established and well-known product within the insurance industry, VINMASTER is a vehicle database that allows insurers a quick and easy way to identify vehicle specifications and Symbols. This data assists insurers in their determination of premiums for physical damage and liability coverages on private passenger autos. In recent years, the suite of VINMASTER products has expanded to include information on motorcycles and Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS). As we continue to grow our offerings, we are looking for you to join us on our journey. Your job will involve enhancing our datasets, maintaining the integrity and quality of the database, generating regular product releases throughout the year, updating customer documentation, and contributing to process improvement. You will be engaging with our external clients by responding to general data inquiries, providing instructions on navigating the data and assisting in the implementation of the product. Once you become more familiar with the product and its capabilities, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with the team to identify and develop new or enhanced products and solutions for our customers. The team is small, so we are in search of candidates who are capable of effectively working in a group environment while equally comfortable working autonomously.   There will be ad hoc tasks and projects that may be assigned, so you must be flexible and able to adapt and assimilate new information quickly.  We are certain you will be happy with what you may accomplish here at Verisk.  We also encourage our employees to pursue education that will benefit them professionally.  If there’s a class or certificate that will benefit you on the job, we want to know about it.  We know a better you mean a better us, and your employment with us is a partnership. Qualifications Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel (e.g. pivot tables, vlookups, etc.), is required Experience collecting, analyzing, and cleansing data Strong attention to detail Excellent problem solving and reasoning skills Database management experience preferred Data analysis experience is a plus College degree or equivalent Customer focused with strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work effectively within tight deadlines Must be self-motivated and be able to work with minimal direction Property-casualty insurance experience, especially personal auto, is desirable Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The ISO Programs Operations department of Verisk Analytics is looking for an analyst verse in client solution implementation who is responsible for dealing with data; data management, data requirements, and data analysis. This contributes to our ability to support and assist with our external partner's reporting responsibilities and prepare data reviews, regulatory filings and compilations in a timely and accurate manner for submission to state insurance departments and ISO affiliates. You will have the opportunity to learn and apply insurance business knowledge and your technical skills in order to research and implement data capture mechanisms and strategies that will maximize usability of reported data for our products and services. As a member of the Strategic Data Acquisition unit, you will be involved with data mining, manipulation and the development of a new reporting system. You will have close interactions with stakeholders (internal and external) on data reporting requirements, and other data management activities. You will be involved in creating, building and improving processes and procedures to support different strategic plans. Responsibilities Create, modify and execute programs to extract, transform and summarize data, as input to derive analyses and reports. Support strategic initiatives associated to cloud computing, by helping to migrate code, data and processes, and reconciling results against existing procedures. Contribute to our business processes and recommend improvements in data management, error identification, quality control, process automation, and analytic techniques. Partake in testing for a new data transformation reporting system and assist with ongoing maintenance, while working closely with our development team. Provide high quality support to client needs including data profiling, mapping and data lineage, data transformation and development, data quality analysis, and data and business inquiry resolutions. Collaborate with other divisions, integrating information from multiple sources along with independent analysis and research to prepare appropriate data capture mechanisms and support. Ability to prioritize business needs and make decisions while handling multiple projects. Use appropriate business language to develop clear and concise data reporting standards and instructions. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Arts or Science, with emphasis in computer science, communication, economics, data analytics, statistics or a related field. At least 1 year of relevant work experience, including data transformation or data mining experience using large and complex datasets. Background in property/casualty insurance; knowledge of ISO statistical plan reporting and/or other Statistical Agent plans is a plus; knowledge of ISO Underwriting and Rating Products is a plus. Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing, etc); experience with data blending tools (Alteryx, etc) is a plus. Have a good understanding of and experience with data manipulation, report generation and data validation procedures including coding of small to mid-size data transformations, cleansing and validation scripts. Working knowledge of any reporting or Business Intelligence tools a plus. Solid background in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel at minimum). Passion for problem solving with strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to work under time constraints and adjust plans in the face of changing priorities. Must be a self-starter, self-motivated, customer-service oriented and capable of working both independently and in a team environment. Continued desire and ability to learn. Professional insurance exams a plus; CPCU, IDMA, etc. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description As part of the team responsible for pricing strategy for Verisk’s foundational Core Insurance services, you will work closely with other organizational units, Product Management, Customer Engagement, and finance. The successful candidate will create and maintain tools and utilities using various analytic resources and multiple data sources. The ability to use and interpret these models to develop and present relevant information is key. Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing, etc); experience with data blending tools (Alteryx, etc) is a plus. Working knowledge of any reporting or Business Intelligence tools a plus. Solid background in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc). Passion for problem solving with strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to work under time constraints and adjust plans in the face of changing priorities. Must be a self-starter, self-motivated, customer-service oriented and capable of working both independently and in a cross-functional team environment. Continued desire and ability to learn. Insurance association membership and/or certification exams a plus; CPCU, IDMA, etc. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The ISO Programs Operations department of Verisk Analytics is looking for an analyst verse in client solution implementation who is responsible for dealing with data; data management, data requirements, and data analysis. This contributes to our ability to support and assist our external clients’ reporting responsibilities and prepare data reviews, regulatory submissions and compilations in a timely and accurate manner for submission to state insurance departments and ISO affiliates. You will have the opportunity to apply your insurance business knowledge and your technical skills in order to research and implement data capture mechanisms and strategies that will maximize usability of reported data for our products and services. As a member of the team you will be involved with data mining, manipulation and the development of a new reporting system. You will collaborate with stakeholders (internal and external) on data reporting requirements, and other data management activities. You will be involved in creating, building and improving processes and procedures to gather client information and support different strategic plans. Create, modify and execute programs to extract, transform and summarize data, as input to derive analyses and reports. Support strategic initiatives associated to cloud computing, by helping to migrate code, data and processes, and reconciling results against existing procedures. Contribute to our business processes and recommend improvements in data management, error identification, quality control, process automation, and analytic techniques. Partake in testing for a new data transformation reporting system and assist with ongoing maintenance, while working closely with our development team. Provide high quality support to client needs including data profiling, mapping and data lineage, data transformation and development, data quality analysis, and data and business inquiry resolutions. Collaborate with other divisions, integrating information from multiple sources along with independent analysis and research to prepare appropriate data capture mechanisms and support. Ability to prioritize business needs and make decisions while handling multiple projects. Use appropriate business language to develop clear and concise data reporting standards and instructions. Our Ideal Candidate Has Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. 4-8 plus years’ experience in insurance data system integration and modernization projects, with a strong focus on process optimization, data quality enhancement and successful data delivery. Knowledge of insurance data operations, regulatory compliance and information management Knowledge of insurance data and analytic technique. Experience in consultative engagements with client business and technology stakeholders Good understanding and experience with data transformation or data mining using large and complex datasets, data manipulation, report generation and data validation procedures including coding of small to mid-size data transformations, cleansing and validation scripts. Background in property/casualty insurance; knowledge of ISO statistical plan reporting and/or other Statistical Agent plans (TICO, CAR, etc) is strongly desired; knowledge of ISO Underwriting and Rating Products is a plus. Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing, etc); experience with data blending tools (Alteryx, etc) is a plus. Working knowledge of any reporting or Business Intelligence tools a plus. Solid background in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc). Passion for problem solving with strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to work under time constraints and adjust plans in the face of changing priorities. Must be a self-starter, self-motivated, customer-service oriented and capable of working both independently and in a cross-functional team environment. Continued desire and ability to learn. Insurance association membership and/or certification exams a plus; CPCU, IDMA, etc. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for working with the product teams and development teams to develop and continuously improve the data analytics business intelligence tools provided to our customers. The successful candidate will have experience in data analytics and developing dashboards using a variety of business intelligence tools to design and maintain external facing reporting tools. At times the role may include gathering and analysis of the business requirements and translating them into meaningful specifications. You will also be tasked with research and analysis of customer data. The ideal candidate would be able to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy and efficiency while communicating the information proficiently across different organizational levels. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will design and create visualizations and analytics that meet customer specifications. You will access source data in Microsoft SQL Server environment and play a key role in data modeling and evaluating data integrity You will Maintain and improve existing reporting solutions and data sources, identifying source data issues and concerns and working with appropriate personnel to address these issues. You will perform data analysis and research. You must possess ability to think logically and process information with a high level of detail, accuracy, and efficiency. You will Interact with all levels of internal users to gain understanding and translate business requirements into sustainable and efficient visualizations You will communicate testing progress and results, and other relevant information to project stakeholders and management. You may create documentation for training purposes, and support client training initiatives Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Proficiency in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Spotfire. The ideal candidate will have experience in EDI claims compliance reporting and a good understanding of the FROI/SROI transactional data and the corresponding compliance reporting outputs. Proficiency in SQL Knowledge of dimensional modeling preferred. 1-2 years of experience in Dashboard Development and/or Development preferred. Data processing experience preferred Excellent troubleshooting ability required Proficiency in Microsoft Office Experience/knowledge of exploratory data analysis techniques. Strong data analysis, data verification, and problem-solving skills Able to "time-box" and balance multiple responsibilities concurrently with efficiency. Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Accountable for leading application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting web content solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 8+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: C#, ASP.Net MVC, WebAPI, AngularJS, NUnit and Moq, LINQ, NHibernate or Entity Framework, Spring.Net, Continuous Integration, JQuery, CSS, AJAX Highly experienced at leading teams, interacting with business partners or customers, and guiding project direction. Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused most important features. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Leadership and ability to guide design and technical meetings Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Description Come be part of something new and exciting at a well-established analytical company. Help build scalable solutions for an industry leading catastrophe modeling company. At Verisk Analytics – Extreme Event Solution, you will be part of a team of full-stack developers taking on new initiatives which will solve complex problems using state-of-the-art technology. Create a positive and lasting impact on the business while building an exciting career full of meaningful work. You will find the support, coaching, and training you need to excel at your role. Our culture of innovation means your ideas will be heard! We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated engineer to join us in developing complex analytical software for catastrophe risk management. Your team will be responsible for all stages of the development process, from reviewing requirements, to design, development, testing and deployment. We are looking for a candidate who can learn new knowledge quickly, pick up new technologies faster, apply their newly acquired skills, and adapt to evolving requirements. Expectations Expertise in object-oriented programming languages (C#, or C++) Excellent level at object-oriented design Experience in design and develop Microsoft SQL server database schemas, store procs Familiar with Ux Knowledge of test automation Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) Understanding of DevOps activities Positive attitude with eagerness to learn new technologies Creative and innovative problem solver of highly complex issues Work well under pressure in an ever-fluctuating environment Communicate clearly and effectively with internal and external stakeholders Qualifications BS or MS in computer science or equivalent Minimum 5 years of work experience in developing commercial software product Nice To Have Strong math or analytical background Experience with object-relational mapping solutions (Hibernate, EntityFramework) Experience with Microsoft WPF Experience working in an agile environment Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description You will join a specialized team focused on development of the EES catastrophe modeling analytics underlying EES products and services. In this position, you will contribute to AIR’s next generation modeling framework with emphasis on high performance and scalability. You will extend your knowledge of modern C++ and software design best practices contributing to a central component of a larger software suite. You will expand your skillset by adding knowledge of architecting and developing critical cloud-based applications. We look for people with passion for achievements, integrity, and the desire to make things happen. Responsibilities Contribute to development of cloud-based analytical framework, algorithms, and tooling Proactively contribute to software performance optimizations Proactively contribute improvements to code quality, robustness, and development processes Enhance functional capabilities of the existing system Investigate and resolve customer inquiries and software defects Qualifications Minimum 3 years in commercial-grade software development, specializing in backend business logic, frameworks, scalability, and performance aspects of the system Minimum 3 years developing Windows/Linux applications using C++ Strong knowledge of design patterns Strong analytical and communication skills Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced team-oriented environment Database platform knowledge (SQL/NoSQL databases) Knowledge of code analysis and performance-tuning tools Preferred Skills Parallel Computing experience (TPL, MPI, TBB, OpenMP) Experience in development of serverless cloud applications Knowledge of cloud design patterns GPGPU Programming – OpenCL/CUDA Background in math, high-performance distributed and parallel computing, game development Familiarity with Python, R, Powershell and developing Windows/Linux applications using C#, or Java Education And Training BS or higher in CS preferred and 3 plus years of relevant experience Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Can you lead the business discussions and demonstrate value proposition to clients about building and using catastrophe models? Be part of the team that can leverage your experience to address growing needs of our client base. As Product Manager of models within our Product Management team, you will be responsible to develop and drive the scope, execution and launch of one or more models. You will bring a customer focus to the complex process of building and releasing catastrophe models. Be a leader and drive the coordination of the release and acceptance of the model with large cross functional groups. Engage clients and consistently bring client focus to a process that is multi-year in nature. Work with key stakeholders to manage the goals, scope and launch of the model Work with diverse teams composed of some of the brightest minds in the industry The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in the insurance or risk management industry with a strong weather or geoscience and technology related background, a blend of business and techno-functional skills, and the ability to define a vision and make it a reality. You Will About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role Drive the model development process from beginning to end, starting with project definition and scope all the way to software release; create and maintain project scope, requirements and schedules; provide progress updates to stakeholders; review and provide feedback on testing strategies Engage with external clients regularly to understand the overall business value, gather requirements, feedback and detailed use cases Coordinate across multiple internal teams, including Product Management, QA, Software, Business Development, Client Services and Research Represent AIR as a domain expert in various internal and external venues Maintain and support models between updates; respond to internal and external client questions and issues Manage off cycle software releases as necessary Qualifications 5+ years insurance industry experience 3+ years working with CAT modeling products Demonstrated ability in managing long term complex projects that include cross functional teams to successful completion Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously Excellent presentation skills, including the ability to articulate complex topics in a concise and easily understandable way Direct Product Management experience including Agile practices, preferred BS Degree in science, technical or related field (Master’s degree a plus) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description We are seeking a Claims Analyst for our Allocation Solutions Department. In this role you will be responsible for file intake and set up of all Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) products, full review, analysis and response to submission requests and development letters, information and documentation follow-up, and client communication. The Claims Analyst role is heavily client facing and each Claims Analyst is responsible for successful communication, timely responses and providing overall excellent customer service. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Intake incoming referrals into claims system, including initial follow-up for incomplete referrals for missing information Comprehensive review, analysis and response to CMS submission requests, development letters and all other communication received from CMS and/or their contractors Serve as primary point of contact for assigned clients Communicate effectively, timely and comprehensively. Communication includes, but is not limited to, internal emails, client inquiries, case status requests, case updates and general subject matter questions Qualifications Detail oriented, organized, and quality focused Advanced customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional environment Flexible and adaptable 1-2 years’ experience Associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. About The Role Job Description We are seeking a Claims Analyst for our Allocation Solutions Department. In this role you will be responsible for file intake and set up of all Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) products, full review, analysis and response to submission requests and development letters, information and documentation follow-up, and client communication. The Claims Analyst role is heavily client facing and each Claims Analyst is responsible for successful communication, timely responses and providing overall excellent customer service. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Intake incoming referrals into claims system, including initial follow-up for incomplete referrals for missing information Comprehensive review, analysis and response to CMS submission requests, development letters and all other communication received from CMS and/or their contractors Serve as primary point of contact for assigned clients Communicate effectively, timely and comprehensively. Communication includes, but is not limited to, internal emails, client inquiries, case status requests, case updates and general subject matter questions Qualifications Detail oriented, organized, and quality focused Advanced customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional environment Flexible and adaptable 1-2 years’ experience Associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description We are seeking a Claims Analyst for our Lien Services Team. The Claims Analyst on the Lien Services team is responsible for file intake and set up of Medicare Conditional Payment referrals, full review, analysis and dispute of Conditional Payment documents issued by Medicare and communicating with Medicare’s recovery contractors for case status. The Claims Analyst role is client facing and each Claims Analyst is responsible for successful communication, timely responses and providing overall excellent customer service. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Intake incoming referrals into claims system, including follow-up of incomplete referrals for missing information Comprehensive review, analysis and dispute of assigned Conditional Payment documents Serve as primary point of contact for assigned clients. Communication includes, but is not limited to, client inquiries, case status requests, case updates and general subject matter questions. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role 0-2 years’ experience Associate’s or bachelor’s degree Detail oriented, organized, and quality focused Advanced customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional environment Flexible and adaptable Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description The Consultant, Client Success (P&C Data Management Solutions) role will act as a consultant between Verisk and our clients and provide professional client services and support. You will drive collaborative and consultative support through all phases of the client engagement cycle. Key activities include helping to drive pipeline, sales and client engagement strategy; collaborating with teams of subject matter experts and stakeholders; and developing and refining processes to gather client information on current state operations and results. You will consult on best practices which address client needs by integrating and operationalizing Verisk data management and statistical data reporting solutions. You will serve as a conduit between clients and internal partners such as Product and Sales Leadership, Data Management Operations and IT Development. Responsibilities & Essential Duties About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role Consultative Support – acting as a business subject matter expert - through all phases of the sales cycle, gathering client information on current state operations and results Provide recommendations for future state best practices operationalizing Verisk solutions The candidate will collaborate and drive engagement strategy, presales messaging and approach, and provide impactful product demonstrations for potential clients in client sales meetings, at trade shows, and for executive presentations related to solution value Develop a meticulous understanding of Verisk-ISO solutions and services The successful candidate will continuously monitor and evaluate existing client needs while working closely with the Product Management and Sales teams for successful client implementations and client account stewardship This position plays a key role in gathering suggested product enhancements from clients for feedback for the Product Owners and Developers In collaboration with Sales, the role will be responsible for assembling key information and delivering high-level executive presentations to align solution opportunities with client organizational goals Provide support in the construction of contracts and work agreements Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned Regular travel required approximately 15-20% Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Required Skills Leadership or comparable experience in a similar industry focused on data management and analytics Proven experience implementing data management and reporting solutions at scale, and knowledge of the insurance data lifecyle Experience in consultative engagements with client business and technology stakeholders Proven ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams Demonstrated effectiveness and strong communication skills, both written and oral Superior public speaking and presentation skills in both sales support and training environments. Ability and experience with tailoring messages to all levels of the organization from individual contributors to executives Provide extraordinary client support with a passionate commitment Excellent computer skills, especially with MS Windows and Office. Excel and PowerPoint skills required Encouraged Skills Business consulting experience Significant P&C insurance industry experience Experience with data management and ISO statistical reporting implementation projects is highly desirable Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing) preferred but not essential Product Development experience preferred but not essential Knowledge of ISO Underwriting and Rating Products is a plus Insurance association memberships and/or certifications a plus (for example: AIDA, CPCU, IDMA) Minimal Education And Training Requirements 4-year college degree or equivalent experience Eight plus years’ experience in insurance data system integration and modernization projects, with a strong focus on process optimization, data quality enhancement and successful data delivery Knowledge of insurance data operations, regulatory compliance and information management Knowledge of insurance data and analytic technique Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Job Description The Verisk Cloud FinOps team is look for a Cloud FinOps - Sr. Engineer to support and augment its mature Cloud FinOps service. Position is responsible for support and admin of RedShift, PowerBI, and Athena which house our cost transparency data, as well as presenting cloud spend and cloud cost optimization recommendations. Looking for a collaborative team member that is able to educate and learn in both finance and cloud. Key Responsibilities Analyze cloud costs across the Verisk Enterprise and recommend ways to optimize spend Strong problem solving skills used to identify cost savings where there are complex trade-offs Expose cloud cost transparency in new ways Strong communication and leadership skills used to effectively present opportunities for cost optimization Ability to prioritize recommendations that make the biggest financial impact Leverage PowerBI and write Athena SQL to prepare ad-hoc analysis of the AWS Cost and Usage Report (CUR) Support Redshift node Present cloud finances to business unit leadership regularly Interpret Densify rightsizing recommendations and support Densify project Implement Densify rightsizing as part of the CI/CD pipeline Purchase Savings Plans and Reserved Instances as warranted after collaboration with Business Units Drive change in DevOps habits to consider cost as a dimension of application architecture design Growth Opportunity Position offers a unique opportunity to grow in technology, finance, leadership, and in building customer relationships. Position is on a mature Cloud FinOps team that drives change across all business lines at Verisk. Location: Position is based in Jersey City, NJ and leverages a hybrid model of required in-office time (currently 2 days in-office weekly but subject to change) and WFH Qualifications Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Strong oral and written communication skills required AWS Cloud Certification preferred FinOps Certification a plus Redshift, PowerBI and Athena SQL skills required Interest in growth in the Cloud FinOps space a must https://www.finops.org/introduction/what-is-finops/ #Hybrid Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Job Description Come join Verisk's corporate Compensation team to work on the development and maintenance of Verisk's compensation structure. Partner with the team of HR Business Partners on ongoing compensation needs for the organization. The role reports in to our Jersey City, NJ office. Verisk offers a hybrid work environment with in-office work 2 days/week. Open to fully remote in other US locations. Compensation Planning Process Support the annual compensation planning process (merit salary increases, promotions, bonuses, and long-term incentive awards) Maintain the bonus and long-term incentive target data in the HRIS Scrub, consolidate, and create (via advanced formulas) data for the planning tool Maintain data accuracy during significant data manipulations and transfers Draft proposed salary budgets and proposed salary ranges, and other reports Market Intelligence Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of market trends to maintain the competitiveness of employee pay and Verisk pay practices via compensation surveys, collaborating with the HR Business Partners, managers, and the corresponding consulting firms Draft response to ad hoc market pricing requests Maintain and use licensed compensation management system Review requests for new or revised classifications to determine appropriate salary grade assignment Data Management and Analytics Perform special studies, cost and impact analyses, and recommendations on subjects such as incentive compensation, bonus plans, sales compensation or equity awards Collaborate with Finance, HRIS, HR Analytics & Reporting, and HR Operations colleagues regarding compensation data, workflows, projects, and processes Employ effective and thorough self/cross checking of work before submission. Management & Administration Consult to HR Business Partners and managers on compensation questions and activities Support the spot award program Assist in merger and acquisition compensation related activities Monitor compensation management trends and regulatory developments Respond to challenging requests made by phone or in video or in person Propose solutions to complex problems or problems where precedent may not exist Participate in compensation program education and training activities Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent experience 3-4 years’ experience in compensation management and administration Strong Microsoft Excel and Strong PowerPoint skills Database experience a plus Strong analytical, problem solving, interpersonal, communication, organization, and prioritization skills Math and detail oriented Comfortable working both independently and collaboratively Experience with HRIS (e.g., PeopleSoft) a plus Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. jobTitle: Compliance and Product Services Senior Analyst
jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description As a Compliance & Product Services team member you will participate in the technical development of new and revised insurance programs in response to the changing business environment for various lines of business. Your focus will be on customer satisfaction, product quality, relevance and timeliness. To Accomplish These Goals, You Will Need To Draft policy language and develop manual rules that guide insurers in issuing and rating policies, and also develop related information, including filings and announcements to customers.  Review laws, regulations and case law for impact on ISO products and insurer procedures. Develop policy language and rules for major program updates that provide valuable insurance enhancements to products used by the entire insurance industry. Review state laws and requirements and make revisions to ensure program updates are compliant and relevant in each state. Leverage insurance expertise and researching skills to provide timely, thoughtful responses to insurer inquires over a wide range of insurance topics. Develop and present items to panels of insurers on emerging trends and potential revisions. Collaborate with all stakeholders including Product Development, Law Department, Government Relations, Actuarial, etc., inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Work in conjunction with the Product Development team to research and review new products, consider impact on other products, and collaborate with others in bringing products to market. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. At least two years of P&C insurance experience with product development, claims, underwriting, and/or filing filings with insurance regulators. Experience involving analyzing and developing forms, rules, and/or rating preferred.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail. Strong organization, research, and analytic skills. Ability to both work independently and collaborate in a team environment. Knowledge of ISO commercial liability/casualty insurance line procedures is a plus.  CPCU or RPLU exam study or completion is a plus. Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. Job Description Our Verisk Strategic Alliances business is thriving! We are seeking an experienced and professional Contract Administrator to monitor and build business with Software/ Technology/ Consulting vendors in the P&C markets and manage licensing and contracts with other consultants. You'll work to protect our intellectual property, maximize opportunity for revenue, and enhance products and services for our customers. This non-commission role benefits from broad exposure to various departments, product and services and personnel. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Assist in managing the administration of licensing Processes with 3rd party vendors and consulting companies working with Verisk customers Manage amendments to licenses when working with 3rd party vendors Draft and negotiate licensing contracts as necessary Work with various levels of management and departments including: Law Department, Business and Product areas, Customer Service, Sales, Finance, Accounting Manage and increase strategic integrations of ISO products with technology vendors and track results and revenue to Verisk as a result of these efforts Monitor and resolve intellectual property compliance issues on the internet, marketing materials and various media Support and/or manage other compliance functions related to vendor licensing Maintain positive relationships and help to ensure the satisfaction of existing client vendors for the purpose of maintaining or growing their revenue base with ISO/Verisk Assists Relationship Managers and Team in executing on its goals exhibiting a strong team orientation Assist the VSA Team is other areas including: Participate in the research, design and implementation of new products and services that meet customer needs Research market and industry trends Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role College degree and 5+ years’ work experience Law degree preferred Sales/marketing experience necessary, preferably with solutions and services to policy administration, software, technology and consulting vendors servicing property and casualty insurers Experience with licenses, contracts and negotiations Familiarity with ISO forms, loss costs, rules and/or Underwiring products strongly preferred Familiarity with internal audit and/or intellectual property issues process desired Experience in compliance with process and procedures Strong communication, interpersonal, negotiation, organizational, research and analytical skills. Must have demonstrated ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with internal and external customers including handling difficult and complex customer issues and related projects. Must be able to perform essential job duties with or without reasonable accommodation. We offer an excellent compensation package. Our benefits package is competitive and includes full healthcare options, a 401(k) plan, and generous paid time off program. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Our Verisk Strategic Alliances business is thriving! We are seeking an experienced and professional Contract Analyst to monitor and build business with Software/ Technology/ Consulting vendors in the P&C markets and manage licensing and contracts with other consultants. You'll work to protect our intellectual property, maximize opportunity for revenue, and enhance products and services for our customers. This non-commission role benefits from broad exposure to various departments, product and services and personnel. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Assist in managing the administration of licensing Processes with 3rd party vendors and consulting companies working with Verisk customers Manage amendments to licenses when working with 3rd party vendors Draft and negotiate licensing contracts as necessary Work with various levels of management and departments including: Law Department, Business and Product areas, Customer Service, Sales, Finance, Accounting Manage and increase strategic integrations of ISO products with technology vendors and track results and revenue to Verisk as a result of these efforts Monitor and resolve intellectual property compliance issues on the internet, marketing materials and various media Support and/or manage other compliance functions related to vendor licensing Maintain positive relationships and help to ensure the satisfaction of existing client vendors for the purpose of maintaining or growing their revenue base with ISO/Verisk Assists Relationship Managers and Team in executing on its goals exhibiting a strong team orientation Assist the VSA Team is other areas including: Participate in the research, design and implementation of new products and services that meet customer needs Research market and industry trends Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role College degree and 5+ years’ work experience Law degree preferred Sales/marketing experience necessary, preferably with solutions and services to policy administration, software, technology and consulting vendors servicing property and casualty insurers Experience with licenses, contracts and negotiations Familiarity with ISO forms, loss costs, rules and/or Underwiring products strongly preferred Familiarity with internal audit and/or intellectual property issues process desired Experience in compliance with process and procedures Strong communication, interpersonal, negotiation, organizational, research and analytical skills. Must have demonstrated ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with internal and external customers including handling difficult and complex customer issues and related projects. Must be able to perform essential job duties with or without reasonable accommodation. We offer an excellent compensation package. Our benefits package is competitive and includes full healthcare options, a 401(k) plan, and generous paid time off program.
