Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description The Lien Services Coordinator is responsible for processing incoming mail, conditional payment reporting, outreach for Proof of Representation documents, Medicare Advantage Plan (“MAPS”) Affidavit and HIPAA release, and outreach to MAPS, Part D, Medicaid programs and Medicare contractors. This coordinator role is not outwardly client facing at this time but will work closely with outside vendors and internal staff. Each coordinator is responsible for successful communication, timely responses and providing overall excellent service. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Process incoming mail, distribute/upload as directed. Routine follow-up on Letters of Authority and/or Proof of Representation documents. Routine follow-up on MAPS Affidavit and HIPAA release. Outreach to MAPS Part D, Medicaid Programs to obtain lien letter for possible dispute or payment. Conditional payment reporting. Conditional payment follow up with Medicare contractors. Responsible for sending out assigned CP $0 letters. Responsible for obtaining final demand and/or case resolved letter and follow up with the Medicare contractors. Retrieve documents as directed from external systems. Assist with referral set-up in database, as needed. Assist attorneys and staff as needed. Qualifications Detail-oriented, organized, and quality focused Customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional, team-focused environment Flexible and adaptable 0-2 years’ experience Associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description The paralegal on the Lien Services team is responsible for file intake and set up of all conditional payment, Medicare Advantage Plan, Part D, and Medicaid referrals, full review, analysis, and dispute of liens, communication with Medicare recovery contractors and Medicare Advantage Plans. The paralegal role is client facing and each paralegal is responsible for successful communication, timely responses and providing overall excellent customer service. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Intake of incoming referrals into claims system, including follow-up of incomplete referrals for missing information Comprehensive review, analysis, and dispute of assigned conditional payment, Medicare Advantage, Part D, Medicaid letters Responsible for client specific services such as, but not limited to, CP Audit and Rush Query Process Assist as needed with obtaining final demands, case resolved letters and follow-ups with the Medicare contractors Serve as primary point of contact for assigned clients Communicate effectively, timely and comprehensively. Communication includes, but is not limited to, internal emails, client inquiries, case status requests, case updates and general subject matter questions Assist attorneys, staff and account management as requested Qualifications Detail oriented, organized, and quality focused Advanced customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional environment Flexible and adaptable 0-2 years’ experience Associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Are you an insurance professional looking to make a real impact on the industry?  Do you feel limited with your growth opportunities in your current role?  Are you looking for a chance to take your career to the next level with a highly innovative organization?  Then you should consider coming to work with Verisk Analytics!  We were recently named Forbes Magazine’s #1 Innovative Research & Consulting Services Company in the World (#18 of all companies) and have a great opportunity for an ambitious, passionate insurance expert. We are looking for an experienced Insurance Product Development expert to develop innovative enhancements to ISO's management liability & professional liability insurance programs. As a product development team member you will conceptually and technically develop new and revised insurance programs in response to the changing business environment. We will look to you for strategic thought leadership on the D&O, EPL, Fiduciary Liability, Crime and Financial Institutions markets, as well as professional liability insurance markets, using your understanding of coverages, markets, industries, legal and regulatory trends, our customers, and our competitors to gauge impacts on our insurance programs, provide actionable insights, and create new products and product enhancements. The better we know our customers, the better we can serve them.  Customer focus will guide all aspects of your work. You will engage with customers and respond to their feedback with key developments, and develop products that anticipate their needs.  This includes participating in panels and other customer forums, representing the products to customers, meeting with them individually and being a key customer resource. You may also represent us at industry conferences and with professional organizations, including preparing and giving presentations and authoring or co-authoring white papers or articles. As part of a small staff of line-of-business experts you will collaborate with all stakeholders. This means inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. CPCU or RPLU preferred. Minimum five to seven years underwriting or product development experience with in-depth knowledge of Directors and Officers, Employment-related Practices, Fiduciary Liability, Commercial Crime and Financial Institutions lines of business.  Professional Liability and/or Cyber experience also a plus. Development or analysis of policy forms required. Proven research and analytical skills.  Pro-active problem solver. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Experience building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on gaining actionable insights and forming collaborative partnerships with the goal of innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Some travel may be required (up to 15%) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!  At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.    Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.   But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.   It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.    At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.  At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career.  We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce.  Job Description ISO’s Community Hazard Mitigation Division implemented the National Flood Insurance Program’s (NFIP) Community Rating System (CRS), a voluntary incentive program that assesses a community’s ability to mitigate flood damage. ISO continues to work with the CRS to encourage community floodplain-management activities that exceed minimum NFIP requirements. Its Three Main Goals Are To reduce flood losses facilitate accurate insurance ratings promote the awareness of flood insurance CRS activities fall into four categories: public information — advising people about flood hazards and how to reduce flood damage mapping and regulations — increasing protections for new development with various programs flood damage reduction — reducing the flood risk to existing development flood preparedness — implementing flood warnings and dam safety programs. Due to the continued growth of the Community Rating System (CRS) program, we currently have a need for a Flood Program Field Representative (CRS Specialist) to cover Baltimore, MD and surrounding states. The CRS program is a voluntary incentive program that recognizes and encourages community floodplain management activities that exceed the minimum requirements of the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP). If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and enjoy working in the field and meeting people, then this position is for you. The primary responsibilities involve visiting communities to collect flood information, preparing reports in accordance with established standards, and representing ISO at meeting involving community officials. Qualifications We are looking for individuals who possess some of the following knowledge and skills, and/or experience: Experience with the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP), floodplain management (i.e. through community planning). College degree in business, engineering or similar discipline preferred and/or proven experience in flood plain mitigation. Excellent customer service, strong math, and verbal/written communication skills are required. A strong knowledge of Microsoft Windows is required. Must be self-motivated, detail oriented, possess a strong work ethic and able to demonstrate the ability to work independently. Certified Floodplain Manager (CFM) certification is desirable. This position requires a valid driver’s license and some overnight travel, and you will work from your home office to complete all work assignments. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice

Job Description Managing customer requests in a prompt, professional, accurate, and thorough manner. Providing meaningful responses to assigned requests within established Service Level Agreement (SLA) time frames. Collaborating to progress customer issues and escalating promptly when knowledge is exhausted, or handover is required. Maintaining complete and accurate documentation of customer issues and investigative findings with regular updates containing current statuses. Resolving issues, while displaying a sense of urgency and professionalism. Providing technical support for internal and external customers of VMS. Delivering QA testing in partnership with Product Management & Product Development on new solutions, features, and system updates. Configuring batch templates and process batch files submitted by customers, returning results within SLA timeframes. Building and preserving relationships with other internal teams, such as Customer Success. Developing and maintaining adequate technical and product knowledge of our products and internal systems Leading and/or participating in appropriate meetings with customers and internal stakeholders. Working as a member of a cohesive team to resolve complex issues but also being able to work independently. Qualifications 2-4 years of experience in a customer facing support role is a must A baseline understanding of APIs and specifically POST/GET methodologies Familiarity with JavaScript, HTML/CSS, SQL (programming skills not required) Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively organize, prioritize, multi-task, and time manage workload. Must be able to handle multiple projects at once with a strong attention to detail. Must be able to work confidently and independently; escalating issues and decisions when appropriate. Inquisitive problem solver through deep dive investigations into technical issues. Nice To Have Experience supporting DaaS products and solutions. Salesforce Sales and/or Service cloud use Experience with managing and analyzing data sets using BI tools, SQL and ETL processing. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Job Description About the Team: The work environment is fast paced, fun, and collaborative. We value and recognize excellent work, and encourage innovative and creative thinking, yet also emphasize the importance of work/life balance. Our team is comprised of professionals from diverse backgrounds with a range of degrees and past work experience.  About The Job Audit building permit data: Verify that data meets specific quality requirements. Utilize knowledge of MySQL and databases to identify errors in the source data or in processing. Normalize building permit data: Receive data in a variety of different formats and use internal applications to clean and normalize data. Use regular expressions to manipulate poorly formatted data. Ensure that data is consistent across the board. Communicate with team members: When data does not meet requirements, make clear recommendations on what needs to be fixed. Communicate efficiently to relay findings to co-workers. A mindset of continuous improvement: Identify steps in the process that could be improved. Share ideas with team members and management in an ongoing effort to optimize our team’s performance. Qualifications The qualified candidate will have both the attitude and the experience to successfully fill this role, including:  Detail oriented: The successful Data Analyst audits large quantities of data and identifies potential issues. Technically skilled: This person has a working knowledge of relational databases. They are comfortable in MySQL and able to pick up new concepts quickly. *Preferred but not required. Collaborator: The Data Analyst works well in a team environment. They lean on fellow employees and internal resources to assist them with their duties. Accountable: This person takes responsibility for each task that they work on. They are invested in the data and claim responsibility for the outcome. Adept Communicator: Comfortable communicating with both technical and non-technical team members and keeps clear and concise notes. Committed to quality with a strong desire to meet and exceed expectations through attention to detail, technical knowledge, and willingness to trouble shoot and support the other team members. Comfortable in a hard-working, fast paced, team environment with the ability to have fun and get the job done. Experience And Skills The candidate should possess a well-rounded background, which may have been acquired through prior job experience, coursework, or personal projects, with as many of the specific qualifications as possible:  Experience working with several different types of file formats. Experience working as part of a strong team. Experience with relational databases is preferred but not required. Experience using regular expressions to manipulate data is a plus. Great problem-solving skills. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Data Warehouse Dimensional Modeler is a mid-to-senior level position that will provide data pipeline expertise and business intelligence leadership to guide the development and implementation of data products and reporting solutions within the Verisk Claims Solutions division. The successful candidate has experience developing data pipelines using cloud services and designing data structures that support data products and reporting systems. In this hands-on role, he/she will be responsible for collaborating with product owners, tackling technical problems, helping define best practices, and contributing in design/code reviews. In addition, the candidate will help create innovative solutions to satisfy the growing needs of internal and external customers. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Data Table Design – Design, review, and build Kimball data models for data products and business intelligence reporting systems like Power BI and ThoughtSpot. Pipeline Development - Design and develop data pipelines using AWS services like Glue, Step Functions, Lambda, SNS, SQS and S3 in conjunction with computing platforms like Snowflake and Databricks. Collaboration – Work closely with product owners to understand and refine new feature requests. Work closely with data engineering team to design, review, and develop new data pipelines. Communication - Ability to communicate technical ideas in terms product owners and non-technical users can understand. Best Practice - Ensure standard practices are followed for logging, monitoring, alerting and data security. Data Security – Understand Verisk data security policies and controls and design and implement ways to comply with the policies. Qualifications BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. 3+ years of Data Modeling experience (Tableau, Power BI, ThoughtSpot, Kimball). 1+ years of experience designing and developing cloud data pipelines (ETL/ELT solutions). 3+ years of Data Warehousing experience. Experience using Python for automating processes, working with APIs, and/or transforming data. Experience building data pipelines using a variety of data sources (RDBMs, NoSQL, REST API’s, AWS SQS, and files). Experience working with Snowflake (or equivalent). Experience working with tokenized PII is a plus. Working knowledge of development standards/best practices with the ability to follow established design patterns. Proficiency with version control systems (GIT) Proficiency with database modeling tools (SqlDBM, etc.) Insurance industry experience is a plus. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2012, 2016, & 2017 Experience with AWS and Aurora-Postgres. Experience in data base design for data integrity, performance and capacity. Knowledge of the SQL language and its capabilities. Ability to analyze SQL and provide recommendations (performance tuning, tables, views, triggers, indexes, constraints, etc.) and best practices. Experience in application (e.g., timeouts, deadlocks, etc.) and server troubleshooting. Advanced knowledge of SQL Server components and tools (Extended Events, etc.) Ability to automate routine processes with Powershell. Experience with installation, configuration, support, and tuning of different complex Microsoft SQL Server installations and setups (Availability Groups, Multi-site Availability Groups, Failover Clusters Instances, etc.) Strong understanding of monitoring: interpretation, actions to take, implementations and administration Past experience in Incident Management and good understanding of SOX compliance Good communication skills Ability to collaborate in a team Ability to take initiative instead of waiting for work to be assigned. Active participation in discussions and ability to have and state opinions. Ability and eagerness to learn and to pick-up other Relational and NoSQL Database Technologies Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field. 3+ years of experience with creating, administering, monitoring and maintaining of multiple relational data bases such as Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, AWS Aurora, etc. Familiarity with working on the AWS Cloud platform with RDS SQL Server and Aurora-Postgres and with EC2 instances and related features. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Develop and maintain applications using .NET technologies, Angular, AWS services and MS SQL. Design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software applications for customers. Analyze code to determine causes of errors and revise programs as needed. Suggests innovative solutions to business problems/processes that leverage technology to provide improvements and better user experiences. Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications. Follow all organizational standards and methodologies. Participate in Agile development process. Interact and communicate effectively with all levels of staff, senior management, and customers. Participate in software design meetings and analyze user needs to determine technical requirements. Perform code deployment, troubleshooting issues and other server deployment processes that may involve after hours and weekends. Qualifications Proficient knowledge in .NET framework, .NET core, Angular and Web API. Proficient in C# with a good knowledge of its ecosystems. Preferred knowledge of MS SQL Server including stored procedures and working with large relational databases. Good understanding of core AWS services, uses, and basic AWS architecture best practices. Knowledge in AWS services such as EC2, Lambda, SQS, SNS, S3, ECS, etc. is a plus. Strong understanding of object-oriented programming. Familiar with various design and architectural patterns. Experience with popular web application frameworks. Experience in developing applications in cloud using serverless technologies. Knack for writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code. Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git. Preferred experience in CI/CD pipeline using Octopus and Bamboo. Knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle. Knowledge of web architecture and application servers. Knowledge of data and technical database design. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Participate in design and technical meetings and provide technical consultation to internal business and design teams as needed. Demonstrated ability to produce design and technical specifications as needed for technical documentation. Willing to work after hours, weekends and be on the on-call schedule as required to complete production support tasks. Job Description Accountable for application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Work on new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Performs hands-on coding and assists in the architecting web content solutions. May serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Participate in design and technical meetings Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 3-5 years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Solid experience and understanding in the following technologies: Core C#, ASP.NET Web API, ASP.Net MVC, NUnit and Moq, LINQ, NHibernate or Entity Framework, Spring.Net, Continuous Integration, JQuery, CSS, AJAX Must have passion for development and latest technologies Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting web content solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 8+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: C#, ASP.Net MVC, WebAPI, AngularJS, NUnit and Moq, LINQ, NHibernate or Entity Framework, Spring.Net, Continuous Integration, JQuery, CSS, AJAX Highly experienced at leading teams, interacting with business partners or customers, and guiding project direction. Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused most important features. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Leadership and ability to guide design and technical meetings Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Description Accountable for leading application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting web content solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications 8+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: C#, ASP.Net MVC, WebAPI, AngularJS, NUnit and Moq, LINQ, NHibernate or Entity Framework, Spring.Net, Continuous Integration, JQuery, CSS, AJAX Highly experienced at leading teams, interacting with business partners or customers, and guiding project direction. Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused most important features. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Leadership and ability to guide design and technical meetings Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Become a member of EES's Technical Services Group. You will be responsible for contributing to our internal automation platform with new tools and automation in order to better support our internal and external customers as well as the business. Technical Implementations Duties and responsibilities are, but not limited to: This role requires a broad skillset/understanding of systems and networks; it is heavily focused on implementation of solutions in these areas using tools such as Ansible, Packer, Laravel, MongoDB and source control. You will be responsible for supporting all consumers of our automation on a day-to-day basis and additionally contributing to the improvement of existing tools, creating new tools, and extending our automation. Troubleshooting failed deployments in order to determine the root cause. Improve stability of deployments by implementing fixes to automation based on root cause in event of a failure. Identify areas of improvement including deployment time, approach to automation at certain stages, resource consumption, and additional tooling. Help to maintain and improve our golden images in multiple platforms. Researching and implementing new technologies relative to our automation platform and needs of the business. Support For Internal/External Clients Providing deployment and troubleshooting support for both internal and external client automation/deployments. Implementation of new features based on needs of internal/external clients. Qualifications Skills/Experience with tools such as Ansible, Packer, Laravel, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Vault, GIT, and VSCode. Knowledge and skills in Computer Systems and Networking - Server OS (Windows or Linux), TCP/IP Windows Environment (ie DHCP/DNS/Subnetting/Active Directory). Basic understanding of the OSI Model and the ability to conceptualize which layer(s) you are working in. Conceptual understanding and/or experience in as many of the following - VMWare vSphere (or Workstation) platform - VM, VM Templates, Network/Portgroups, Datastores/vSAN, Oversubscription AWS platform - AMI, EC2 Instance Tenancy/Type, EBS (gp2/gp3/io1/io2/etc), EBS Snapshots, Dedicated Hosts, S3, etc Basics of virtualization (Hypervisors (ESXI/AWS Nitro), Oversubscription, storage/deduplication) Ability to identify areas in need of automation or improved efficiency and assist in its implementation by using the tools and technologies described above. Good written communication skills Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Verisk is seeking a DevOps Engineer to help adhere to best practices in the cloud. In this role, you'll learn and apply knowledge of Cloud-specific technologies and services and be part of the team leading the design and implementation of Verisk’s Cloud Strategy. The Day-to-day Responsibilities Of This Role Include Deploying applications in an automated fashion by creating and managing CI/CD pipelines Developing and maintaining infrastructure as code Designing highly available and cost-effective architectures Monitoring, alerting, and supporting production environments to keep systems stable and running Providing off-hour support when needed to troubleshoot problems with mission-critical applications and take actions resulting from root cause analysis Engaging with multiple business units to prototype new ideas and new technologies and help create solutions to drive the next wave of innovation. Recommending solutions that align with the business needs and requirements Providing configuration recommendations and assistance Assisting in the development of detailed project specifications and implementation plans Contributing work to central cloud architecture team to benefit Verisk as a whole Qualifications Experience with building large-scale enterprise architecture solutions, including security concerns, high availability methods, multiple platforms, hardware considerations, network design, monitoring solutions, virtualization, performance, capacity planning, and information management practices Experience with AWS and cloud architecture Experience with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, New Relic, etc. Familiarity with splunk Experience with containers and tools such as docker and kubernetes Knowledge of development methodologies and experience with Python development Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code tools and methodologies, CloudFormation, CDK or Terraform Experience with CI/CD and configuration management tools and technologies, including Jenkins, Octopus, Chef, Ansible, etc. Creative and innovative approach to problem solving and passion for continuous improvement Experience with agile processes (Kanban / Scrum) including familiarity with JIRA BA or BS degree Amazon Certified SysOps Administrator or Solutions Architect, Associate or higher is a plus Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk Extreme Event Solutions (VEES, previously AIR Worldwide), a member of Verisk Analytics, is the scientific leader and most respected provider of risk modeling software and consulting services. VEES founded the catastrophe modeling industry in 1987 and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, terrorism, and pandemic outbreaks in 90 countries. VEES offers the opportunity to work with advanced technologies, global clients, and hundreds of the most innovative, talented minds in the industry. This earthquke engineer resaerch poistion is responsible for developing and supporting the damage estimation component of VEES earthquake models. These models cover worldwide regions and include multiple perils such as ground shaking, liquefaction, landslide, fire-following, sprinkler leakage, and tsunami. The damage estimation component focuses on identifying the impact these perils on the built environment and society in terms of physical damage to properties (buildings and contents), loss of use (downtime), and human loss and casaulty. The candidate will work closely with a team of structural and geotechnical engineers, seismologists, and specialists to perform deterministic and probabilistic risk assessment, and present and explain results to internal stakeholders and external clients. Evolving nature of research work at VEES creates unique and challenging problems that spark innovation and growth for VERISK and creates opportunities for its employees. A successful candidate should have a strong techncial background in earthquake, structural, geotechnical, or civil engineering. Candidates are expected to be highly motivated, detail oriented, excellent team player, and capable of utilizing problem-solving skills to solve problems as new areas of modeling emerges. Responsibilities (main Responsibilities, But Not Limited To) Data acquisition (including post-event survey) and analysis to understand building inventory and their vulnerability in regions of interest Perform analytical studies on damage observations or synthesized data to develop fragility functions for a variety of assets subjected to earthquake shaking, liquefaction, landslide, tsunami, fire and etc. Use data from independent research to assess and validate model components and its overall performance Present VERISK models to technical and non-technical audiences and provide support to clients and staff as needed Author technical writing for internal and external publications Qualifications Master with 2+ years of relevant experience or PhD in Earthquake, Structural, Geotechnical, and/or other relevant engineering fields Demonstrated capabilities in probabilistic and stochastic risk assessment and modeling, particularly in earthquake engineering Familiarity with C++ and data mining skills using tools such as R, Matlab and others Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational and documentation skills Experience with GIS applications (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Verisk Extreme Event Solutions (VEES, previously AIR Worldwide), a member of Verisk Analytics, is the scientific leader and most respected provider of risk modeling software and consulting services. VEES founded the catastrophe modeling industry in 1987 and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, terrorism, and pandemic outbreaks in 90 countries. VEES offers the opportunity to work with advanced technologies, global clients, and hundreds of the most innovative, talented minds in the industry. As an earthquake fire-following modeling engineer, the primary responsibility will be studying how fires could start, spread, and be suppressed after an earthquake and their impact on built environment and human beings. The outcome of the research will be translated to estimate financial losses to large insurance portfolios due to property damage and human casualty. The candidate will work closely with a team of specialists to perform probabilistic risk assessment by earthquake fire-following, and present and explain results to technical and non-technical audiences including VERISK clients and government officials. A successful candidate should have a strong technical background in science, engineering, or mathematics, have passion and desire to learn, and is expected to be a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized, self-directed, and excellent team player. As a researcher at VERISK, the nature of our work varies from month to month and year to year, and you will have constant opportunities to learn and grow expertise in new areas. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Improve earthquake fire-following modeling to reproduce reality Data acquisition (including post-event survey) and analysis to understand fire ignition, spreading, suppression among different built environment such as residential, commercial, industrial and infrastructural areas Use data from independent research to assess and validate model components and its overall performance Present model to technical and non-technical audiences and provide support to clients and staff as needed Author technical writing for internal and external publications Qualifications MS with 2+ years of relevant experience or PhD in Earthquake fire following simulation Demonstrated capabilities in Cellular Automata simulation or relevance applicable to fire following simulation Experience of probabilistic and stochastic risk assessment and modeling Familiarity with Fortran/ C++ and data mining tools such as R, Matlab and others Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational and documentation skills Experience with GIS applications (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description This research engineer position is responsible for developing and supporting the engineering components of Verisk Extreme Event Solution earthquake models that cover multiple regions and multiple perils such as ground shaking, liquefaction, landslide, fire, tsunami. The engineering components include identifying the impact of these perils can have on the built environment in terms of physical damage which can result in monetary loss of buildings/infrastructures, contents as well as loss of use (downtime). The candidate will work closely with a team of structural and geotechnical engineers, seismologists, and specialists to perform probabilistic risk assessment. Candidates should have a desire to use their problem-solving skills in applying sound engineering principles to solve unique and challenging problems as new areas of modeling emerge. The candidate is expected to be a highly motivated, detail oriented, well organized, self-directed, outstanding in writing and speaking and an excellent collaborator. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Author technical writing for internal and external publications Data acquisition (including post-event survey) and analysis to understand building inventory and their vulnerability in regions of interest Perform analytical studies on damage observations or synthesized data to develop fragility functions for a variety of assets subjected to earthquake shaking, liquefaction, landslide, tsunami, fire and etc. Use data from independent research to assess and validate model components and its overall performance Present VERISK models to technical and non-technical audiences and provide support to clients and staff as needed Qualifications This research engineer position is responsible for developing and supporting the engineering components of Verisk Extreme Event Solution earthquake models that cover multiple regions and multiple perils such as ground shaking, liquefaction, landslide, fire, tsunami. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Overview Job Description The Research and Modeling group at Verisk Extreme Event Solutions is looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented research engineer to join our team. The research engineer position will be responsible for developing, enhancing and managing the vulnerability component and overall model performance of Verisk Extreme Event Solutions’ atmospheric peril vulnerability models that cover multiple regions and perils, including hurricane, straight-line tornadic winds, storm surge as well as precipitation-driven flooding. The candidate will work closely with a team of structural engineers, meteorologists, statisticians, hydrologists/hydraulic engineers, and specialists in financial application of probabilistic risk assessment. We are seeking candidates with a desire to use their problem-solving skills in applying sound engineering principles to solve unique and challenging problems in the fields of civil/structural engineering, risk assessment and many interconnected scientific disciplines. It is expected that the candidate will be well-organized, able to perform high-quality self-directed research, have outstanding written and verbal communication skills, and be an effective team player. Main Responsibilities Understand key features of any interested region’s (worldwide) building inventory and its impact on vulnerability subjected to atmospheric hazards Development of vulnerability functions and monetary loss curves for structural and non-structural building and infrastructure components subjected to hazards such as hurricane winds, hail, tornadoes, storm surge, precipitation induced flooding for the regions of interest. Collect, analyze and efficiently manage a wide variety of data (such as building characteristics, damage and loss data) used in the development and validation of catastrophe models. Implement the research of building vulnerability into Verisk Extreme Event Solutions’ portfolio risk assessment models, and validate the output Investigate property damage in the aftermath of flooding, including statistical analysis of historical damage and insurance claims data Provide technical support regarding model development and communicate results internally and externally to staff and clients. Qualifications Ph.D. in Wind Engineering, Structural Engineering, Building Science, Civil Engineering, and/or other relevant fields Experience in probabilistic and stochastic risk assessment and modeling, particularly in the field of structural engineering Proficient in C/C++, Python, R, SQL, MATLAB Knowledge of data mining skills and/or statistical analysis tools Excellent communication skills to convey findings to internal and external stakeholders Knowledge of GIS applications is a plus Insurance industry experience is a plus Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Risk Modeler is primarily responsible for developing, enhancing, and managing vulnerability component of Verisk’s wildfire portfolio risk analysis models. The candidate will be located in Boston and work closely with a team of engineers, scientists, statisticians, and specialists in the research department. Candidates fit this position are expected to be highly motivated and detail-oriented team player with sophisticated problem-solving skills. Main Responsibilities Collect and analyze wildfire datasets to build a solid understanding of wildfire damages and losses. Build vulnerability models of buildings, infrastructures, and industrial facilities subjected to wildfires as well as wildfire smoke. Build a broad knowledge base of wildfire risk mitigation, state legislation, and wildfire related insurance regulations. Incorporate the knowledge into Verisk’s wildfire models through robust, efficient, and realistic algorithms. Assist in client support by providing technical analysis, conference presentation, and written documentation. Qualifications Master's degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Economics/Engineering or other quantitative discipline with 3+ years of related experience or PhD degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Economics/Engineering or other quantitative discipline. 3+ years working with large data sets. Hands-on experience in wildfire risk assessment and modeling. Without wildfire modeling experience, candidates with rich experience in modeling other natural catastrophe perils is equally qualified. Proficient in programming with Python or R. C++ programming capability is a plus. Demonstrated experiences in statistical and probabilistic modeling. Familiar of GIS data process, analyzation, and visualization is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Coding in SAS or SQL Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Job Description The Field Enablement Trainer will partner with the Head of Revenue Operations and Field Enablement team to form strategic partnerships across the Commercial organization to align and incorporate Verisk Marketing Solutions’ bookings & retention objectives into all aspects of training for the Commercial team. The Field Enablement Trainer will be a key contributor to the success of quota-carrying employees, with involvement ranging from new hire training to active deal review and coaching. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Own the adoption of the Value Selling sales methodology certification of sales representatives and inform the broader Commercial organization Prepares new sales representatives by conducting orientation to the sales process, develops individual coaching plans, and provides guidance. Conducts exercise sessions for new and current sales employees. Observes sales interactions and collect feedback, results, and performance data of trainees after sessions or customer engagements Coordinates with the Commercial Leadership team and Revenue Operations. Structures training plans to meet financial objectives. Maximize effectiveness by researching training methodologies, learning tools, platforms, and practices. Evaluate sales team performance to ensure training programs are successful. Ensure training materials are up-to-date and stay current on product updates, launches, and key company initiatives. Qualifications Advanced customer service and time management skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Demonstrable ability to execute effective training programs Outstanding coaching skills Motivated by a desire to exceed shared goals Great organizational and interpersonal skills Ability to measure performance and communicate results to key stakeholders. Key performance indicators include: number of sales reps attaining quota, average sales rep productivity, average deal size, sales cycle & closing ratio. At least 2 years of experience as a sales coach, training specialist, or a similar position Possession of certifications in sales training methodologies Experience with building and developing teams Nice to Have Bachelor’s degree or Associates degree in business administration or related field Previous experience in an Account Executive, Account Manager or Business Development role is preferred, but not required Previous experience in social selling, through LinkedIn or other social platforms Previous experience with Salesforce.com, ZoomInfo, Gong, and/or a learning management system (LMS) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Key performance indicators include: number of sales reps attaining quota, average sales rep productivity, average deal size, sales cycle & closing ratio. jobTitle: Field Representative - Insurance Inspections - McAllen / Harlingen TX
jobDescription: Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description This is a full-time work from home position where you will get to observe a wide variety of properties, businesses, and operations through the lens of the insurance carrier. Our self-driven Field Representatives work independently to effectively plan, schedule and complete work assignments, evaluating commercial properties and businesses for drivers of risk and loss relevant to insurance underwriting, pricing and loss control. Perform on-site insurance surveys and interviews by appointment and create reports used to evaluate risk for multiple lines of coverage. You are the eyes and ears of our customers, identifying construction materials, business operations, fire protection systems such as fire sprinkler systems, safety measures, and other information pertaining to underwriting and loss control. Professionally represent customers and ISO in person, via phone and in written correspondence. Use your eye for detail and excellent communication skills to recognize unique customer needs and convey property conditions to the customer. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferred and one year of related experience; specific field of study not required, but may include Risk Management and Insurance, Construction Management, Property and Liability Insurance, Safety. Ideal candidates have prior experience in insurance loss control, underwriting or claims; commercial building construction or inspections; fire safety and industrial safety occupations. Excellent customer service and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to communicate facts clearly, verbally and written, and provide feedback. Ability to write concise and informative reports to quality standards. Strong proficiency for technology, laptops, mobile devices, MS Office suite and mobile applications. Ability to observe onsite conditions, examine, measure, analyze, map, gather data, and travel to and from all sites. Job may involve occasional lifting of up to 40 lbs., regular climbing of stairs and ladders, working in all types of neighborhoods, environments and weather. Walking, standing and driving for extended time periods may be needed. Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record in accordance with company policies required. Overnight travel (in and out of state) required in accordance with business needs. Ability to assimilate and learn new material through classroom, exercises and on-the-job field training. Professional designations (e.g., CFPS, CSP, ARM, ALCM, NFPA and/or CPCU) are desirable. Candidates work remotely from their own home office; high speed internet connection required. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice

If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, come join us! Job Description This role interfaces with the Product leaders, Reporting, Controllership, and other Corporate Finance teams. The Financial Analyst should be a self-starter who can work closely with senior leaders, deliver superior analytics, and own complex deliverables. The responsibilities include: Providing support in completion of month-end close activities, compiling financial statements, completing variance analysis, balance sheet reconciliations, and preparing and posting journal entries Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts. Lead monthly financial reviews with senior leadership team Develop financial projections and build financial models. Prepare models to support strategic decision-making. Understand key business drivers, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements. Perform research and analysis as required Work closely with the Billings team to ensure that there are no delays and revenue is accurate for the month. Prepare Ad-hoc Revenue and Expense analysis using pivot tables and v-lookups Develop and maintain financial forecasts and budget (monthly, quarterly, annually). Help prepare Senior Management presentations / meetings (Monthly Business Reviews, Quarterly Forecast review meetings, etc.) Ensure compliance with financial guidelines, company policies, and relevant legal regulations. Qualifications 3+ years’ work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, and/or corporate finance Bachelor’s Degree Comfortable with P&L Management and construction Experience performing variance analysis against budget and forecast and writing explanations Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills. Knowledge of Tableau/Power BI is a big plus Strong analytical mindset with attention to details and accuracy Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Should be able to present to the senior management Ability to work under pressure and within short time constraints in a complex system and business environment Basic Accounting knowledge Experience with Financial Systems: Smartview/Oracle Financials, Peoplesoft and nVision a plus Team player, able to work in a collaborative environment Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Grow your career by becoming a member of Extreme Events Solution's Software Development team. We are seeking an experience, motivated Full Stack Developer to participate in software development within an Agile team developing web and desktop applications. You will be responsible for work in all stages of SDLC, from reviewing requirements, to design, to develop and test, to deployment. We are looking for a candidate who can quickly pick up new technologies, respond quickly to change and adapt to changing requirements.. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Design and development of cloud-hosted web applications for insurance industry from high-level architecture and network infrastructure to low-level creation of site layout, user experience, database schema, data structure, work-flow, graphics, unit testing, an end to end integration testing, etc. Working from static application mockups and wireframes, developing front-end user interfaces and page templates in HTML 5, CSS, SAAS, LESS TypeScript, bootstrap, Angular and third-party controls like Kendo UI/Infragistics. Design and develop complex single page web applications communicating with REST API backends using Angular, React or similar technologies. Design and develop functional and responsive web applications by collaborating with other engineers in the Agile team. Develop REST APIs. Implement UI Automation along with development responsibilities. Good knowledge of T-SQL and database programming with any RDMS system. Strong problem-solving skills Fast learner and keen to learn. Excellent listening skills Good written and verbal communication skills Enthusiasm, energy, and creativity Qualifications B.S. in Math, EE, CS or Software Engineering; M.S preferred. 5+ years of hands-on experience in development of commercial-grade software products. 3+ years in web development, Angular/React, Typescript, JavaScript, CSS, .NET Core or NodeJS and REST 2+ years of working with Microsoft technology stack, C#, PostgreSQL. 2+ years of experience working with multi-tenant cloud native applications Experience in AWS Cloud is plus. Strong understanding of Agile process and best practices Strong knowledge of latest technologies and trends. Ability to develop use-cases from business requirements Ability to collaborate effectively with project stakeholders outside of Dev. group, especially with Product Management on feature requirements and project schedules. Ability to provide effective technical leadership and oversight to development team on a project, ensuring that software is developed in adherence to established architecture, design, quality standards, as well as delivery schedule. Knowledge and experience in GIS Software development is a plus, but not required. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description At EES we love to automate systems. When things get in the way of productivity, the team steps in to remove the hurdles. The EES’s Integration Services team is responsible to identify time-consuming manual processes and build automated solutions that are reliable and scalable. You listen to EES employees and clients to transform their needs into high-level technical specifications, and design and develop the recommended solution. Whether it be a client solution or internal process improvement, you will help the end-users to work smarter, faster, and efficiently. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role As a full-stack developer, you will be working extensively across several teams within EES and our clients that use EES’s suite of Risk Modeling and Analytics products. Following are the responsibilities for this job position. Design, develop and maintain automation solutions to streamline the client’s processes, eliminate manual steps and to improve the overall productivity. Ability to understand client’s workflow and business processes required to integrate with EES’s product suite. Contribute to the development of EES Cloud working with the latest AWS services. Provide feedback to the software development group regarding client-facing APIs. Develop robust, innovative, and user-friendly web applications, including consumer-facing web experiences. Integrate with platforms such as Okta, Salesforce, and Eloqua. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role At least 2+ years of experience working with AWS technologies. Experience with Microsoft technologies and Windows server operating system Basic networking knowledge, and network troubleshooting skills Multiple years of experience working with C#, .NET technologies, and Web APIs Knowledge of database concepts and experience working with relational databases like Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL Customer-oriented, customer service, and customer support skills AWS certifications are a plus, but not required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are looking for a Software Engineer-II to work as part of ClaimSearch team in our Jersey City, NJ office. ISO ClaimSearch is the property/casualty insurance industry's largest claims database, providing robust claim analysis and fraud detection. You will be responsible for designing and developing components of Visualized ClaimSearch solution. VCS platform allows SIU users to search and view MatchReports that provides actionable insights into their company’s claims. You will be working as full stack engineer in a SCRUM team and work directly with product owners, QA and UX teams as well as other engineering teams. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Design and build high performance, scalable and reliable component-based applications using latest technologies such as AWS, Docker, Elasticsearch etc. Design clear and concise REST service interfaces with corresponding documentation Write unit tests in a TDD (Test Driven Design) manner to ensure code quality Write integration tests based on defined acceptance criteria and in conjunction with QA Develop new applications as well as enhance and support existing applications Effectively resolve production problems in a timely manner by rapidly organizing and deploying the appropriate resources. Continuously review problems to determine the root cause to prevent them in the future. Ensure that secure coding practices are followed throughout the software life cycle Learn from senior team members regarding proper application design and security Participates in planning meetings, retrospectives, daily stand ups, and other meetings as part of the software development process Experiment with new technologies and provide recommendations for product improvement Mentor junior team members in proper application design and security. Effectively communicate software solution expectations to internal customers, team members and other stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion. Qualifications Fluent in Java, SQL, XML, JSON Experience working with Spring, Hibernate and Message Queues Experience working in JavaScript frameworks such as Ember.js or AngularJS Experience with AWS, Docker, Elasticsearch a plus Understanding and exposure to creating and consuming RESTful services Working knowledge of software development tools Knowledge of testing methodologies and Agile processes Familiarity with continuous integration concepts and processes Strong teamwork and problem-solving skills Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small-group situations Experience leading small technical teams Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology Effectively translated complex customer requirements and recommended system solutions Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audience Minimum of bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or related field) from four-year college or university with minimum 3.0 GPA 2-4 years of experience or similar ability in software development Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Accountable for leading application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting web content solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications 8+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: C#, ASP.Net MVC, WebAPI, AngularJS, NUnit and Moq, LINQ, NHibernate or Entity Framework, Spring.Net, Continuous Integration, JQuery, CSS, AJAX Highly experienced at leading teams, interacting with business partners or customers, and guiding project direction. Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused most important features. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Leadership and ability to guide design and technical meetings Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
