Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk is seeking a Global Protection Services Analyst to join our GPS team in Jersey City, NJ. In this role, you'll be responsible for reviewing global intelligence feeds for safety/security incidents that may affect Verisk employees, travelers and facilities. The successful candidate will perform assessments to scope the individuals/facilities affected and reach out accordingly to gather status (i.e. large scale fires, severe weather, crime, and terrorism.) The Day To Day Responsibilities Of This Role Are Perform facility assessments, evaluating inherent risks, mitigation actions, and remaining residual risks of safety/security of Verisk global facilities. Liaison with facility leads and BU managers in preparation for possible crisis incidents. Incidents can include increased geopolitical tensions and civil unrest situations. Create a corporate risk assessment and traveler protocols for employees traveling to high-risk locations, e.g., Nigeria, Sierra Leone, Mexico, and Pakistan. These reports are updated annually, or when an employee is planning to travel. Brief the employee and their manager before travel may commence. Review and update the Facility Safety/Security playbook and Employee-facing Safety/Security playbooks. Support the Corporate-wide emergency notification system. Provide training and support to local facility/BU’s notification system’s administrators to ensure they have timely messaging capability. Ensure that administration rights are provided appropriately (by BU or facility). Act as main contact with notification system vendor to discuss features or technical issues. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics or a risk-related field and 3 - 5 years of relevant experience. 3 or more years of experience in global incident response, crisis management and support. Strong working knowledge of security management, business operations, risk management, response management and physical security assessments (ASIS). Experience in developing and maintaining case management, evidence collection, report preparations and documentation of substantiate findings. Strong knowledge of facility assessments and evaluating inherent risks. Willing and able to travel on short notice. Superior organization and written communication skills, coupled with strong technical writing and / or editorial skills and the ability to develop, document and maintain methodologies and procedures. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office including MS Excel and PowerPoint and experience with vendor risk tracking platforms is a plus. Demonstrate superior leadership, consulting, analysis, presentation and project management skills. Ability to work independently on multiple projects with minimal supervision and meet aggressive deadlines is essential. Knowledge of RSA’s Archer GRC portal is highly desirable. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Data Driven Safety, LLC ("DDS") is seeking a Government Relations Specialist to start immediately. The employee will be a member of our Government Relations team and will work collaboratively across teams to acquire and maintain new data sources. Interest in big data, tech, FOIA, government transparency is a plus. Responsibilities Reporting to our Lead for Data Continuity, this key role provides data acquisition and works directly with our Government Relations team members. As a member of our Government Relations team your duties will include: Establishing contact with judicial, law enforcement and other governmental agencies to make formal public records requests. Negotiating conditions of access to government held data. Establishing and maintaining relationships with government employees and officials. Building personal and professional relationships with custodians of records. Ensuring that agreements and required forms are appropriately maintained, updated and changed as required. Advising on strategic approaches in data acquisition. Working closely with the Quality Assurance team to ensure files are received and processed in a timely manner. Coordinating billing efforts between Accounting and state contacts. Qualifications Clear speaking and writing skills that deliver persuasive communications that foster effective, collaborative working relationships with agencies. Strong organizational skills. Creative problem-solving skills. Experience in an administrative, law enforcement, insurance, or military setting a plus. Job Description We’re looking for a HRIS Senior Administrator to join our HRIS team in Jersey City. Lead review and gathering of business requirements for various HR system updates and/or functionality; Develop specification documentation. Creates test plans and/or related documentation that would be used to manage the testing process Performs system troubleshooting. Lead review, testing and implementation of system enhancements. Collaborates with IT staff to coordinate updates and/or fixes and documents the process and results. Provides production support, including researching and resolving HR technology issues, unexpected results or process flaws. Conducts regular data audits and implement validation measures to ensure data integrity. Provides area leadership for the new system implementation. Make recommendations to help re-engineer and improve effectiveness of various HR processes. Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent business experience Years of experience in industry and/or similar positions: 8+ Experience with technologies supporting any combination of the following HR disciplines: HRIS (HR Job Management, HR Org Management, HR Master Data, Compensation, Benefits, etc.), Talent Acquisitions, Talent Development (Learning and Performance Management), On Boarding, Engagement and HR Operations, PeopleSoft HCMS, Oracle Cloud HCM a plus. ServiceNow experience is highly desired. SmartRecruiters experience is highly desired Must be comfortable using Microsoft Productivity Suite Can project manage and follow through on deliverables independently with stakeholders Solid understanding of HR Functional areas and how downstream dataflow from HRIS supports each function Stakeholder Management, Managing Expectations, Prioritization Skills, Conflict Management, Decision Making Quality Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Draft policy language and develop manual rules that guide insurers in issuing and rating policies, and also develop related information, including filings and announcements to customers.  Review laws, regulations and case law for impact on ISO products and insurer procedures. Develop policy language and rules for major program updates that provide valuable insurance enhancements to products used by the entire insurance industry. Review state laws and requirements and make revisions to ensure program updates are compliant and relevant in each state. Leverage insurance expertise and researching skills to provide timely, thoughtful responses to insurer inquires over a wide range of insurance topics. Develop and present items to panels of insurers on emerging trends and potential revisions. Collaborate with all stakeholders including Product Development, Law Department, Government Relations, Actuarial, etc., inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Work in conjunction with the Product Development team to research and review new products, consider impact on other products, and collaborate with others in bringing products to market. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. At least two years of P&C insurance experience with product development, claims, underwriting, and/or submitting filings with insurance regulators. Experience analyzing and developing forms, rules, and/or ratings preferred.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail. Strong organization, research, and analytic skills. Ability to both work independently and collaborate in a team environment. Knowledge of ISO commercial liability/casualty insurance line procedures is a plus.  CPCU or RPLU exam study or completion is a plus. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Are you an insurance professional looking to make a real impact on the industry?  Do you feel limited with your growth opportunities in your current role?  Are you looking for a chance to take your career to the next level with a highly innovative organization?  Then you should consider coming to work with Verisk Analytics!  We were recently named Forbes Magazine’s #1 Innovative Research & Consulting Services Company in the World (#18 of all companies) and have a great opportunity for an ambitious, passionate insurance expert. We are looking for an experienced Insurance Product Development expert to develop innovative enhancements to ISO's management liability & professional liability insurance programs. As a product development team member you will conceptually and technically develop new and revised insurance programs in response to the changing business environment. We will look to you for strategic thought leadership on the D&O, EPL, Fiduciary Liability, Crime and Financial Institutions markets, as well as professional liability insurance markets, using your understanding of coverages, markets, industries, legal and regulatory trends, our customers, and our competitors to gauge impacts on our insurance programs, provide actionable insights, and create new products and product enhancements. The better we know our customers, the better we can serve them.  Customer focus will guide all aspects of your work. You will engage with customers and respond to their feedback with key developments, and develop products that anticipate their needs.  This includes participating in panels and other customer forums, representing the products to customers, meeting with them individually and being a key customer resource. You may also represent us at industry conferences and with professional organizations, including preparing and giving presentations and authoring or co-authoring white papers or articles. As part of a small staff of line-of-business experts you will collaborate with all stakeholders. This means inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. CPCU or RPLU preferred. Minimum five to seven years underwriting or product development experience with in-depth knowledge of Directors and Officers, Employment-related Practices, Fiduciary Liability, Commercial Crime and Financial Institutions lines of business.  Professional Liability and/or Cyber experience also a plus. Development or analysis of policy forms required. Proven research and analytical skills.  Pro-active problem solver. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Experience building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on gaining actionable insights and forming collaborative partnerships with the goal of innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Some travel may be required (up to 15%) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Become a member of AIR's Technical Services Group. You will be responsible for contributing to our internal automation platform with new tools and automation in order to better support our internal and external customers as well as the business. Technical Implementations Duties and responsibilities are, but not limited to: This role requires a broad skillset/understanding of systems and networks; it is heavily focused on implementation of solutions in these areas using tools such as Ansible, Packer, Laravel, MongoDB and source control. You will be responsible for supporting all consumers of our automation on a day-to-day basis and additionally contributing to the improvement of existing tools, creating new tools, and extending our automation. Troubleshooting failed deployments in order to determine the root cause. Improve stability of deployments by implementing fixes to automation based on root cause in event of a failure. Identify areas of improvement including deployment time, approach to automation at certain stages, resource consumption, and additional tooling. Help to maintain and improve our golden images in multiple platforms. Researching and implementing new technologies relative to our automation platform and needs of the business. Support For Internal/External Clients Providing deployment and troubleshooting support for both internal and external client automation/deployments. Implementation of new features based on needs of internal/external clients. Qualifications Skills/Experience with tools such as Ansible, Packer, Laravel, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef, Puppet, Vault, GIT, and VSCode. Knowledge and skills in Computer Systems and Networking - Server OS (Windows or Linux), TCP/IP Windows Environment (ie DHCP/DNS/Subnetting/Active Directory). Basic understanding of the OSI Model and the ability to conceptualize which layer(s) you are working in. Conceptual understanding and/or experience in as many of the following - VMWare vSphere (or Workstation) platform - VM, VM Templates, Network/Portgroups, Datastores/vSAN, Oversubscription AWS platform - AMI, EC2 Instance Tenancy/Type, EBS (gp2/gp3/io1/io2/etc), EBS Snapshots, Dedicated Hosts, S3, etc Basics of virtualization (Hypervisors (ESXI/AWS Nitro), Oversubscription, storage/deduplication) Ability to identify areas in need of automation or improved efficiency and assist in its implementation by using the tools and technologies described above. Good written communication skills Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Initiate projects following appropriate project management methodology, including defining scope, gathering and defining project requirements, developing project charters, project plans, budgets, and schedules, identifying staffing requirements, and forming project teams. Select and follow project management methods, procedures, and quality objectives, and tracks metrics for assessing progress. Balance workload and provide technical and analytical guidance and work direction to project team, including scheduling, work assignment, review of project efforts, and removal of roadblocks that may inhibit project success. Incorporate regulatory compliance into technology solutions along with corporate policies and procedures. Assess variance from the project plans, develop and implement changes as necessary to ensure that the project remains within a specific scope and is within time, cost, and quality objectives, and keep management aware of the situation. Identify opportunities to adopt innovative technologies; work with Portfolio Manager at the strategic level and lead options analysis, and make solution proposals that meet business expectations as well as work within the constraints of the organization. Identify and recommend potential improvements in current methodologies. Develop and maintain a productive working relationship with business units, and team members Maintain appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools. Completes all responsibilities as outlined in the annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent work experience. 7+ years proven working experience in Project Management and 3-5 years of IT experience. Extensive understanding, knowledge, and practice of project/program management methods and practices (Agile preferred). Excellent planning and time management skills. Knowledgeable in computer systems architecture, including high-availability, fault-tolerant systems. Perform a variety of complicated tasks which require strong computer and analytical skills. Ability to interpret and apply complex technical information to facilitate in the resolution of difficult problems. Ability to lead small, medium, and possible large projects solutions, breakdown projects into tasks, and define priorities. Resourceful and able to manage multiple projects at once and shifting priorities with limited supervision. Strong and effective interpersonal, communication (oral and written), and motivational skills within technical and function team members. Ability to mentor other team members. Experience identifying and working through process improvement activities related to systems. Self-motivated individual with ability to work independently, take full ownership of projects, and take initiative to accomplish goals and objectives. PMP and CSM certification is a plus. Experience with operational excellence and process improvement methodologies (Six Sigma, Lean) Strong working experience/knowledge with Project Management software (Jira) and MS Office suite. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Develop, construct, test and maintain software applications and architectures (including database and large-scale data processing systems) Implement elegant (i.e. simple and intuitive) predictive models in software that are dynamic and responsive to user inputs or time-varying observations Develop and maintain code to consistently analyze, transform, and grade the quality of diverse datasets Creatively and practically overcome data quality concerns and data gaps via custom software solutions Infer high-fidelity characteristics in datasets where such fidelity is only available for a portion of the dataset Assist in the evaluation of applications and tools for data processing and analysis Implement data analysis in software following standards and best practices Develop data set processes for data modeling, mining and production Work as part of the development team to implement and fully utilize the data analysis in implementing world class software solutions Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality Work effectively with project technologists and stakeholders Be a strong fit for our technical and cultural environments Qualifications BS with 4+ years’ experience or MS with 2+ years in Computer Science with experience in Data Science/Analytics in their educational program and/or professional experience Programming skills creating enterprise grade solutions in Java a requirement. Modeling will be implemented and actualized in multi-project enterprise-grade Java-centric codebase Experience with a variety of languages: C, C++, C#, JavaScript, ReactJS, etc… a serious benefit. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from disparate and complementary sources Communicate complex analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner Passionate about empirical research and answering difficult questions with data Ask insightful questions to better understand expressed and unexpressed customer needs Present complex results in a visual and intuitive manner Thrive in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment Work both autonomously and in a team Solve problems through programming and simulation Have experience with large scale programming and/or optimization problems Subject matter agnostic with a passion for digging into any dataset by researching the relevant information on the subject in order to use the data effectively Unbound by subjective/arguable presumptions Have experience with geospatial statistics Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements

Company Description FAST, which stands for “Flexible Architecture, Simplified Technology,” is a Verisk (NASDAQ: VRSK) business that offers a suite of out-of-the-box software components insurers can use to quickly modernize their current environments or replace their legacy systems. FAST, which has a U.S. office in Iselin, New Jersey and an international office in Hyderabad, India, was founded in 2010 to provide an alternative to the overly burdensome solutions available in the market. At FAST, we recognize that each insurance company faces a unique set of issues and challenges, and that a tremendous amount of creativity and capability is required to craft and implement the best solution. That’s why FAST was built on an agile mindset. FAST, in concert with Verisk, is focused on providing innovative technology and analytics solutions for the life insurance industry. We’re continuously learning and improving, constantly challenging the status quo, and always seeking a “win/win” for our customers, partners, and employees. We reduce the time to market, eliminating risk and lowering the cost of standing up and maintaining core insurance systems. We continue to leapfrog the competition through Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Life Insurance Policy Admin Systems, North America. FAST was first recognized in Gartner’s 2015 Magic Quadrant and after only three years became the youngest company to make Gartner’s leadership quadrant (upper-right). We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description The Junior Product Analyst works as a consulting team member or as an individual analyst on the enhancement, integration, and implementation of client-driven FAST solutions. They will collaborate with other actuaries and/or product experts, focusing on the analysis of the customer’s product specifications and on the configuration of the customer’s products utilizing FAST’s toolset. Duties may be performed at customer’s site. This Product Analyst operates under close supervision and works on tasks as directed. Essential Duties And Responsibilities 90% - 100% Works on single or multi-product projects, usually with multiple computer environments where design is extremely complex: Develops detailed understanding of customer’s products and how customer’s products will be integrated with the FAST solution through interfacing with customer’s actuarial resources. Interviews customer peers during requirements gathering exercises and documents findings. Facilitates and manages design sessions regarding business functionality and/or product logic with customer(s). Tests FAST system against customer’s system. Identifies gaps between customer requirements and FAST solution and proposes ideas to address these issues. Authors detailed actuarial specifications and functional specifications from limited BSR(s), or with no BSR(s), through independent discussions with customers. Performs product loading and values testing. Using detailed knowledge of regulations, calculations and processing, routinely guides detailed discussions with customers regarding at least two (2) of the following product types: UL/VUL, Traditional Products, Deferred Annuities and Immediate Annuities. Shares business knowledge with peer business analysts through mentoring and/or group presentations. Authors functional specifications for multiple FAST solutions: Home Office, Administration, Payout Administration, Application, Underwriting, Illustrations Calculations, Illustrations and Technical Integration. Estimates time frames, quality and quantity of resources required to successfully implement project; assists in developing project plan incorporating all project variables. Provides periodic status checks with customers and team to assess progress against plan. Performs re-forecasts of project variables as necessary throughout project. Prepares status reports, as needed, on all project activities. <10% Serves as advisory-level pre-sales support and post-sales technical support specialist when needed. Qualifications Essential Education and Work Experience Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics or Actuarial Science required. FSA or ASA desirable. Up to 18 months of work experience in the life and/or financial services industry, relevant industry business practices, business consulting, or technical consulting. Specialized Knowledge and Skills The Actuarial Analyst participates as a project resource according to a schedule. Design complexity may vary from fairly straight forward to moderately complex, may involve a single or multiple products, and may require multiple computer environments. The Actuarial Analyst must possess excellent communication, interpersonal, presentation, organizational, and planning skills. Equipment and Applications PC proficiency required Microsoft Office proficiency required, especially Microsoft Excel Work Environment and Physical Demands General office environment Travel may be required Average 45-hour work-week, may be more as needed Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering and Analytics Lab (DEAL) is a team of technical actuaries responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Lead Business Intelligence Engineer, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, business accumen, communication skills, and a passion for mentoring. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 17a. This is a hybrid role that will combine insurance knowledge and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage a team of Jr actuarial/data engineers supporting multiple work-streams and a wide array of internal customers. We are looking for a team lead that can support the development of our technical business staff in modern data applications including database architectures, efficient data pipelines, effective use of data visualization in organizing workflows, and other data related best-practices. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Design business critical services, code and own what you build architecturally and operationally. Mentor and assist in the career development of junior engineers. Assist with recruiting and hiring. Decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions. Partner with technical and non-technical colleagues to understand data and reporting requirements. Work with engineering teams to collect required data from internal and external systems. Design table structures and ETL strategy to build performant Data solutions that are reliable and scalable in a fast growing data ecosystem. Document and publish Metadata and table designs to facilitate data adoption. Perform ad hoc analysis as necessary. Perform SQL and ETL tuning as necessary. Develop Data Quality checks for source and target data sets. Coach and mentor team members to improve their designs and ETL processes Create and conduct project/architecture design review Create POC when necessary to test new approaches Design and build modern data management solutions Enforce common data design pattern to increase code maintainability Conduct peers code review and provide constructive feedback Partner with team leads to identify, design and implement internal process improvements Automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, understand when to re-design architecture for greater scalability You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role University degree in Math, Computer Science, or Engineering 7+ years of relevant Professional experience. 5+ years’ work experience implementing and reporting on business key performance indicators in data warehousing environments. Strong understanding of data modeling principles including Dimensional modeling, data normalization principles etc. 4+ years’ experience using analytic SQL, working with traditional relational databases and/or distributed systems such as Greenplum, Redshift, Snowflake. 3+ Years of experience programming languages (e.g. Python, bash). Expert level understanding of SQL Engines and able to conduct advanced performance tuning Familiarity with data exploration / data visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, etc. Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret market and consumer information. Strong communication skills – written and verbal presentations. Excellent conceptual and analytical reasoning competencies. Comfortable working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment. A great team player who embraces collaborations also work well individually while supporting multiple projects in parallel Expereince in the Property & Casualty insuance industr is preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. This is a hybrid role that will combine insurance knowledge and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage a team of Jr actuarial/data engineers supporting multiple work-streams and a wide array of internal customers. We are looking for a team lead that can support the development of our technical business staff in modern data applications including database architectures, efficient data pipelines, effective use of data visualization in organizing workflows, and other data related best-practices. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Design business critical services, code and own what you build architecturally and operationally. Mentor and assist in the career development of junior engineers. Assist with recruiting and hiring. Decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions. Partner with technical and non-technical colleagues to understand data and reporting requirements. Work with engineering teams to collect required data from internal and external systems. Design table structures and ETL strategy to build performant Data solutions that are reliable and scalable in a fast growing data ecosystem. Document and publish Metadata and table designs to facilitate data adoption. Perform ad hoc analysis as necessary. Perform SQL and ETL tuning as necessary. Develop Data Quality checks for source and target data sets. Coach and mentor team members to improve their designs and ETL processes Create and conduct project/architecture design review Create POC when necessary to test new approaches Design and build modern data management solutions Enforce common data design pattern to increase code maintainability Conduct peers code review and provide constructive feedback Partner with team leads to identify, design and implement internal process improvements Automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, understand when to re-design architecture for greater scalability You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role University degree in Math, Computer Science, or Engineering 7+ years of relevant Professional experience. 5+ years’ work experience implementing and reporting on business key performance indicators in data warehousing environments. Strong understanding of data modeling principles including Dimensional modeling, data normalization principles etc. 4+ years’ experience using analytic SQL, working with traditional relational databases and/or distributed systems such as Greenplum, Redshift, Snowflake. 3+ Years of experience programming languages (e.g. Python, bash). Expert level understanding of SQL Engines and able to conduct advanced performance tuning Familiarity with data exploration / data visualization tools like Tableau, PowerBI, etc. Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret market and consumer information. Strong communication skills – written and verbal presentations. Excellent conceptual and analytical reasoning competencies. Comfortable working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment. A great team player who embraces collaborations also work well individually while supporting multiple projects in parallel Expereince in the Property & Casualty insuance industr is preferred Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The User Experience (UX) Design Lead is responsible for creating compelling, innovative design solutions that demonstrate the power and value of rich client, web-based product experiences. The UX Design Lead is responsible for collaborating with Engineering and Product to conceptualize, design, and prototype innovative, highly usable applications, including UI design patterns and frameworks for next-generation analytics applications. The UX Design Lead is responsible for guiding their design team in the development of highly interactive prototypes to demonstrate the product vision. There will be a need for close coordination with all relevant stakeholders to ensure that the designs can be adopted and extended across product suites. Principal Responsibilities And Essential Duties Develop and drive the design strategy for claims solutions. Manage/build a design team, establishing design standards, training, and supporting the team in UX best practices. Work cross-functionally to plan, prioritize, and deliver information architecture, information design, visual design/page layouts, tools, services and applications to support a complete and cohesive user experience. Leverage modern web technologies to define innovative user interfaces and interaction models that result in improved user productivity and operational efficiency. Work closely with key stakeholders to communicate design strategy and underlying design rational. Collaborate with product teams and follow Verisk corporate design guidelines to develop UI common components and design patterns for the next-generation application suite. Make understanding end-user requirements a constant priority. Educate internal teams on best practices around information architecture, interaction and visual designs, usability and supporting technologies. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in design complex enterprise level desktop and web applications. Created seamless and consistent user experiences. People management experience required Track record of developing and delivering successful, intuitive, and compelling designs that contribute toward market leadership. Successful track record of delivering integrated, high-end user interfaces on schedule, on budget, and with exceptional quality. Deep knowledge of user-center design processes and methodologies. Experience with WCAG Broad knowledge and skills in visual design, information architecture, usability evaluation, and related UX methodologies. Solid understanding of interactive web technologies (Mobile Web, HTML5/CSS, DHTML, JavaScript, Flash, Flex, Ajax, Mashups) and industry trends and experience designing applications leveraging these trends. Experience gathering and documenting business, functional, and end user requirements.  Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to successfully develop and deliver shipping products. Experience in creating both low- and high-fidelity wireframes (from sketching to interactive prototypes). Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Job Description Position Summary We are looking for a candidate (Linux admin/AWS Devops) to design, implement, support, administer and maintain NoSQL Databases in AWS Cloud, who is willing to learn NoSQL and distributed databases administration on the job. Responsibilities Create, Manage, Monitor, and Maintain multiple NoSQL databases, such as Elasticsearch, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redi, Solr, etc. Work with development teams to design and implement optimized databases Work on new and existing logical/physical database designs for applications and infrastructure. Support application development for problem solving and performance tuning. Assist in administering, monitoring, and maintaining availability and scalability requirements of databases. Qualifications Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field required. 3+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. 3+ years of experience in Python or any other programming language 2+ years of proven experience with AWS Cloud. Skills And Knowledge Must be able to write and debug code in Python (preferred) or any other programming language. Experience in managing Linux servers, debugging, and troubleshoot issues; must be familiar with Linux command line tools Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) – EC2, S3, ASG, CloudFormation. etc. Familiarity with data modeling, Rest API, and client server model. Eagerness to learn new skills, adapt to continuously changing technology and take ownership Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision and work well with others Understanding of distributed database, availability, and scalability model Knowledge in any NoSQL databases and its internals is a plus. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Apply a formal structured methodology to guide an incident through its lifecycle with a consistent level of quality. Formally track and document incident response efforts as part of the cyber incident lifecycle including Root-Cause identification and post-incident activities Serve as incident commander during small and medium scale incidents as well as subject matter expert during large scale incident response scenarios Follow through with the tracking and execution of Lessons Learned and Post incident activities portion of the Incident Response Process Collaborate with other members of the Threat Management Team regarding SIEM correlation tuning opportunities and Threat Intelligence efforts. Provide SME support and training to junior members of the team. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related sciences preferred. Master’s degree in Information Security a plus. 5+ years of information security experience or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience. Must have industry-recognized certifications such as GCIH, GCFA, GCFE, GREM. Networking, Cloud, and other certifications a plus. Must have strong knowledge of Operating Systems, Networking, Information Systems and Technology, Cloud, and Virtualization Concepts as well as strong knowledge of common security tools including SIEM, EDR, IPS, Forensic Tools Proven skills in various elements of incident response including but not limited to computer intrusion investigations and digital forensics in enterprise environments as well as a thorough understanding of attacker methodologies and TTPs. Advanced understanding of information security governance concepts including security incident response plans and cyber security incident management including proficiency with leading SIEM, EDR, eDiscovery, and forensic analysis tools. Demonstrated ability to communicate complex subjects regarding strategic and tactical processes of incident response to stakeholders of varying technical levels. Must be able to multi-task and work independently, or with a team, on moderate to complex assignments using independent professional discretion and judgment as well as transition quickly between projects. Job Description Underwriting Solutions, a Verisk business, is looking to advance a high-powered product suite into the future. This product suite is focused on the P&C insurance market with a heavy focus on core insurance products, data analytics driven through large-scale data assets, and associated internal and external facing technology infrastructure. We are embarking on a multi-year journey to modernize the product suite, architecture, and associated technology/infrastructure. This individual will be responsible for collaborating across the organization to document and gather critical current state information and improvement opportunities and apply their knowledge of carrier processes and financial goals to ultimately craft suggestions/recommendations that will enable our customer to integrate our offerings into their normal workflow and make better decisions. The successful candidate will collaborate with key leaders and subject matter experts to gain consensus on a path forward and will demonstrate the ability to create and define a pilot execution plan that includes key activities, key deliverables, and key performance indicators. As such, the candidate will balance a strategic mindset with achieving results. Qualifications 3+ years of P&C insurance carrier experience in Product Management, Product Development, Underwriting or Actuarial Pricing preferred Strong knowledge of ISO core lines products (rate, rules, forms) 2- 4 years management consulting in the insurance industry or internal insurance carrier strategy experience Track record in Strategy, Product Development, Customer Journey Management or Digital Transformation projects Experience performing current state analysis and formulating strategic action plans based on results and future state goals Working knowledge or experience with repositioning products to showcase their powerful relevance for the future Demonstrated history of building consensus across business areas and other stakeholders to support new ways of thinking about product capability and value Attributes And Skills Passionate about solving challenges and building fresh and disruptive products/services Strategic thinker – understands how to structure problem statements/improvement opportunities and develops solutions to account for barriers and dependencies while creating short, medium and long term benefits Collaboration – possess the ability to share knowledge and take in new knowledge/information Applies knowledge of carrier business/financial key performance indicators to recommended actions/solutions Appreciation for nuance of customer/ user experience; ability to think through how to utilize feedback and other data Serves as an advocate for the customer and pursues products/services that promote ease of doing business and delivery of information that enables improved decision making Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. About The Role Job Description Verisk is seeking a talented content strategist with superior creativity and writing ability to join its marketing team. This role will focus on the translating our key capabilities into unifying themes that will rally and align our marketing efforts to drive Verisk into the hearts and minds of key audiences. The individual will define and help promote the themes that impact our industries to position Verisk as a key thought leader and value provider in these critical areas by authoring content that tells an ongoing thematic story authentic to the Verisk brand. This critical role will be responsible for developing the brand vocabulary that will position Verisk as the leading provider of technology-driven data analytic solutions serving key industries including insurance, and communicate our vision to stakeholders including customers, internal audiences, potential employees, analyst firms, and investors. This role is based at Verisk headquarters in Jersey City, NJ and allows for a hybrid work schedule (two days a week in office.) Job Responsibilities Lead annual macro themes process from research, recommendation, approval and execution. Consistently revisit to ensure ongoing importance and “so-what” for key stakeholders Own the macro themes editorial calendar and partner with key contributors to ensure a steady stream of relevant content that drives brand awareness and advocacy Partner with the business to translate themes into as it connects with go-to-market strategies (internal and external) to ensure we are providing unified messaging Write a wide range of communications that support the brand team’s needs Be a strong advocate for brand voice, tone, and style requirements Communicate and collaborate across teams and with senior leadership Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required in business, marketing or related field Related marketing experience o 8+ years professional content/copywriting experience either inhouse or at an agency o Global B2B experience preferred o Deep understanding of and demonstrable ability to communicate corporate brand positioning Exceptional writing skills An in-depth understanding of brand vocabulary, an ear for language, and knack for writing pithy, insightful copy that connects with customers and succinctly, yet powerfully, communicates brand o Portfolio that demonstrates strong conceptual thinking o Strategic writer who has demonstrated prior success developing theme-based content o Able to express ideas clearly, succinctly, and compellingly, with excellent command of syntax and grammar. Data-driven mindset Strong analytical mind to architect a measurable, outcome-based deliverable Strategy driven execution Someone who is always aligning tasks and activities with targeted outcomes Excellent organizational skills and a metrics driven mindset B2B marketing experience, with technology and insurance industry experience a plus Superior critical thinking skills Skills Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed and motivated; demonstrates endurance Collaborative: demonstrated ability to nurture strong relationships with key stakeholders Creative thinker: able to quickly shift gears and create experiences applicable for different audiences, with different needs #Hybrid Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We’re looking for an ambitious and driven Product Marketing Strategist ready to apply their expertise in marketing strategy and execution for a marketing team within a fast-paced publicly traded company. You’ll have a proven track record in developing, managing, and reporting on marketing campaigns and offering marketing solutions to stakeholders across solutions/products to meet revenue goals. In addition, you’ll exhibit a deep understanding of markets and customers to devise and lead a product’s go-to-market strategy and demonstrate excellent leadership and project management skills. The Product Marketing Strategist will define a marketing strategy and roadmap for solutions for Claims Marketing. You’ll be working with a group of accomplished high-level professionals while deepening your knowledge and skills with an ever-expanding breadth of projects and the opportunity to make independent decisions. You’ll apply your talent in communicating the value of Verisk solutions and enjoy collaborating and building relationships with colleagues and clients. Responsibilities Market & Competitive Intelligence – Understand market and competitive intelligence to develop insights and strategies that inform product positioning and direction Customer Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, buyer needs and the purchasing decision process for the product, including key buyer roles (Product) Strategy – Define the market opportunity for a product through demonstrated knowledge of business goals for the product (product portfolio & roadmap, innovation plans, pricing models, etc.) Marketing Strategy – Deliver ongoing marketing planning process inclusive of objectives, strategies, tactics, budget, and measurement that secures BU leader and CMO approval Messaging & Positioning - Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates Verisk’s Claims Solutions in the market Sales enablement – Work with the product team to develop sales collateral to enable effective selling, and other on-demand materials in support of sales efforts. Campaign Development - Conceive of, lead, and launch innovative, integrated, and multimedia marketing campaigns to include email marketing, digital content, web landing pages, online advertising, podcasts, video, advertising, social media, etc. Deliver superior creative briefs that compel outstanding creative development. Marketing Analytics - Monitor and report on the performance of products in the market and communicate the results of related sales and marketing efforts Thought Leader - Serve as internal and market-facing SME/thought leader for the product Qualifications BA in marketing, communications, or related field. 5 to 8 years of strategic marketing and/or marketing/product management experience Demonstrated success with marketing strategy development and implementation across multiple channels. Clear understanding of the digital marketing landscape: marketing automation; demand generation; personalization; sales enablement/effectiveness; attribution reporting; campaign management Skilled at writing and socializing product-level documents: marketing plan, sales enablement plan, launch plan, solution handbook Successful track-record of cross-functional collaboration with teams, contributors, and stakeholders across multiple seniority levels Detail oriented with strong analytical and business problem-solving skills, including financial analysis, ROI analysis, and customer segmentation. Data-driven and results-oriented, with a perspective on how to measure and evaluate metrics for pre and post product launch, and define and measure metrics to measure the impact of marketing efforts Ability to rapidly prioritize and react to changing business needs and external market dynamics Skills Innovative and creative thinker: pioneer who embraces bold ideas Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: works quickly and nimbly; able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed, and motivated; demonstrates endurance #hybrid Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

jobTitle: Marketing Strategist, Partner and Analyst Engagement
jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Verisk is seeking a key member of the marketing team to assume responsibility for our partnership and analyst engagement. The individual will build a new function in marketing to optimize our relationships with these important stakeholders through engagement with our product and marketing teams and our global business unit leadership. In this inaugural role the individual will need to understand our business and marketing goals and how these channels can empower them. They will leverage excellent strategy, communications and execution skills to drive plans to successful outcomes. And they will need to work collaboratively across the business with the various thought leaders and business partners who have a strong role in success achievement. The role is based in one of our primary offices - New York (Jersey City, NJ), Boston or Salt Lake City (Lehi, UT). Verisk offers a hybrid work environment with in-office work at least 2 days/week. Job Responsibilities Deliver the strategy across all aspects of Verisk partner engagement from market research, to thought leadership opportunities to shaping the overall analyst and partner relationship Articulating the strategy thru a plan that includes a budget and program calendar Create a systematic, process-driven approach to partnerships across Verisk, including the development of near- and long-term goals for current partnerships. Analyze and recommend optimal engagement across each industry analyst and partner opportunity; provide on-going consideration into each organization and how to adapt for Verisk’s current, and future brand positioning Lead and secure internal and external stakeholders support that achieves strong analyst and partner engagement Collaborating across the entire marketing organization, with focus on Experiential and Communications teams to deliver a differentiated, exceptional Verisk experience Work with our alliance partner team to provide resources and support to enhance this important channel. Assist with industry, customer, and business analysis activities to enhance our overall analyst strategy to support marketing plans and strategies. Perform in-depth analyses, create and define metrics, measure performance, and develop insights to support and inform marketing plans. This includes development of competitive and customer insights and reporting. Qualifications An advanced degree and/or an MBA is preferred but not required Related marketing experience 5+ years of experience in B2B marketing program development and partnership management o Experience in developing and managing large-scale partner and/or industry association engagement including market research projects, tradeshows, whitepapers and grassroots initiatives Experience with business analytics, and business intelligence in the B2B space Demonstrated success in managing and optimizing partnerships and influencer groups such as analysts.
