Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Join us! Verisk is hiring for a Marketing Strategist for our Underwriting unit. In this role you will be responsible for marketing strategy development and implementation across multiple channels. The successful candidate will be responsible for market & competitive intelligence including understanding the market and competitive intelligence to develop insights and strategies that inform product positioning and direction. The day to day responsibilities of this role include: Customer Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, buyer needs and the purchasing decision process for the product, including key buyer roles (Product) Strategy – Define the market opportunity for a product through demonstrated knowledge of business goals for the product (product portfolio & roadmap, innovation plans, pricing models, etc.) Marketing Strategy – Deliver ongoing marketing planning process inclusive of objectives, strategies, tactics, budget, and measurement that secures BU leader and CMO approval Messaging & Positioning - Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates (insert product/lob) in the market Sales enablement – Work with the product team to develop sales collateral to enable effective selling, and other on-demand materials in support of sales efforts. Campaign Development - Conceive of, lead, and launch innovative, integrated, and multimedia marketing campaigns to include email marketing, digital content, web landing pages, online advertising, podcasts, video, advertising, social media, etc. Deliver superior creative briefs that compel outstanding creative development. Marketing Analytics - Monitor and report on the performance of products in the market and communicate the results of related sales and marketing efforts Thought Leader - Serve as internal and market-facing SME/thought leader for the product Market & Competitive Intelligence – Understand market and competitive intelligence to develop insights and strategies that inform product positioning and direction Customer Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, buyer needs and the purchasing decision process for the product, including key buyer roles (Product) Strategy – Define the market opportunity for a product through demonstrated knowledge of business goals for the product (product portfolio & roadmap, innovation plans, pricing models, etc.) Qualifications BA in marketing, communications, or related field. 5 to 8 years of strategic marketing and/or marketing/product management experience Demonstrated success with marketing strategy development and implementation across multiple channels. Clear understanding of the digital marketing landscape: marketing automation; demand generation; personalization; sales enablement/effectiveness; attribution reporting; campaign management Skilled at writing and socializing product-level documents: marketing plan, sales enablement plan, launch plan, solution handbook Successful track-record of cross-functional collaboration with teams, contributors, and stakeholders across multiple seniority levels Detail oriented with strong analytical and business problem-solving skills, including financial analysis, ROI analysis, and customer segmentation. Data-driven and results-oriented, with a perspective on how to measure and evaluate metrics for pre and post product launch, and define and measure metrics to measure the impact of marketing efforts Ability to rapidly prioritize and react to changing business needs and external market dynamic #hybrid Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are seeking Medical Analysts with experience in reviewing medical treatment related to injury claims. This includes experience in medical reviews or utilization reviews, preparing chronologies, analyzing treatment in medical claims and medical bill reviews. Experience in reviews on behalf of insurance carriers or defense counsel is a plus. Strong writing skills, analysis skills and application of guidelines are required for this position. Medical Analysts will work closely with our attorneys and other members of the medical team to prepare chronologies and provide an analysis of treatment/medical bills for appropriateness under medical guidelines and standards. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Through a review of relevant medical files and related documentation, provides a chronology, analysis and medical bill review and cost projection for injuries cases consistent with the current guidelines Collaborates with a team of attorneys and medical professionals in identifying mitigating issues for injury claims Uses ISO Claims Partners proprietary information technology tools to identify diagnoses and treatment guidelines when applicable Provides additional professional analysis and recommendations as needed This is a full-time position, but additional hours may be required during peak time Occasional travel (<10% of the time) Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Bachelor’s Degree, Associate Degree or Diploma in Nursing 3-5 years’ experience in Nursing RN license in good standing with the applicable Board of Nursing Experience in preparing medical review reports, medical bill reviews and utilization reviews in injury cases Certification in any of the following, including but not limited to: Legal Nurse Consulting, Rehabilitation Counseling, Disability Management, Utilization Review, Life Care Planning, Medical Coding, Case Management a plus Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills including report preparation preferred Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team Ability to gather data, compile and synthesize information, including medical information, claims payment histories and billing, to identify level and types of services utilization Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. This includes reviewing records, preparing the narrative and an appropriate allocation for medical treatment and prescription medications. Candidates will demonstrate knowledge of CMS policies related to preparing MSAs. Strong writing skills, analysis skills and application of guidelines are required for this position. Medical Analysts will work closely with our attorneys and other members of the medical team to prepare Medicare Set-Asides and Medical Cost Projections. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Through a review of relevant medical files and related documentation, provides a narrative and cost projection for future treatment related to Workers Compensation and Liability injuries consistent with the current guidelines Collaborates with a team of attorneys and medical professionals in identifying negotiating and documenting guidelines and cost reductions on future treatment plans Uses ISO Claims Partners proprietary information technology tools to identify diagnoses, treatment guidelines, and prescription medication pricing, and documents the case when applicable Provides additional analysis and medical recommendations as needed Identifies cost drivers and cost savings opportunities on all files and completes client specific -cost mitigation activities on files where applicable This is a full-time position, but additional hours may be required during peak time Occasional travel (<10% of the time) Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Bachelor’s Degree, Associate Degree or Diploma in Nursing required 3-5 years’ experience in Nursing preferred Registered Nurse (RN) license in good standing with applicable Board of Nursing required Experience in preparing medical review reports, medical bill reviews and utilization reviews in injury cases preferred Certification in any of the following preferred: Medicare Set-aside Certified Consultant (MSCC), Life Care Planner (CLCP or CNLCP), Certified Case Manager (CCM), Medical Coding, Legal Nurse Consulting, Rehabilitation Counseling, Disability Management, Utilization Review Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills including report preparation preferred Ability to work effectively both independently and as a Job Description Do you have a passion for math and the sciences? Do concepts in data engineering and data science interest you? Does the opportunity to learn and validate the recent developments in the science and the engineering behind catastrophe modeling interest you? Well, we have a great opportunity for you that will have you work with the best, and develop you to take ownership of various projects and processes. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Author and present technical documents of analytical work Drive development of detailed test plans and timely execution and delivery of multiple products that have concurrent schedules Responsible to prepare technical model studies and requirements documents Perform advanced statistical and mathematical insurance analytics tasks to validate model outputs and complete such projects with minimal supervision Ensure that products meet exacting requirements for accuracy and explicit and/or implicit validation of scientific and financial algorithms Design and implement key quality metrics to track progress, provide status and enable transparency and timeliness in the product delivery decision making process Implement and/or expand use of automated testing practices throughout the software development life cycle Collaborate with peer teams to facilitate timely completion of projects Ability to multitask and manage concurrent delivery of multiple enterprise grade products Qualifications Undergraduate or Graduate degree in engineering, science, or mathematics Proven experience with large data sets analysis and manipulation Strong exploratory data analysis and data visualization skills Experience with either statistical, mathematical software packages; or generally with analytical software Experience with designing and/or validating numerical probabilistic models in engineering, science, catastrophe modeling, finance, actuarial science, etc. Programming skills that include: numerical, scientific and databases programming Proven analytical and problem-solving quantitative abilities Excellent attention to detail and experience working in distributed with diverse cultural backgrounds Superior verbal and written communication skills to interface with cross-functional teams that are talented, culturally diverse, global and widely varying technical skill sets Knowledge of product development life cycles to ensure the critical role of quality assurance teams Logical and clear thinker having made sound process-driven decisions Experience with writing complex queries, understanding relational databases and table structures is a plus 2-4 years or more of relevant experience Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description We are seeking an MSP Compliance Advisor for our Allocation Solutions Department. In this role, you will be responsible for preparing Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) products and consulting with adjusters, attorneys and Medicare on issues related to workers’ compensation and liability cases. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes individual accountability with the support of a team structure, come join us! About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Consult with adjusters, defense attorneys, claimant attorneys and Medicare on all Medicare issues relative to workers’ compensation and liability cases. Prepare MSP related products for assigned clients. Educate clients and third parties on the Medicare Secondary Payer statute through conference calls and client visits. Provide timely and efficient responses to all client needs, including, but not limited to general subject matter questions, case status requests, and case specific questions. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Detail oriented, organized and quality focused Advanced customer service and communication skills, both verbal and written Excellent technical skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Able to work independently, self-directed, highly motivated Desire to work in a fast-paced, professional environment Flexible and adaptable 1-2 years’ experience JD required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Working as a Data Scientist at Verisk means: Being part of and contributing to a large, vibrant community of Data Scientists working in P&C Insurance, Life Insurance, Energy, Financial Services, Environmental Health and Safety, and Geopolitical Security Applying a variety of analytic methodologies including Predictive Modeling, Machine Learning, Forecasting, Network Analytics, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, and Voice and Speech Analytics to develop solutions to business problems Working with a diverse set of extremely rich datasets such as 19 billion detailed records of insurance premiums collected and losses paid, 90%+ of Insurance Claims in the US, and billions of photos of insurance losses Seeing your work result in new products, product enhancements, consulting revenue, or internal process improvements on a regular basis Working with cutting-edge technology, and continuously developing new skills and capabilities Working In Verisk’s Insurance Claims Group Involves Forming part of an Analytics Center of Excellence who build AI and machine learning products for Verisk’s P&C insurance claims vertical worldwide Developing analytics solutions that help make millions of people financially whole more quickly after suffering losses such as house fires, auto accidents, hailstorms, hurricanes, injuries at work, and more Working on state of the art AI solutions that sit at the core of market-leading products used by thousands of insurance professionals and consumers. Green-field disruption of legacy process and systems as you work on a wide variety of technologies and products from fraud detection to deep learning Specific Responsibilities As a Lead Data Scientist on the NLP team, you will be responsible for constantly pushing our NLP-based solution for medical insurance claims handling to the cutting edge. Build machine learning and/or deep learning models for named entity recognition, information retrieval, document classification, text summarization, automated speech recognition, etc. to automate medical claims processes As a senior team member working with minimal supervision, lead initiatives that apply the latest in NLP and Deep Learning research to real-world AI problems that directly impact our products and customers Share important methodologies, advances, and best practices from your research and work among the whole analytic community Qualifications Graduate degree (M.S. required, Ph.D. preferred) in a quantitative discipline 4+ years professional experience building machine learning and deep learning models in NLP Exposure to the property & casualty industry is desirable, and experience with medical, clinical, fraud & abuse and pharmacy data analytics is a big plus Ability to lead projects from model design to deployment Proficient with NLP models for classification, information retrieval, recommender systems, NER, text summarization etc. Experience working with large datasets Experience with deep learning libraries such as Tensorflow and PyTorch Extensive experience in Python programming Understanding of RDBMs and interactive SQL programming skills are a must Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark and Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.) Experience with Git, JIRA, and basic software development best practices is required Aptitude for picking up new technologies is expected Strong communication skills Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Position Summary We are looking for a candidate (Linux admin/AWS DevOps) to design, implement, support, administer and maintain NoSQL Databases in AWS Cloud, who is willing to learn NoSQL and distributed databases administration on the job. Responsibilities Create, Manage, Monitor, and Maintain multiple NoSQL databases, such as Elasticsearch, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redi, Solr, etc. Work with development teams to design and implement optimized databases Work on new and existing logical/physical database designs for applications and infrastructure. Support application development for problem solving and performance tuning. Assist in administering, monitoring, and maintaining availability and scalability requirements of databases. Qualifications Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field required. 3+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. 3+ years of experience in Python or any other programming language 2+ years of proven experience with AWS Cloud. Skills And Knowledge Must be able to write and debug code in Python (preferred) or any other programming language. Experience in managing Linux servers, debugging, and troubleshoot issues; must be familiar with Linux command line tools Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) – EC2, S3, ASG, CloudFormation. etc. Familiarity with data modeling, Rest API, and client server model. Eagerness to learn new skills, adapt to continuously changing technology and take ownership Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision and work well with others Understanding of distributed database, availability, and scalability model Knowledge in any NoSQL databases and its internals is a plus. Job Description Position Summary We are looking for a candidate (Linux admin/AWS Devops) to design, implement, support, administer and maintain NoSQL Databases in AWS Cloud, who is willing to learn NoSQL and distributed databases administration on the job. Responsibilities Create, Manage, Monitor, and Maintain multiple NoSQL databases, such as Elasticsearch, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redi, Solr, etc. Work with development teams to design and implement optimized databases Work on new and existing logical/physical database designs for applications and infrastructure. Support application development for problem solving and performance tuning. Assist in administering, monitoring, and maintaining availability and scalability requirements of databases. Qualifications Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field required. 3+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. 3+ years of experience in Python or any other programming language 2+ years of proven experience with AWS Cloud. Skills And Knowledge Must be able to write and debug code in Python (preferred) or any other programming language. Experience in managing Linux servers, debugging, and troubleshoot issues; must be familiar with Linux command line tools Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) – EC2, S3, ASG, CloudFormation. etc. Familiarity with data modeling, Rest API, and client server model. Eagerness to learn new skills, adapt to continuously changing technology and take ownership Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision and work well with others Understanding of distributed database, availability, and scalability model Knowledge in any NoSQL databases and its internals is a plus. jobTitle: P&C Data Management Solutions Consultant, Client Success
jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description The Consultant, Client Success (P&C Data Management Solutions) role will act as a consultant between Verisk and our clients and provide professional client services and support. You will drive collaborative and consultative support through all phases of the client engagement cycle. Key activities include helping to drive pipeline, sales and client engagement strategy; collaborating with teams of subject matter experts and stakeholders; and developing and refining processes to gather client information on current state operations and results. You will consult on best practices which address client needs by integrating and operationalizing Verisk data management and statistical data reporting solutions. You will serve as a conduit between clients and internal partners such as Product and Sales Leadership, Data Management Operations and IT Development. Responsibilities & Essential Duties About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role Consultative Support – acting as a business subject matter expert - through all phases of the sales cycle, gathering client information on current state operations and results Provide recommendations for future state best practices operationalizing Verisk solutions The candidate will collaborate and drive engagement strategy, presales messaging and approach, and provide impactful product demonstrations for potential clients in client sales meetings, at trade shows, and for executive presentations related to solution value Develop a meticulous understanding of Verisk-ISO solutions and services The successful candidate will continuously monitor and evaluate existing client needs while working closely with the Product Management and Sales teams for successful client implementations and client account stewardship This position plays a key role in gathering suggested product enhancements from clients for feedback for the Product Owners and Developers In collaboration with Sales, the role will be responsible for assembling key information and delivering high-level executive presentations to align solution opportunities with client organizational goals Provide support in the construction of contracts and work agreements Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned Regular travel required approximately 15-20% Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Required Skills Leadership or comparable experience in a similar industry focused on data management and analytics Proven experience implementing data management and reporting solutions at scale, and knowledge of the insurance data lifecyle Experience in consultative engagements with client business and technology stakeholders Proven ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams Demonstrated effectiveness and strong communication skills, both written and oral Superior public speaking and presentation skills in both sales support and training environments. Ability and experience with tailoring messages to all levels of the organization from individual contributors to executives Provide extraordinary client support with a passionate commitment Excellent computer skills, especially with MS Windows and Office. Excel and PowerPoint skills required Encouraged Skills Business consulting experience Significant P&C insurance industry experience Experience with data management and ISO statistical reporting implementation projects is highly desirable Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing) preferred but not essential Product Development experience preferred but not essential Knowledge of ISO Underwriting and Rating Products is a plus Insurance association memberships and/or certifications a plus (for example: AIDA, CPCU, IDMA) Minimal Education And Training Requirements 4-year college degree or equivalent experience Eight plus years’ experience in insurance data system integration and modernization projects, with a strong focus on process optimization, data quality enhancement and successful data delivery Knowledge of insurance data operations, regulatory compliance and information management Knowledge of insurance data and analytic technique Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Draft policy language and develop manual rules that guide insurers in issuing and rating policies, and also develop related information, including filings and announcements to customers.  Review laws, regulations and case law for impact on ISO products and insurer procedures. Develop policy language and rules for major program updates that provide valuable insurance enhancements to products used by the entire insurance industry. Review state laws and requirements and make revisions to ensure program updates are compliant and relevant in each state. Leverage insurance expertise and researching skills to provide timely, thoughtful responses to insurer inquires over a wide range of insurance topics. Develop and present items to panels of insurers on emerging trends and potential revisions. Collaborate with all stakeholders including Product Development, Law Department, Government Relations, Actuarial, etc., inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Work in conjunction with the Product Development team to research and review new products, consider impact on other products, and collaborate with others in bringing products to market. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. At least two years of P&C insurance experience with product development, claims, underwriting, and/or submitting filings with insurance regulators. Experience analyzing and developing forms, rules, and/or ratings preferred.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail. Strong organization, research, and analytic skills. Ability to both work independently and collaborate in a team environment. Knowledge of ISO commercial liability/casualty insurance line procedures is a plus.  CPCU or RPLU exam study or completion is a plus. Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description Verisk Insurance Solutions is a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, Verisk provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. Verisk serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. If you are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and enjoy working in the field and meeting people, then we have a terrific position for you to conduct commercial property inspections in the Charlottesville, VA area. Your Major Responsibilities Will Involve Conducting Comprehensive Studies Of Consults with clients to conduct, analyze and document studies of communications resources and procedures relating to dispatch of fire alarms; fire department equipment, staffing, training and geographic distribution; water supply networks, including hydraulic analysis of water system capability; and building information pertaining to PPC requirements. Completes verifications in the office and in the field and plans trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Conducts studies to determine complex and moderately complex community hazard mitigation gradings as assigned and prepares appropriate reports in accordance with corporate standards. May assist in coordinating meetings with local officials in small group and/or workshop formats and may offer information or advice as requested. Provides customer support for Verisk products through on-site visits as needed. May serve as a mentor and trainer to less experienced staff as needed. Maintains corporate standards of quality, timeliness, productivity and customer service. Maintains CHM equipment and supplies in accordance with Verisk policies. Qualifications We are looking for individuals who possess some of the following knowledge and skills, and/or experience: Bachelor’s degree/ life experience in a technical discipline or equivalent experience preferred and one year of experience in fire/property insurance, fire protection services or engineering. Field experience performing detailed analyses preferred. Satisfactory completion of prescribed in-house training or equivalent required and demonstrated ability to perform all field work assignments at this grade level. Ability to observe, examine, measure, analyze, map, gather data, and describe all aspects of a community’s fire protection capability and safely operate a vehicle to and from all sites. This will involve occasional lifting of up to 40 lbs. and regular climbing of stairs and ladders, working in all types of neighborhoods and environments. It may be necessary to drive a vehicle for extended periods of time. Good customer service and one-on-one interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate ideas and concepts clearly and provide constructive feedback. Ability to conduct on-the-job training. Good verbal and written communication skills. Ability to conduct public speaking engagements on discipline to groups of all sizes. Adequate technical proficiency and communication skills to represent Verisk in trade group settings. Knowledge and experience resulting in demonstrated proficiency with personal computers and Microsoft applications. Valid driver’s license and maintenance of satisfactory driving record in accordance with company policies. Overnight and/or air travel (in and out of state) may be required. If this opportunity looks exciting and challenging to you, please submit your application below! Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice

Completes verifications in the office and in the field and plans trips to ensure efficient, cost effective and timely completion of work. Conducts studies to determine complex and moderately complex community hazard mitigation gradings as assigned and prepares appropriate reports in accordance with corporate standards. May assist in coordinating meetings with local officials in small group and/or workshop formats and may offer information or advice as requested. Provides customer support for Verisk products through on-site visits as needed. May serve as a mentor and trainer to less experienced staff as needed. Maintains corporate standards of quality, timeliness, productivity and customer service. Maintains CHM equipment and supplies in accordance with Verisk policies. Qualifications We are looking for individuals who possess some of the following knowledge and skills, and/or experience: Bachelor’s degree/ life experience in a technical discipline or equivalent experience preferred and one year of experience in fire/property insurance, fire protection services or engineering. Field experience performing detailed analyses preferred. Satisfactory completion of prescribed in-house training or equivalent required and demonstrated ability to perform all field work assignments at this grade level. Ability to observe, examine, measure, analyze, map, gather data, and describe all aspects of a community’s fire protection capability and safely operate a vehicle to and from all sites. This will involve occasional lifting of up to 40 lbs. and regular climbing of stairs and ladders, working in all types of neighborhoods and environments. It may be necessary to drive a vehicle for extended periods of time. Good customer service and one-on-one interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate ideas and concepts clearly and provide constructive feedback. Ability to conduct on-the-job training. Good verbal and written communication skills. Ability to conduct public speaking engagements on discipline to groups of all sizes. Adequate technical proficiency and communication skills to represent Verisk in trade group settings. Knowledge and experience resulting in demonstrated proficiency with personal computers and Microsoft applications. Valid driver’s license and maintenance of satisfactory driving record in accordance with company policies. Overnight and/or air travel (in and out of state) may be required. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Join our growing Research and Modeling department as a member of our Boston-based wildfire modeling team. You will work with the team to develop, optimize, and deploy advanced computational models that simulate fire ignition, spread, and penetration into the wildland-urban interface at meter-scale resolution for millions of scenarios, and that describe the complex relationships between wildfire activity, weather/climate, fuels, and other factors. As a member of this collegial team, you will work closely with a range of stakeholders to (a) incorporate up-to-date scientific knowledge, data, and modeling approaches into our existing models; (b) develop new models and model components; and (c) deploy existing modeling technologies into new regions and/or for new applications. As a Principal Analyst, you will lead efforts to create the quality, large, high-resolution geospatial data sets necessary to characterize wildfire risk, using your skills to acquire, clean, analyze data and develop, test, and maintain data pipelines. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Understand the principles of our wildland fire models and how their components work together to assess model stability, sensitivity to key drivers (e.g., fuel type, weather), and convergence of output. Evaluate large datasets that describe processes and entities affecting wildfire behavior in multiple regions of the world. Build new data sets for characterizing wildfire activity, weather/climate, and fuels; lead efforts to develop, test, and maintain data pipelines. Integrate new climatological, wildfire fuel, and wildfire activity data into existing models and explain changes seen in modeled results. Analyze big data sets, including those that characterize fire risk factors and the resulting catalogs of model simulated fires, containing hundreds of millions of individual events. Collaborate closely within the wildfire modeling team and across teams focusing on vulnerability of structures to fire, geospatial data, software implementation, and others. Understand client needs and address those needs with our model products. Analyze and validate model solutions and perform sensitivity analyses to answer client questions and constrain uncertainty regarding their wildfire risk. Navigate and manage multiple code repositories, data sets, and data archives in order to maintain and update our models with appropriate approaches to archiving and version control. Prepare accurate and effective technical and non-technical documents describing modeling processes and results, both for client use and internal model improvement. Create and deliver presentations to coworkers, company management, and clients. Deliver results on time to meet project objectives. Qualifications Advanced skills in managing, processing, and analyzing large GIS datasets, with focus on raster creation and editing. Practical experience working with environmental GIS data: land use land cover, forestry, soil moisture, slope and aspect, and digital elevation models, etc. Demonstrated Python fluency to solve complex modeling challenges and automation, with emphasis on geospatial packages like ArcPy. Professional experience in either Esri or open-source GIS desktop software. Demonstrated ability to write clear, concise, and well-documented programming code. Experience with meteorological data a plus. Knowledge or experience with SQL syntax, C++, and/or R is a plus. Strong mathematical and/or statistical experience and practical experience developing new models and/or significant new components (e.g., advanced subroutines) in existing models. Ability to gather, understand, and critically analyze information from all relevant sources, such as historical fire/weather/climate databases, scientific papers, government reports, insurance data, etc. Demonstrated ability to learn new concepts and skills and to meet project objectives and deadlines. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Knowledge of the application of probabilistic modeling to (re)insurance applications and/or climate change science a plus. Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative field; minimum 5 years professional experience. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Principal Software Engineer Grow your career by becoming a member of AIR’s Software Development team. We are seeking an experienced, motivated Principal Software Engineer to participate in developing complex analytical software for catastrophe risk management within an Agile team. Your team will be responsible for work in all stages of SDLC, from reviewing requirements, architecture, to design, to develop and test, to deployment. We are looking for a candidate who can quickly pick up new technologies, respond quickly to change and adapt to changing requirements. Responsibilities Design and development of multi-tier applications for insurance industry from high-level architecture to user experience, database stored procedures, workflow, unit testing and end-to-end integration testing etc. Working from static application mockups and wireframes, developing end to end interface solutions. Architect, design, develop, and finalize functional and responsive applications by collaborating with other engineers in the Agile team and provide technical leadership and experience to the team(s). Help team(s) in building future cloud native solutions. Using automation and tooling to continuously improve the reliability, scalability, and velocity. Good knowledge of T-SQL and database programming with any RDMS system. Strong problem-solving skills, fast learner and keen to learn. Excellent listening skills, good written and verbal communication skills, enthusiasm, energy, and creativity. Qualifications B.S. in Math, CS or Software Engineering; M.S preferred. 8+ years of hands-on experience in development of SOA commercial-grade software products (C#, .NET, WPF, WCF). Experience with Microsoft High Performance computing (HPC). Experience with multi-threading and processing large volumes of data with high parallelized process. 2+ years of technical lead experience with architecting solutions. Experience in designing and developing cloud native products is a plus. Strong understanding of Agile process and best practices. Strong knowledge of latest technologies and trends. Ability to develop use-cases from business requirements. Ability to collaborate effectively with project stakeholders outside of Dev. group, especially with Product Management on feature requirements and project schedules. Ability to provide effective technical leadership and oversight to development team on a project, ensuring that software is developed in adherence to established architecture, design, quality standards, as well as delivery schedule. jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Initiate and lead technical and conceptual development of ISO policy forms, endorsements and related materials. Function as the strategic thought leader in your domain, using understanding of coverages, market, industry, legal, and regulatory trends, our customers, and our competitors to gauge impact on our insurance programs, provide actionable insights, and create new products and product enhancements. Maintain communication of ISO activity to customers and industry stakeholders. Prepare and present panel agenda and minutes material at panel meetings and other industry events. Analyze customer feedback in order to prepare meeting minutes and determine impact on proposed product changes. Collaborate with product strategy leaders and compliance experts to react to emerging trends and create new insurance products and related material. Foster client engagement through relationship-building efforts. Coordinate in-person visits and teleconferences to gain client input on and share knowledge with respect to ISO products and services Further ISO's position as thought leader by speaking and writing about ISO products, services and industry trends. Research and develop topic- and line-specific presentations and articles; collaborate with Law Department and ISO Marketing teams as appropriate Mentor less experienced staff as necessary, with regard to insurance-related topics and/or ISO internal systems and workflows Qualifications Minimum of 5 years of product development experience (Property Liability - Business Owners) or other insurance-related experience Bachelor's degree or related experience Highly organized, sharp individual with excellent interpersonal, communication and relationship building skills Excellent research and analytical skills with a very good knowledge of insurance industry trends and emerging issues Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills with internal and external personnel Excellent ability to work independently with proficiency Active Pursuit of CPCU designation or other insurance education preferred Able to travel up to 15% of the year Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Work with senior Product Leadership to evolve high-level strategic vision into actionable tactics that provide ClaimSearch users with an intuitive powerful efficient and personalized experience. Assist senior Product Leadership by participating in and ultimately assuming the following Agile activities: formulating and refining the business value proposition, requirements gathering, story writing, sprint backlog grooming, prioritization, and delivery of enhancement and new features to our ClaimSearch products. Assist in the management of the product roadmap, working collaboratively, communicating with and setting expectations with relevant stakeholders including the senior leadership team. Leverage data and analytics to inform decisions on the priority of stories in the product backlog. Data and analytics may come in the following forms: Customer focus groups, present state assessments, return on investment analysis, target revenue generation analysis, gathering customer sentiment, user behaviors analysis, and known software bugs. Employ constant customer listening, and natural curiosity to research and understand the latest trends. Know our user personas as well as our competition. Engage with customers directly and often. Proactively identify and resolve issues that may impair the organization’s ability to meet its strategic, financial, or technical goals. Become a subject matter expert for assigned ClaimSearch products and services. Promptly analyze escalated product issues and assign them to appropriate parties to ensure timely resolution. Work cross-functionally with other departments to ensure smooth delivery of product enhancements and features – including, but not limited to marketing, compliance, legal, customer support, training. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree. 2+ years of experience in product development role in an agile environment with increasing responsibility. 2+ years of experience in insurance claims, special investigations or equivalent a plus. Detail-oriented with ability to manage and execute simultaneous projects and tasks. Self-motivated with a high level of initiative. Comfortable working both independently and with a team. Advanced oral and written communication skills. Familiar with Agile methodologies. Demonstrated record of partnering with teams across the organization and influencing to achieve business results across multiple teams who may have competing goals. Demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts with technical and non-technical employees. Prior product innovation experience preferred. Familiarity with software development tools such as Confluence, leankit, and JIRA is a plus. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Principal Responsibilities and Essential Duties: Understand customer journeys, user personas, and jobs-to-be-done, and create tests to validate or disprove hypotheses. Contribute to the creation of wireframes, conceptual prototypes and/or mock-ups, and facilitate user testing of changes to assess potential value. Lead cross-functional teams and/or efforts to create new or enhance existing digital experiences that solve customer problems, improve an experience, or address an unmet or imperfectly/partially met customer need. Drive product development across software development and go-to-market cycles, including creating user stories and acceptance criteria. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders and subject matter experts in support of these efforts. Maintain solutions as assigned. Employ suitable frameworks and methodologies to identify opportunities for process learnings and operational improvements; contribute to the implementation of these efforts. Assess potential implications of changes on business rules, functions, and requirements. Conduct or coordinate market, competitive and customer research to identify and document customer needs for assigned ISOnet products, services, or segments. Determine near term strategy and roadmap for the same. Contribute specific understanding of assigned scope to the overall ISOnet product roadmap. Lead in the adoption and practice of Agile methodology and principles. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Requirements Qualifications The Product Manager serves as the product owner of and responsible party for one or more customer- and internal-facing products, services, and systems that comprise or support ISO digital platforms. They will conduct customer and market research and review and act on analytics to 1) ensure assigned products/services/systems meet or exceed established KPIs and 2) develop new products and enhancements that deliver additional customer value. The Product Manager will also drive aspects of go-to-market efforts and lead cross-functional teams to successful outcomes. The Product Manager is comfortable with ambiguity, embraces change, and exerts influence with their product team and customers. They will be familiar with data-driven decision making, quantitative and qualitative research techniques, and have a solid understanding of contemporary product, user experience, and technology best practices and tools. Product Managers contribute to the Digital Platforms team roadmap and develop subject matter expertise in assigned areas. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The ISO Underwriting unit of Verisk Insurance Solutions is hiring a Product Manager as part of the team developing and supporting ISO’s Electronic Rating Content (ERC) product. As a Product Manager at Verisk, you will be part of our Underwriting Products team, working closely with product managers, IT, customers, marketing and sales to enable success for our customers and drive the ERC product forward. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Serves as the focal point for on boarding new customers. Develop and implement strategies for expanding business opportunities with existing Customers. This includes developing account business plans, identifying sales opportunities, and implementing Customer strategies Keep management apprised of critical problems and the status of all assigned Customers/Partners. Support the pre-sales process to evaluate the effort to implement ISO products. Develop and manage Statements of Work and project scopes Provide regular reporting of billable hours and services revenue; ensure all targets are achieved Work with business development teams in the development, management and support of new Partners. Participate in other duties as assigned by the AMO Director and senior management. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role BS/BA or equivalent Proven background in effectively managing customer relationships and project teams Commercial auto trucking/transportation experience preferred MBA and/or prior product development/management experience preferred Highly motivated self starter, with strong analytical, inter-personal and leadership skills Technical skills which include competency with development environments and insurance software products Ability to garner attention and convey confidence in ability to teach and coach Customers/Partners Polished communication, presentation and leaderships qualities Ability to travel up to 75% for on-site customer visits Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.  Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.  At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. Job Description Manage day-to-day activities of a rapidly growing product line, including identifying and executing product enhancements, identifying, and analyzing data sources, building client and vendor relationships, and implementing marketing initiatives in support of carriers’ and distributors’ straight through processing with a focus on small commercial underwriting products Lead the product portion of sales opportunities to ensure effective positioning of the solution’s value proposition and customer comfort with the product capabilities to support the ambitious growth goals of the product line Liaise between product colleagues, marketing, and sales to ensure streamlined messaging driven by customer needs and how existing and emerging Verisk capabilities can solve these needs Provide industry thought leadership through white papers, articles, presentations, conferences, and customer conversations Qualifications 5 to 10 years of commercial insurance product, underwriting, and/or channel management experience Understands the basics of technology and the convergence of software and data in support of straight-through processing  Quantitative background with a focus on high-quality data and analytics  Prior product development/management experience preferred Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, including presentation skills. Ability to communicate effectively (verbally and in writing) with internal staff and external stakeholders Comfortable speaking in front of a room full of industry executives but can also dive into the details of a challenging quantitative problem to solve customer needs Strong critical thinking, analytical problem-solving, and negotiating skills; business creativity is a must Experience with Data & Analytics is a must 10% - 15% travel Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Can you lead the business discussions and demonstrate value proposition to clients about building and using catastrophe models? Be part of the team that can leverage your experience to address growing needs of our client base. As Product Manager of models within our Product Management team, you will be responsible to develop and drive the scope, execution and launch of one or more models. You will bring a customer focus to the complex process of building and releasing catastrophe models. Be a leader and drive the coordination of the release and acceptance of the model with large cross functional groups. Engage clients and consistently bring client focus to a process that is multi-year in nature. Work with key stakeholders to manage the goals, scope and launch of the model Work with diverse teams composed of some of the brightest minds in the industry The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in the insurance or risk management industry with a strong weather or geoscience and technology related background, a blend of business and techno-functional skills, and the ability to define a vision and make it a reality. You Will About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role Drive the model development process from beginning to end, starting with project definition and scope all the way to software release; create and maintain project scope, requirements and schedules; provide progress updates to stakeholders; review and provide feedback on testing strategies Engage with external clients regularly to understand the overall business value, gather requirements, feedback and detailed use cases Coordinate across multiple internal teams, including Product Management, QA, Software, Business Development, Client Services and Research Represent AIR as a domain expert in various internal and external venues Maintain and support models between updates; respond to internal and external client questions and issues Manage off cycle software releases as necessary Qualifications 5+ years insurance industry experience 3+ years working with CAT modeling products Demonstrated ability in managing long term complex projects that include cross functional teams to successful completion Ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously Excellent presentation skills, including the ability to articulate complex topics in a concise and easily understandable way Direct Product Management experience including Agile practices, preferred BS Degree in science, technical or related field (Master’s degree a plus) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Provide thought leadership based on experience with insurance and reinsurance terms, data coding challenges and risk modeling needs of the industry. Discover problems in the market with gaps in coding policies, financial modeling, and validating assumptions by interviewing customers, recent evaluators and untapped potential customers. Validate problems to show their pervasiveness in the market. Identify competitive and alternative offerings in the market. Assess their strengths and weaknesses. Develop a strategy for winning against the competition. Demonstrations, presentations and discussions with clients. Contribute to product roadmaps, ideate on product definition, create feature overviews and help with design, development and quality of products. Define pre-launch, post-launch and go to market phases and lead conversations on licensing, pricing, deployment for the initiative, function or product as needed. Advocate for best product management practices and process improvements. Qualifications At least 10+ years working in leadership role in catastrophe modeling workflows, strong actuarial background, ideally in different insurance/reinsurance companies or catastrophe modeling vendors. Strong understanding of insurance and/or reinsurance industry, particularly the use of financial models for quantification of catastrophe risk including related exposure data and financial terms. Proven ability to guide global teams and answer technical financial modeling questions. Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills. Ability to dig into details and understand the big picture. Willing to build expertise in all areas of product development: from domain, business, technology to design, from discovery and delivery to marketing and analytics. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We’re looking for an ambitious and driven Product Marketing Strategist ready to apply their expertise in marketing strategy and execution for a marketing team within a fast-paced publicly traded company. You’ll have a proven track record in developing, managing, and reporting on marketing campaigns and offering marketing solutions to stakeholders across solutions/products to meet revenue goals. In addition, you’ll exhibit a deep understanding of markets and customers to devise and lead a product’s go-to-market strategy and demonstrate excellent leadership and project management skills. The Product Marketing Strategist will define a marketing strategy and roadmap for solutions for Verisk’s underwriting business unit. You’ll be working with a group of accomplished high-level professionals while deepening your knowledge and skills with an ever-expanding breadth of projects and the opportunity to make independent decisions. You’ll apply your talent in communicating the value of Verisk solutions and enjoy collaborating and building relationships with colleagues and clients. Responsibilities Market & Competitive Intelligence – Understand market and competitive intelligence to develop insights and strategies that inform product positioning and direction Customer Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, buyer needs and the purchasing decision process for the product, including key buyer roles (Product) Strategy – Define the market opportunity for a product through demonstrated knowledge of business goals for the product (product portfolio & roadmap, innovation plans, pricing models, etc.) Marketing Strategy – Deliver ongoing marketing planning process inclusive of objectives, strategies, tactics, budget, and measurement that secures BU leader and CMO approval Messaging & Positioning - Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates (insert product/lob) in the market Sales enablement – Work with the product team to develop sales collateral to enable effective selling, and other on-demand materials in support of sales efforts. Campaign Development - Conceive of, lead, and launch innovative, integrated, and multimedia marketing campaigns to include email marketing, digital content, web landing pages, online advertising, podcasts, video, advertising, social media, etc. Deliver superior creative briefs that compel outstanding creative development. Marketing Analytics - Monitor and report on the performance of products in the market and communicate the results of related sales and marketing efforts Thought Leader - Serve as internal and market-facing SME/thought leader for the product Qualifications BA in marketing, communications, or related field. 5 to 8 years of strategic marketing and/or marketing/product management experience Demonstrated success with marketing strategy development and implementation across multiple channels. Clear understanding of the digital marketing landscape: marketing automation; demand generation; personalization; sales enablement/effectiveness; attribution reporting; campaign management Skilled at writing and socializing product-level documents: marketing plan, sales enablement plan, launch plan, solution handbook Successful track-record of cross-functional collaboration with teams, contributors, and stakeholders across multiple seniority levels Detail oriented with strong analytical and business problem-solving skills, including financial analysis, ROI analysis, and customer segmentation. Data-driven and results-oriented, with a perspective on how to measure and evaluate metrics for pre and post product launch, and define and measure metrics to measure the impact of marketing efforts Ability to rapidly prioritize and react to changing business needs and external market dynamics Skills Innovative and creative thinker: pioneer who embraces bold ideas Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: works quickly and nimbly; able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed, and motivated; demonstrates endurance #hybrid Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Attain and exceed assigned annual sales goals  Develop product and market expertise to be able to present/run meetings with prospective clients. Collaborate with Account team on regular basis to develop a customer target list and territory sales strategy plan with each Account Executive in order to achieve sales quota and corporate objectives Communicate in a timely and effective manner with prospects, customers, and project leads and within the Sales team Provide timely feedback to sales peers, sales leadership, product management and marketing on developing industry trends, new product ideas, and competitive intelligence  Guide product and marketing strategy, informed through voice of the customer Develop customized solution proposals and contractual agreements  Prepare periodic sales reports highlighting sales volume, potential opportunities, and client-based expansion Qualifications Minimum of 5 years of professional P&C insurance experience and/or sales support in a complex sales environment with emphasis on selling solutions and services to property casualty insurance writers    Has consistently demonstrated success in sales roles, including exceeding quota and account objectives. Proven successful sales (or product sales) history in insurance software, data, geospatial, and/or predictive modeling software solutions a plus  Self-starter with proven pre-sales or consulting experience in enterprise accounts and a proven track record of sales strategy, industry, and organizational leadership. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Job Description Attain and exceed assigned annual sales goals  Develop product and market expertise to be able to present/run meetings with prospective clients. Collaborate with Account team on regular basis to develop a customer target list and territory sales strategy plan with each Account Executive in order to achieve sales quota and corporate objectives Communicate in a timely and effective manner with prospects, customers, and project leads and within the Sales team Provide timely feedback to sales peers, sales leadership, product management and marketing on developing industry trends, new product ideas, and competitive intelligence  Guide product and marketing strategy, informed through voice of the customer Develop customized solution proposals and contractual agreements  Prepare periodic sales reports highlighting sales volume, potential opportunities, and client-based expansion Qualifications Minimum of 5 years of professional P&C insurance experience and/or sales support in a complex sales environment with emphasis on selling solutions and services to property casualty insurance writers    Has consistently demonstrated success in sales roles, including exceeding quota and account objectives. Proven successful sales (or product sales) history in insurance software, data, geospatial, and/or predictive modeling software solutions a plus  Self-starter with proven pre-sales or consulting experience in enterprise accounts and a proven track record of sales strategy, industry, and organizational leadership. Possess a structured approach to selling that includes strong prospecting skills and the ability to sell based on business value.  Ability to navigate across complex organizations in a trusted advisor/consultative approach Able to gain the buy-in of a diverse community of business stakeholders, technical teams, peers, and project managers Must possess outstanding listening skills and read and adapt to people with different organizational levels and functional responsibilities. Experience in building a wide range of decision influencers and the ability to coordinate and secure buy-in from internal stakeholders and motivators, including company executives.
