jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Work with development teams to successfully deliver projects within a specified timeline, budget and project plan Coordinate resources - across organizational boundaries where necessary - to ensure timely delivery of projects and manage project scope Assist development team through the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) where necessary, including (but not limited to) activities like acceptance testing and process facilitation, and determining suitable strategies and objectives needed to meet project goals Work with Product Manager/Director and customers to clarify project scope Maintain project stakeholders expectations to project status and updates Elicit, Raise/Identify and help resolve projects roadblocks from the development team to facilitate rapid delivery Clearly identify, document, communicate, and mitigate risks to project success Assist and coach Product Manager/Director in respect to refining, maintaining the product backlog and prioritization techniques Act as liaison to 3rd party vendors Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Are you an effective project manager with great agile skills? Do you enjoy coaching your teams to reach new levels of performance? Are you looking for a company that will help develop your skills? Do you want your work to feel meaningful? If you answered “yes” to each of these questions we’d love to talk to you! We are seeking highly talented scrum masters and agile project managers to join our PMO. We are implementing the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) in our organization and seek passionate team members to help us lead the change. Job Description Lead agile teams to successfully meet project objectives. Manage complex cross-team project initiatives. Facilitate agile ceremonies (such as standups, retrospectives, backlog grooming and planning sessions) to support the creation of project deliverables Model, mentor, and coach agile best practices to improve productivity and ensure operational excellence Coordinate resource needs across organizational boundaries Guide agile teams through a SDLC Ensure project work adheres to established standards and project governance requirements Work with a Product Manager and customers to clarify project scope and priority Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations Report and communicate the progress of agile teams to stakeholders Remove roadblocks from the agile team to facilitate rapid delivery Clearly identify, document, communicate and mitigate risks to project success Qualifications BA/BS in business or technical field or equivalent work-related experience and training 2+ years relevant project management experience. Experience in an agile software development environment is highly desired. An agile project management certification (such as SAFe Certified Scrum Master (SSM), SAFe Certified Agilist (SA), PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (ACP), or Certified Scrum Master (CSM)) is desired. A PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is also desirable. Proficient with Microsoft Office, common diagramming tools (e.g. Visio, Lucidchart), and project/issue management tools (e.g. Jira) Understanding of project management and software development lifecycles Ability to manage integration, scope, schedule, cost, quality, resources, communication, risks, procurement, and stakeholders as it relates to projects This job is eligible for a flexible hybrid working model (with some work from home and some work from the office). As such, applicants should be located within a reasonable distance of the Verisk office in Lehi, UT in order to attend in-person meetings and events when required for the role. If you meet the qualifications, like being challenged in your work, and collaborating with others to accomplish new objectives please apply! Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate. Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries Verisk Businesses Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement Life Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group. Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Takes responsibility for the successful delivery of the project. Serves as liaison between Development and Business to ensure smooth communication and prioritization of work. Leads Agile teams to achieve the objectives of the project. Works to continuously improve the team, both technically and culturally. Proactively takes the initiative to identify and resolve issues impacting the development team Identifies, assesses and manages risks to the success of the project, including the provision and use of contingency for those risks which are to be managed. Communicates with all stakeholders of the project based on their needs. Mentors junior agile project managers. Proficient knowledge of Agile Project Life Cycles (Scrum, Kanban) and tools (Confluence, Jira). Expert in Agile Values and Principles. Critical thinking skills, specifically the ability to identify issues, propose solutions and lead the effort in resolving the issues. Excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated ability to use influence to keep teams focused and resolve conflicts Familiarity with basic development technologies and skills Ability to negotiate in reference to time management and deliverables. Qualifications 4-6+ years of proven experience serving as Project Manager and/or ScrumMaster for Software Development Team Engaged as a productive member of a project team, using agile methods. Proficient ScrumMaster, with demonstrated ability to recognize obstacles as they impede the team’s progress and to employ techniques to guide the team to continuously improve. Demonstrated understanding of Agile Project Management concepts and values. Deep experience managing risks and opportunities within a project. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are seeking a Public Records Counsel with 5+ years of legal experience. Reporting to the Associate General Counsel, this key role provides data acquisition and contract negotiation. You will work directly with the Government Relations team and will be responsible for negotiating conditions of access to government held data, establishing and maintaining a relationship with government agencies, building personal and professional relationships with custodians of records and advising on strategic approaches in data acquisition. You will also oversee the process for post-signing administration of contracts. The ideal candidate is a team player with a positive attitude. A person who is collaborative and willing to take on a challenge with strong analytical, deductive, and hands-on problem-solving skills that demonstrate superior business acumen. Periodic travel required. Bonus incentive plan available. Health/Dental Benefits provided. Qualifications Juris Doctorate from an accredited university. Active bar license in good standing. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to develop productive working relationships with multiple stakeholders across the organization. Willingness to take on all levels of work assigned, whether simple or complex tasks. Goal-oriented, self-starter. Ability to work independently and prioritize issues. Proficient in time management to execute on multiple projects with multiple deadlines and stakeholders. Clear speaking and writing skills that deliver persuasive communications that foster effective, collaborative working relationships with clients and internal stakeholders. Familiarity with DPPA desirable. Experience in data privacy, data protection and compliance. Knowledge of FCRA and FOIA regulations. CIPP (US) desirable. Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Accountable for leading application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to applications and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting data processing and analytics solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 3-5 years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications and multi-tier architecture. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns. Experience with multi-threading, memory management, networking, I/O concepts, and performance aspects of common classes and algorithms. Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: Python, Linux, AWS (Athena, DynamoDB), Git, CI/CD. Understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Additional Information ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. Job Description Do you have 5+ years of experience and thrive in a small, dynamic, and fast-paced team? Are you curious about how things work and enjoy trying to break things? Do you want work where you are valued as a key member of the engineering team? If this entices you, read on... The candidate will report directly to a special project team that has been charged with redesigning and enhancing ISO ClaimSearch®, the insurance industry’s premier and only all claims database. He/she will work closely with a small number of agile teams serving as the “Automation Test Lead”, and drive all processes and tools used to achieve automated regression & functional testing. Prior experience developing and implementing automated regression testing suites is required. Job Responsibilities Own the Software QA process, including: developing, implementing, and maintaining test plans, test scenarios and test cases Analyze requirement and design specifications for test case development Recommend test automation approach, tools and frameworks Develop test infrastructure and custom automation tools as needed to expand test coverage and enable non-functional testing Perform manual and automated tests for our website and applications Prioritize test execution Find and report defects with detailed, accurate and concise steps to reproduce Assist developers in discovering and researching defects, and recommend system enhancements Complete ownership for all testing across multiple applications build with a varied set of tools/technologies Hands on testing that includes analyzing requirements, preparing test plans and building appropriate test cases to validate the functionality being built Support and execution of the application testing phase (functional & non-functional) to ensure all software meets requirements before changes are placed in production. Liaison/co-ordination with other technology groups (across sites) to coordinate/execute end-end testing Drive all efforts on test automation, includes planning, hands-on scripting and oversight of other resources working on automation. Qualifications Experience breaking complex software systems Experience evaluating software architectures and designs to identify potential quality, performance and scalability weaknesses or limitations and developing an automated test regimen to fully exercise these suspect areas Experience leading QA process development, execution, and documentation A strong command of manual and automated testing methodologies and general quality concepts Experience with Agile and Scrum Experience with scripting software automation testing products, including Selenium and Cucumber Experience with Automation Framework development using Selenium and Java Experience in TDD, BDD and ATDD Experience in Mobile Automation Testing tools Experience with LoadRunner/JMeter load testing Extensive knowledge of web technologies and experience testing web APIs/REST services Experience of automating complex systems integration (End-To-End) Experience integrating the execution of Selenium regression scripts with Continuous Integration build servers like Jenkins Experience testing hosted/cloud SaaS web applications is highly desirable Experience in Mobile Automation testing and tools Experience testing native mobile applications is desirable Bachelor’s in Computer Science, or related field or equivalent experience Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Job Description Intake and deliver data downstream into production to support the ongoing operational needs of DDS Implement quality control tasks and processes that routinely measure data quality and positive data outcomes to effectively grow data sources, maintain existing DDS customers that support the expansion of new DDS customers to achieve revenue targets Systematically assess and evaluate data consumption processes by reviewing new and existing data sources utilizing a suite of in-house statistical analysis tools Deliver data quality improvement initiatives as defined, agreed and prioritized Collaborate across multiple departments related to data collection and data management Work closely with data owners, data users and data custodians (IT) to ensure the root cause of reported data issues are understood and underlying problems as well as associated symptoms are resolved Present data quality trends and findings to internal and external stakeholders as needed Monitor and manage large data sets that are tracked through various data systems. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. About The Role Job Description The Consultant, Client Success (P&C Data Management Solutions) role will act as a consultant between Verisk and our clients and provide professional client services and support. You will drive collaborative and consultative support through all phases of the client engagement cycle. Key activities include helping to drive pipeline, sales and client engagement strategy; collaborating with teams of subject matter experts and stakeholders; and developing and refining processes to gather client information on current state operations and results. You will consult on best practices which address client needs by integrating and operationalizing Verisk data management and statistical data reporting solutions. You will serve as a conduit between clients and internal partners such as Product and Sales Leadership, Data Management Operations and IT Development. Responsibilities & Essential Duties About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role Consultative Support – acting as a business subject matter expert - through all phases of the sales cycle, gathering client information on current state operations and results Provide recommendations for future state best practices operationalizing Verisk solutions The candidate will collaborate and drive engagement strategy, presales messaging and approach, and provide impactful product demonstrations for potential clients in client sales meetings, at trade shows, and for executive presentations related to solution value Develop a meticulous understanding of Verisk-ISO solutions and services The successful candidate will continuously monitor and evaluate existing client needs while working closely with the Product Management and Sales teams for successful client implementations and client account stewardship This position plays a key role in gathering suggested product enhancements from clients for feedback for the Product Owners and Developers In collaboration with Sales, the role will be responsible for assembling key information and delivering high-level executive presentations to align solution opportunities with client organizational goals Provide support in the construction of contracts and work agreements Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned Regular travel required approximately 15-20% Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Required Skills Leadership or comparable experience in a similar industry focused on data management and analytics Proven experience implementing data management and reporting solutions at scale, and knowledge of the insurance data lifecyle Experience in consultative engagements with client business and technology stakeholders Proven ability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams Demonstrated effectiveness and strong communication skills, both written and oral Superior public speaking and presentation skills in both sales support and training environments. Ability and experience with tailoring messages to all levels of the organization from individual contributors to executives Provide extraordinary client support with a passionate commitment Excellent computer skills, especially with MS Windows and Office. Excel and PowerPoint skills required Encouraged Skills Business consulting experience Significant P&C insurance industry experience Experience with data management and ISO statistical reporting implementation projects is highly desirable Experience with data management technologies (SQL, Python, ETL, Data Warehousing) preferred but not essential Product Development experience preferred but not essential Knowledge of ISO Underwriting and Rating Products is a plus Insurance association memberships and/or certifications a plus (for example: AIDA, CPCU, IDMA) Minimal Education And Training Requirements 4-year college degree or equivalent experience Eight plus years’ experience in insurance data system integration and modernization projects, with a strong focus on process optimization, data quality enhancement and successful data delivery Knowledge of insurance data operations, regulatory compliance and information management Knowledge of insurance data and analytic technique Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Become a member of the exposures group and join our growing research and model development team at Extreme Event Solutions in Boston. As an engineer in the exposures group, you will work with a collaborative team of engineers, analysts, and economists to transform national census, building surveys, geospatial data, and satellite imagery into detailed models of the built environment for over 100 countries. In this role, you will use a variety of quantitative techniques, tools, and programming languages to build databases that capture the locations and characteristics of the buildings where people live and work. The property databases that you and the team develop will serve as inputs into Extreme Event Solutions catastrophe models and will be used by the modeling teams to predict how much property damage would be caused by simulated catastrophes ranging from hailstorms to earthquakes and estimate corresponding industry losses. Successful candidates will be highly motivated, detail-oriented, and have strong technical and analytical skills. They will also have excellent research skills and be able to work well independently. It is expected that they will apply their engineering knowledge and work with the team to create and deliver best-in-class property databases to the market. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role As a member of the exposures engineering group, you will be primarily responsible for evaluating and assigning the building characteristics to the properties in the databases. Your work will consist of the following: Collect and analyze data on buildings characteristics for buildings around the world to use in assessing the potential vulnerability of the building stock to natural catastrophes Use information obtained from engineering reports and building codes to develop classifications of the building stock by structural type, occupancy, and height Derive regional cost estimates for buildings of varying types throughout the world Employ the use of GIS tools to locate buildings and determine the proximity to natural hazards Develop custom tools and/or applications for use in building classification Create and deliver presentations of analysis methods and results to coworkers and senior management Write technical documentation for internal use and distribution to clients Provide support to clients Qualifications Experience, Knowledge and Abilities: Ability to gather, understand, and critically analyze data on building construction types Knowledge of statistics Demonstrated ability to learn new concepts and skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Familiarity with handling raw data and manipulating large data sets Programming experience in a high-level language such as SQL or C# Desired Experience Insurance industry knowledge Experience in GIS Experience in risk modeling and/or economic modeling Experience in project management Foreign language skills Qualifications BS or BEng degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, construction science or construction management MS/PhD preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. About The Role Job Description The Extreme Event Solution team within Verisk (formerly AIR Worldwide) is looking for an enthusiastic, passionate and ambitious Risk Analyst to join our Insurance-Linked Securities (ILS) team. The mission of our team is to be market leaders and innovators in the ILS industry, producing superior analytics and using Verisk Extreme Event Solution’s products to meet the needs of our clients. In this role, you will be working collaboratively with a high-performing ILS team to produce sophisticated reports for our (re)insurance, brokers, corporate and sovereign clients. You will have the opportunity to manage multiple projects concurrently, learn and enhance our current workflows, build relationships with our partners, and produce custom risk reports. As a Risk Analyst/Consultant you will undoubtedly gain a deeper understanding of catastrophe modeling, application of (re)insurance and financial structures, and the dynamic Catastrophe Bond market. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Perform sophisticated analyses using our cutting-edge technology for (re)insurers, brokers, and Insurance-Linked Securities (ILS) investors in the global Catastrophe Bonds industry Create robust Risk Analysis Reports through customization of model output tailored to the specifics of a given catastrophe bond and client book Communicate directly with internal stakeholders (the project manager, the senior reviewer etc.) to develop project timelines and manage deliverable expectations Help clients make important decisions around managing their catastrophe risk through interpretation of modeling results Work with a high-powered team of driven professionals to enhance our risk-modeling techniques, and execute at the highest level, to maintain Verisk’s position as the leader in the ILS industry Qualifications Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment Quick learner, with proactive problem-solving skills Self-starter, ability to work independently to achieve goals Excellent communication skills, working with internal and external stakeholders Data analysis using Excel, SQL, R Software, Python, or equivalent a plus Knowledge of finance, statistics, insurance, mathematics, or economics a plus Requirements 1+ years of experience in consulting, finance or insurance fields Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, finance, data science, actuarial science or atmospheric sciences Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Description: Are you an experienced risk control professional with proven ability working in a fast-paced environment? Are you looking to utilize your knowledge in fire protection systems, building construction, loss control, and related discipline providing risk analysis, development of policies and practices, conduct research among others? Do you like working in a collaborative environment? We have an immediate opening for a Risk Control Engineer/Consultant in the Risk Engineering group within commercial property. This position is primarily based in Jersey City, NJ or can work remotely with occasional travel to Jersey City. Principal Responsibilities And Essential Duties Serve as a supporting subject matter expert for our proprietary pricing methodology (SCOPES), including its integration into associated data collection platforms and product delivery workflows. Support the maintenance and enhancement of SCOPES, including through associated technical research and engineering analysis, alignment with and tracking to business objectives, solution conceptualization, technical requirement definition, and integration of technical integrity and quality precepts. Partner with other stakeholders to ensure the technical integrity and quality of SCOPES-related commercial property products and data, including through the identification and specification of associated technical edits and validations. Work closely and effectively with IT related to SCOPES maintenance and development, with an emphasis on clear communication of supporting technical requirements in line with established business goals and objectives.  Provide, as needed, engineering support for the development, maintenance and evolution of other risk evaluation approaches, risk control best practices, field survey guidance, and loss estimates. Analyze and/or identify underlying principles, reasons or facts associated with information or data to draw conclusions utilizing engineering knowledge and analytic skill.  Research complex problems of varied urgency, developing effective solutions and facilitating their reliable implementation.   Maintain an awareness of emerging technical issues and their impact on product development and enhancements.  Present clear written and oral communications to external and internal audiences on technical issues.  Complete all special projects and other duties as assigned.   Qualifications 3 or more years of experience in commercial property loss control and field survey risk control with knowledge of the evaluation/design of fire protection systems, fundamentals of building construction, and/or related resistance to fire and natural perils (wind, earthquake, flood, etc.) Excellent understanding of construction material, best practices of construction technologies and building use/occupancy classification. Experience in risk control concepts related to property insurance, workers compensation, and liability issues. Familiar with the ISO Specific Commercial Property Evaluation Schedule (SCOPES), data collection and workflow management platforms. Working knowledge or familiarization with international building codes and standards (ICC), knowledge and understanding of fire and life safety codes, including NFPA and other national industry standards Factory Mutual (FM), and OSHA. Knowledge of risk analysis techniques, including predictive, statistical, and/or analytical procedures for the assessment of hazards. General understanding of fire alarm systems and fire suppression systems. Experience in providing technical support to internal stakeholders and/or external customers. Capable of developing business requirements and conducting business validation, when working with IT, related to data collection platforms and calculation systems. Professional Engineer (P.E.) designation desired. Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent from a four-year university. Fire protection, mechanical, and civil/structural engineering (or related field) degree preferred; advanced degree desired. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description The Sales Trainer (Field Enablement Trainer) will partner with the Head of Revenue Operations and Field Enablement team to form strategic partnerships across the Commercial organization to align and incorporate Verisk Marketing Solutions’ bookings & retention objectives into all aspects of training for the Commercial team. The Field Enablement Trainer will be a key contributor to the success of quota-carrying employees, with involvement ranging from new hire training to active deal review and coaching. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Own the adoption of the Value Selling sales methodology certification of sales representatives and inform the broader Commercial organization Prepares new sales representatives by conducting orientation to the sales process, develops individual coaching plans, and provides guidance. Conducts exercise sessions for new and current sales employees. Observes sales interactions and collect feedback, results, and performance data of trainees after sessions or customer engagements Coordinates with the Commercial Leadership team and Revenue Operations. Structures training plans to meet financial objectives. Maximize effectiveness by researching training methodologies, learning tools, platforms, and practices. Evaluate sales team performance to ensure training programs are successful. Ensure training materials are up-to-date and stay current on product updates, launches, and key company initiatives. Qualifications Advanced customer service and time management skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Demonstrable ability to execute effective training programs Outstanding coaching skills Motivated by a desire to exceed shared goals Great organizational and interpersonal skills Ability to measure performance and communicate results to key stakeholders. Key performance indicators include: number of sales reps attaining quota, average sales rep productivity, average deal size, sales cycle & closing ratio. At least 2 years of experience as a sales coach, training specialist, or a similar position Possession of certifications in sales training methodologies Experience with building and developing teams Nice to Have Bachelor’s degree or Associates degree in business administration or related field Previous experience in an Account Executive, Account Manager or Business Development role is preferred, but not required Previous experience in social selling, through LinkedIn or other social platforms Previous experience with Salesforce.com, ZoomInfo, Gong, and/or a learning management system (LMS) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Observes sales interactions and collect feedback, results, and performance data of trainees after sessions or customer engagements Coordinates with the Commercial Leadership team and Revenue Operations. Structures training plans to meet financial objectives. Maximize effectiveness by researching training methodologies, learning tools, platforms, and practices. Evaluate sales team performance to ensure training programs are successful. Ensure training materials are up-to-date and stay current on product updates, launches, and key company initiatives. Qualifications Advanced customer service and time management skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Demonstrable ability to execute effective training programs Outstanding coaching skills Motivated by a desire to exceed shared goals Great organizational and interpersonal skills Ability to measure performance and communicate results to key stakeholders. Key performance indicators include: number of sales reps attaining quota, average sales rep productivity, average deal size, sales cycle & closing ratio. At least 2 years of experience as a sales coach, training specialist, or a similar position Possession of certifications in sales training methodologies Experience with building and developing teams Nice to Have Bachelor’s degree or Associates degree in business administration or related field Previous experience in an Account Executive, Account Manager or Business Development role is preferred, but not required Previous experience in social selling, through LinkedIn or other social platforms Previous experience with Salesforce.com, ZoomInfo, Gong, and/or a learning management system (LMS) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Who is Verisk Marketing Solutions? Verisk Marketing Solutions helps marketers create exceptional experiences for their customers and prospects by targeting the right person, with the right message, at the right time. We do this with the highest standards for data security and respect for the consumer’s privacy, preference, and permission. Our consumer insights and data solutions are designed to help marketers continuously maintain a real-time view of customers and prospects as those consumer’s profiles and behaviors are changing over time. Whether our clients are seeing a consumer for the first time or have a long-standing relationship with her, we help them improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every engagement. We take pride in helping our customers understand and apply our solutions and data to improve their digital marketing strategies in new and creative ways. When our clients win, we win. Position Overview As a Scrum Master at Verisk Marketing Solutions, you will function as a leader enabling teams to deliver business value in the software being developed, protecting teams from external interferences, resolving impediments that teams encounter and coaching teams in better ways of achieving software agility. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Organize and drive product development throughout the Sprints, including Sprint Planning, Daily Stand-ups, Sprint Reviews, Sprint Refinements, and Sprint Retrospectives. Assist Product Owners, Development, Data, and IT teams with backlog refinement and prioritization. Review and maintain adherence to company-defined Definitions of Ready and Done. Facilitate the teams' abilities to develop in a consistent and creative manner. Protect teams from scope creep and maintain sprint goals. Remove impediments for teams. Perform the role of Scrum Master for multiple scrum teams. Keep appropriate stakeholders up-to-date with the latest information on high-priority incidents through timely and regular written and verbal communications. Identify and track internal and external dependencies. Ensure that appropriate Scrum artifacts are accurate and visible, including progress tracking through charts and views in Targetprocess. Measure, track and help teams improve metrics through continuous improvement. Maintain a high level of effective communication between onsite and remote teams. Qualifications 2 – 3 years of experience in Scrum Master role on Scrum and Kanban teams. Certified Scrum Master or similar certification. Experience with Product delivery-focused organizations. Experience with managing projects including Data Engineering, Data Science, and Software Delivery. Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle. Knowledge of Agile and other software development techniques like: User Stories, Continuous Integration, TDD, Continuous Testing, Automated Testing, and Agile Games. Demonstrated excellence in leadership and ability to create collaborative, productive teams. Familiarity with tools like JIRA, Rally, Targetprocess for managing projects. Amazon Web Services or other cloud infrastructure knowledge. Experience with fostering growth in agile organizations. Ability to communicate, negotiate and plan work across dependent teams or departments clearly. Experience building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, judgment, with an emphasis on healing and problem solving. Accepts and acts on constructive criticism while being a careful listener that uses that ability to connect closely with team members. Honesty / Integrity – Does not cut corners ethically. Earns trust and maintains confidence. Does what is right, not just what is politically expedient. Speaks plainly and truthfully. Ability to work independently, make informed decisions, and ask for guidance where needed. Ability to understand both business and technical needs to facilitate the delivery of high-quality products. Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description The Client Services/ Technical Product Support Specialist will work closely with the Client Services, business and engineering teams to support Verisk customers using our core ISO platforms and applications. S/he will take ownership of assigned customer issues; research, diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve system issues, and follow standard procedures for proper logging of issues as well as escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams. Using strong knowledge of technology and best practices, s/he must also be able to analyze calls and logs to discover any underlying issues or trends, test and evaluate new technology, suggest product / process improvements and contribute to the shared customer knowledge base.  Specific duties include:  Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues for mid-level to complex applications and platform services such as account and data management, authentication, search, entitlement, etc. Gather information and escalate unresolved issues as needed  Troubleshoot content and document extract issues   Perform Root Cause Analysis of technical issues   Monitor systems, processes, warning messages, etc. as required and take appropriate actions  Work with customers on software installation issues  Field questions on customer-mandated technical changes  Document and share resolutions across all support teams / levels and develop technical documentation to provide troubleshooting guides and facilitate knowledge transfer. Perform additional technical duties as required to support ISOnet applications and customers Qualifications BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or relevant field, and 3+ years of experience as a Technical Support Engineer, Web Application Support Engineer, or similar Software support role.   Strong understanding of software development processes and methods, design concepts and patterns and browser debug tools as well as ability to debug browser assets Solid understanding of the following technologies and tools, e.g. Core C#, Java, Bootstrap, Angular, JQuery or any client-side JavaScript, CSS, RDBMS, SQL, JIRA Excellent problem-solving skills and outstanding attention to detail  Able to manage and prioritize multiple open issues at once Excellent oral and written communication skills. Able to ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem and provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal. Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software, database queries and ISO products/applications a plus  Experience generating reports via Jira iql or similar Experience with web application client-side troubleshooting, familiarity with system and event logs, navigating application logs for troubleshooting along with cloud-based log mining software like Splunk is preferred  Familiarity with cloud hosting services like AWS is desired  Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environments. Additional certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies is a plus. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

About The Role Job Description Be a part of a dynamic software development group at AIR contributing to design and development of next generation AWS cloud-native SaaS product suite. Focusing on our analytics platform, you are expected to work in an agile team to help plan and design new features, write clean, testable and performant code, provide automated tests, as well as resolve customer issues. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will be working in a Scrum team structure collaborating with a Solution Architect and your peers on design and development tasks assigned as sprint deliverables. You will be expected to conduct formal design reviews with other project stakeholders. Periodically, you will work on PoC (Proof-of-Concept) tasks researching technological feasibility of proposed solutions. You will unit/system-test, trouble-shoot, debug, and resolve any software functional and performance defects. Be a key member of the Agile team in the delivery of our suite of next-generation innovative cloud SaaS solutions. Design and develop the back-end microservices and API. Proactively improve development process by implementing the best practices for SDLC. Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in This Role Experience Required Good communicator and listener Eager to learn business and product domain Eager to innovate while working on clean-slate problems as well as on enhancing exiting products & codebases Taking pride in your work - being a quick and with attention to detail and quality Required Technical Skills 3+ years of industry experience developing commercial software products Solid knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals, design patterns, and best practices Ability to translate functional requirements and conceptual architecture into formalized design specification Fluent programming skillset in C# on .Net[Core] (preferable) or Java Thorough understanding of cloud computing and SaaS concepts and best practices Hands-on experience developing SaaS systems on Amazon cloud leveraging AWS PaaS technologies Must be able to work remotely until further notice with a return to office schedule of 2 days onsite and 3 days remote. Desired education and/or certification B.S in Math, EE, CS or Software Engineering; M.S. preferred Preferred Technical Skills The ideal candidate will also have strong analytical skills and prior experience with HPC (High-Performance Computing) systems Streaming Analytics (Kafka) C++ programming System performance diagnostics and optimization techniques Unit-testing and DevOps tooling Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Designs, creates and develops software code, writes test cases, establishes design patterns and frameworks, and contributes to best coding practices Responsible for collaborating with a team of software designers and developers to deliver high quality internally designed software and processes within budget and on schedule. Participates in full software development life cycle delivering robust high-performance applications and services adhering to team and corporate standards, guidelines, and policies Provides work breakdown and estimates for small software development tasks. Reports status updates for areas of individual responsibilities in projects on timely basis. Guides and mentors more junior members of the team in regards to the object-oriented and functional programming paradigms / languages Facilitates the discussions regarding design processes and frameworks, etc. Promotes Agile architecture and development on the project Investigates the design implications of incorporating analytics into solutions and delivering information to users through a variety of interfaces Qualifications 7+ years of proven experience in designing, architecting, leading, developing, coding and testing of large-scale business applications and frameworks. Excellent experience with technologies like C#, .NET, ETL tools, AWS based technologies such as Lambda, S3, IAM, SQS, EC2, ECS, Redis, DynamoDB as well as deep understanding of relational and NoSQL databases, etc. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology, provide technical thought leadership Ability to drive the architecture of systems to provide a highly scalable and highly resilient design and infrastructure to support our products. Demonstrated excellence with N-tiered architecture, SOA, REST Services, JSON, XML, AWS, data engineering and productionizing the cloud-based architectures Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Solid experience and understanding in the following technologies and tools: cloud-based design, AWS Services, continuous integration/continuous deployment, automation tool experience– Jenkins, Hudson, Bamboo etc. Highly experienced at leading technical solutioning and guiding project’s technical and architectural direction. Job Description We are hiring a Senior Product Manager to be based in Jersey City, New Jersey. The Senior Product Manager is product owner for one or more offerings on ISO’s core digital platform. They are an experienced product leader, adept at leading product discovery and definition, and are comfortable driving teams through the conception and delivery of solutions that address critical business needs and delight customers. As a Senior Product Manager, You Will Conduct and synthesize market, competitive and customer research to identify, document and articulate customer needs for assigned products, services, or segments Lead cross-functional teams and/or efforts to create new or enhance existing digital experiences that solve customer problems or address needs based on identified insights and opportunities Understand customer journeys, user personas, and jobs-to-be-done, and formulate tests to validate or disprove hypotheses Collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, partners, and subject matter experts Employ suitable frameworks and methodologies to identify and realize opportunities for process learnings and operational improvements Qualifications Four-year college degree in computer science, business or related discipline with 7+ years related experience as a product leader, agile product owner, or similar. Additional certifications or graduate degrees are desired (PSPO, CSPO, etc.). Demonstrated understanding of software engineering and web development concepts, customer analytics and data-driven decision making, UX/UI practices, software testing and quality, and agile and lean methodologies Able to learn systems and applications quickly, connect functions to business context, and translate technical concepts and terminology to non-technical clients and internal stakeholders Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Solid research, facilitation, and presentation skills. Able to synthesize and summarize data and insights, to present a story with a level of detail that is suitable to the audience Solid organizational and project management skills, follow through, and ability to work independently. Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills, and a high level of personal maturity, discretion, integrity, and professional judgment Able to manage nuance, and coach & mentor junior team members as appropriate Insurance and related domain experience preferred Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. About The Role Job Description The Senior Director, Digital Marketing Operations leads a digital marketing team to develop scalable processes and programs that drive digital marketing results. They educate and empower integrated marketing campaigns, lead martech management and deliver actionable insights that drive better business outcomes. This individual will have demonstrated expertise managing marketing automation programs including Salesforce and Eloqua (or similar email marketing platform) to deliver a lead workflow program for end-to-end ROI reporting. They will have experience delivering programs using segmentation and audience profiling, demand generation capabilities, and marketing attribution modelling. This is a highly cross functional role requiring both strategic and tactical execution, strong program management, and ability to lead a team. This leader will work closely with marketing, sales, and technical stakeholders to develop processes for a high growth marketing organization and should have exceptional problem-solving skills. This role resides in Jersey City and reports to the AVP, Digital Marketing. The role works in the office 2 days/week. Responsibilities Improve marketing campaign efficiency Lead the effort to develop a performance-based digital marketing organization, focused on improving and building scalable processes and programs to align marketing and sales efforts Build marketing attribution and audience profile models in partnership with analytics lead Create templatized marketing dashboards and reporting for campaign effectiveness in partnership with analytics lead – reports include campaign execution and tracking, budget to pipeline and revenue, marketing automation systems, database health and market segmentation Manage, build, and optimize our lead workflow programs This includes lead scoring and routing, campaign creation, and inbound marketing channels, and help ensure a smooth handoff of leads to sales by improving our lead execution, funnel alignment, and sales SLA with sales ops Establish deep Eloqua and Salesforce integration to maximize functionality and sharing of data among marketing, sales, and customer service-related systems Lead email marketing, Eloqua data maintenance, segmentation, and data/list imports Share best practices and maintenance of lead generation campaigns, programs, drip and nurture programs for great campaign effectiveness Lead data strategy development and infrastructure deployment, including technology ownership and marketing process governance for data stewardship Build and maintain a marketing technology stack that meets the needs of the business, is effective in engaging customers, provides scale to our customer communications, and drives efficiencies to hyper-scale pipeline and revenue growth Provide leadership in defining, mapping, and documenting key marketing processes Qualifications 10+ years’ experience in a Marketing Operations/Automation role or similar position Bachelor's degree (preferably in Marketing, Business, or Communication) or equivalent experience; MBA a plus Advanced user of marketing automation systems like Eloqua; Eloqua certification a plus Experience with system administration of marketing functions in Salesforce.com – comfortable with technical conversations with sales ops around Salesforce workflows, objects, and triggers Data-driven marketer proficient in A/B testing, conversion rate optimization, and email optimization Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex data sets into concrete business recommendations for marketing and sales, with the goal to optimize revenue-generating investments Ability to drive results, lead cross-functional teams, influence others and foster positive collaboration Deep expertise and experience in B2B marketing Strong prioritization, planning, and organizational skills Excellent communication skills: verbal, written, presentation; especially when working with teammates who may be technical or non-technical Strong working knowledge of project management tools including Workfront, JIRA, and Confluence Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint Skills Innovative and creative thinker: pioneer who embraces bold ideas Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: works quickly and nimbly; able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed and motivated; demonstrates endurance Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Verisk Extreme Event Solutions (VEES, previously AIR Worldwide), a member of Verisk Analytics, is the scientific leader and most respected provider of risk modeling software and consulting services. VEES founded the catastrophe modeling industry in 1987 and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, terrorism, and pandemic outbreaks in 90 countries. VEES offers the opportunity to work with advanced technologies, global clients, and hundreds of the most innovative, talented minds in the industry. This senior earthquake engineer research position is responsible for leading and improving the development of the damage estimation component of VEES earthquake models. These models cover worldwide regions and include multiple perils such as ground shaking, liquefaction, landslide, fire-following, sprinkler leakage, and tsunami. The damage estimation component quantifies the impact these perils on the built environment and society in terms of physical damage to properties (buildings and contents), loss of use (downtime), and human loss and casualty. The candidate will work closely with a team of structural and geotechnical engineers, seismologists, and specialists to perform model validation, deterministic and probabilistic risk assessment, and present and explain results to internal stakeholders and external clients. Evolving nature of research work at VEES creates unique and challenging problems that spark innovation and growth for VERISK and creates opportunities for its employees. A successful candidate should have a strong technical background in earthquake, structural, geotechnical, or civil engineering. Candidates are expected to be highly motivated, detail oriented, excellent team player, and capable of utilizing problem-solving skills to solve problems as new areas of modeling emerges. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Data acquisition (including post-event survey) and analysis to understand building inventory and their vulnerability in regions of interest Perform analytical studies on damage observations or synthesized data to develop fragility functions for a variety of assets subjected to earthquake shaking, liquefaction, landslide, tsunami, fire and etc. Use data from independent research to assess and validate model components and its overall performance Explore process improvement and innovative ideas to improve modeling accuracy and efficiency Present VERISK models to technical and non-technical audiences and provide support to clients and staff as needed Author technical writing for internal and external publications Qualifications Master with 5+ years of modeling experience or PhD in Earthquake, Structural, Geotechnical, and/or other relevant engineering fields with 3+ years of modeling experience Demonstrated capabilities in probabilistic and stochastic risk assessment and modeling, particularly in earthquake engineering Familiarity with C++ and data mining skills using tools such as R, Matlab and others Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational and documentation skills Experience with GIS applications (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description Assist and work alongside development teams as they build and maintain software solutions. Ensuring that work is completed in a timely manner with high quality in accordance with development standards and operational requirements Accountable for proactively driving the solutions to technical problems, and improvements within areas of responsibility in conjunction with leadership. Work with leadership and the architecture team to ensure that new and existing technologies and functionality have been properly evaluated, with defined success criteria, and that the team can support what they build. Appraise performance; address complaints; resolve problems; reward, and discipline employees; interview, hire, train employees; plan, assign, and direct work. Measure and ensure code quality, development productivity, consistent velocity, and improvements across assigned teams. Delegate responsibilities as needed and hold team members accountable. Assists in goal setting and continuous improvement while ensuring high engagement and satisfaction of employees. Work with modern technology stack including Angular, TypeScript, Sass, HTML, Node/npm, Java, PostgreSQL, MongoDB and AWS. Designing, coding, testing, documenting, and debugging single page web applications to ensure they remain in “category killer” status Install, configure, and administer your own workstation software, including editors, development servers, and client applications Manage a small team in designing, coding, testing, documenting, and debugging single page web applications to ensure they remain in create simple and well-designed solutions to complex software problems Dedication to excellence and championship work ethic Knowledge of internet client/server technologies and experience working building enterprise single page web applications Knowledge of PC and web based software testing in both client and server sides Team-player mindset with strong communication and problem solving skills 2 years’ experience leading a development team is preferred but not required Ability to lead agile development teams to achieve product, technical, and operational objectives Ability to manage development team velocity and work quality in accordance with established targets Ability to cultivate a professional team environment with high employee engagement Ability to coach and develop Job Description Develop, construct, test and maintain software applications and architectures (including database and large-scale data processing systems) Implement elegant (i.e. simple and intuitive) predictive models in software that are dynamic and responsive to user inputs or time-varying observations Develop and maintain code to consistently analyze, transform, and grade the quality of diverse datasets Creatively and practically overcome data quality concerns and data gaps via custom software solutions Infer high-fidelity characteristics in datasets where such fidelity is only available for a portion of the dataset Assist in the evaluation of applications and tools for data processing and analysis Implement data analysis in software following standards and best practices Develop data set processes for data modeling, mining and production Work as part of the development team to implement and fully utilize the data analysis in implementing world class software solutions Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality Work effectively with project technologists and stakeholders Be a strong fit for our technical and cultural environments Qualifications BS with 8+ years’ experience or MS with 4+ years in Computer Science with experience in Data Science/Analytics in their educational program and/or professional experience Programming skills creating enterprise grade solutions in Java a requirement. Modeling will be implemented and actualized in multi-project enterprise-grade Java-centric codebase Experience with a variety of languages: C, C++, C#, JavaScript, ReactJS, etc… a serious benefit.
