Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Are you an insurance professional looking to make a real impact on the industry?  Do you feel limited with your growth opportunities in your current role?  Are you looking for a chance to take your career to the next level with a highly innovative organization?  Then you should consider coming to work with Verisk Analytics!  We were recently named Forbes Magazine’s #1 Innovative Research & Consulting Services Company in the World (#18 of all companies) and have a great opportunity for an ambitious, passionate insurance expert. We are looking for an experienced Insurance Product Development expert to develop innovative enhancements to ISO's management liability & professional liability insurance programs. As a product development team member you will conceptually and technically develop new and revised insurance programs in response to the changing business environment. We will look to you for strategic thought leadership on the D&O, EPL, Fiduciary Liability, Crime and Financial Institutions markets, as well as professional liability insurance markets, using your understanding of coverages, markets, industries, legal and regulatory trends, our customers, and our competitors to gauge impacts on our insurance programs, provide actionable insights, and create new products and product enhancements. The better we know our customers, the better we can serve them.  Customer focus will guide all aspects of your work. You will engage with customers and respond to their feedback with key developments, and develop products that anticipate their needs.  This includes participating in panels and other customer forums, representing the products to customers, meeting with them individually and being a key customer resource. You may also represent us at industry conferences and with professional organizations, including preparing and giving presentations and authoring or co-authoring white papers or articles. As part of a small staff of line-of-business experts you will collaborate with all stakeholders. This means inviting perspectives, contributions, and partnerships within the team, the unit, the company, and with our customers and business partners. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience. CPCU or RPLU preferred. Minimum five to seven years underwriting or product development experience with in-depth knowledge of Directors and Officers, Employment-related Practices, Fiduciary Liability, Commercial Crime and Financial Institutions lines of business.  Professional Liability and/or Cyber experience also a plus. Development or analysis of policy forms required. Proven research and analytical skills.  Pro-active problem solver. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Experience building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on gaining actionable insights and forming collaborative partnerships with the goal of innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Some travel may be required (up to 15%) Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable. Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows. Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description Accountable for leading application development supporting business objectives while demonstrating independence in software development lifecycle phases from concept and design to testing. Lead new and existing applications along with enhancements to applications and infrastructure. Perform hands-on coding while designing and architecting data processing and analytics solutions. Serve as a liaison to internal customers, research groups and various business support areas. Provides technical guidance to junior programmers and other software engineers. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain mid-level to complex applications. Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan. Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned. Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation. Qualifications 6+ years of proven experience in software development and system maintenance. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology. Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications and multi-tier architecture. Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns. Experience with multi-threading, memory management, networking, I/O concepts, and performance aspects of common classes and algorithms. Proficient experience and understanding in the following technologies: Python 2/3, Linux, AWS, OLTP, and OLAP databases, any Data Warehouse RDBMS based on MPP/Cluster, Jupyter, Docker, Kubernetes, Spark, Git, CI/CD. Experience with any of the following technologies a plus: Snowflake (DBaaS), Greenplum. Highly experienced at leading teams, interacting with business partners or customers, and guiding project direction. Excellent understanding of object-oriented design concepts and software development processes and methods. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused most important features. Must have passion for development and latest technologies Leadership and ability to guide design and technical meetings Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. Job Description Join the Mid-latitude Atmospheric Perils research team at Verisk Extreme Event Solutions in the Boston-based Research Department. You will be responsible for providing a process level understanding of extratropical cyclones/winter storms and the processes or conditions that lead to extreme winds, snowfall accumulations, and freezing rain in the historic, near present, and future climates. As a research scientist, you will be applying your scientific and technical knowledge to represent the observed damage-causing characteristics of extratropical cyclones within catastrophe (CAT) models. You will also support and validate Verisk CAT models for regions around the globe within client-facing meetings and as part of the shared responsibilities of the Mid-latitude Atmospheric Perils research team. The results of your work will be used by industry and governments to assess the risks from extreme weather events. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Provide domain knowledge and modeling (e.g. WRF) or observational expertise for building scientifically sound representations of extreme weather events. Collect and analyze a wide range of in-situ and remote sensing observations. Develop code and apply statically robust methods for model development and evaluation. Engage with clients about validating and using Verisk’s CAT models to assess risks from extreme weather events. Qualifications M.S. with 4+ years professional experience in a technical environment, or Ph.D. degree in meteorology, geoscience, or related fields required Knowledge of atmospheric dynamics is required. Background and experience in extratropical cyclone modeling would be considered a significant advantage. Experience with statistical analysis and data science is desired. Ability to gather, integrate, and critically analyze data from all relevant sources. Strong skills gained through practical experience using high-level language and tools such as Python, R, NCL, Git and Linux environment. Familiarity with C++, MATLAB, FORTRAN Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated record of scientific excellence (e.g., software deliverables/products, publications, presentations) Open to mid-career scientists. Early-career scientist preferred Additional Information At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Job Description Join Verisk – Extreme Event Solutions’ growing Research and Modeling Department and be part of the Financial and Uncertainty Modeling team in Boston; working closely with statisticians, mathematicians, analysts and geoscientists. You have a strong desire to learn, as you will gain expert knowledge of a broad range of topics, including but not limited to; modeled perils and associated catastrophic events, postal codes in various countries around the world, insurance terms, and probability distributions. You have excellent communication skills and will use your technical and analytical skills to solve problems. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role Analyze insurance claims data from catastrophic events such as hurricanes, earthquakes, flood, and severe thunderstorms Model uncertainty and correlation in catastrophe losses using statistical techniques and simulations Develop methodologies for Monte Carlo loss aggregation for reinsurance Test accuracy of new methodologies by writing code in R or C++ and run simulations Present findings concisely and create clear visualizations Assist the client services team in explaining methodology and answering client questions Qualifications PhD in a quantitative field, such as data science, statistics, mathematics, or computer science, with 2-3 years of professional experience with data analytics projects is required Strong analytical and quantitative skills, a solid understanding of probability concepts, and excellent problem-solving skills Background in data science/machine learning highly desired Experience with any of the following would be a big plus: insurance claim data, risk aggregation, insurance policy conditions, actuarial science, database management Basic programming knowledge required; familiarity with R or similar statistical language is preferred. Company Description FAST, which stands for “Flexible Architecture, Simplified Technology,” is a Verisk (NASDAQ: VRSK) business that offers a suite of out-of-the-box software components insurers can use to quickly modernize their current environments or replace their legacy systems. FAST, which has a U.S. office in Iselin, New Jersey and an international office in Hyderabad, India, was founded in 2010 to provide an alternative to the overly burdensome solutions available in the market. At FAST, we recognize that each insurance company faces a unique set of issues and challenges, and that a tremendous amount of creativity and capability is required to craft and implement the best solution. That’s why FAST was built on an agile mindset. FAST, in concert with Verisk, is focused on providing innovative technology and analytics solutions for the life insurance industry. We’re continuously learning and improving, constantly challenging the status quo, and always seeking a “win/win” for our customers, partners, and employees. We reduce the time to market, eliminating risk and lowering the cost of standing up and maintaining core insurance systems. We continue to leapfrog the competition through Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Life Insurance Policy Admin Systems, North America. FAST was first recognized in Gartner’s 2015 Magic Quadrant and after only three years became the youngest company to make Gartner’s leadership quadrant (upper-right). We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Job Description The Software Engineer works as a team member within FAST’s Product Development supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, and creating other mobile and web solutions for customers. The Software Engineer has a primary focus on frontend development using Javascript, React; however; they may be asked on occasion to jump into backend code. Research and analysis skills are often used to accomplish and complete tasks. The Software Engineer operates under general supervision with latitude for independent judgement and may be called upon to mentor less-experienced team members. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop front-ends for our web applications in React in support of the Company’s offerings, FAST Insurance Components - craft responsive experiences using React Develop event-driven high-performant logic to interface with various API’s Provide critical software development in support of the Company’s most recent e-App and web development efforts, including supporting pre-sales and demo efforts Collaborate with product management, designers, and back-end developers to deliver highquality features for potential and existing customers Collaborate with FAST peers assist in the development of next generation user interfaces for both mobile and web interfaces most often utilizing JavaScript technologies Participate in the design and development of componentized software leveraging SOA design principles Develop expertise in technical areas: FAST Application Architecture, Hosting infrastructure, Configuration Tools, Integration Architecture and other technical areas Leverage FAST’s analytical tools and big data technologies to collaborate and solution complex business problems Liaison between customers and cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs Oversee and mentor a team of developers who implement these designs ensuring changes conform to FAST best practices Support the deployment of FAST’s Insurance components as a SaaS offering using AWS services Participate with FAST and customer teams in an Agile, collaborative team environment Develop customer facing skills through a rapid succession of customer engagements Qualifications Essential Education and Work Experience A domain expert in: Javascript in particular React.JS 3-5 years of front-end or full-stack development experience with a minimum of 2 years of React experience. Prior experience with web and mobile UI development using a javascript framework (React, ExtJS) Demonstrated ability to write clear, concise, and maintainable JavaScript Expertise in building secure, scalable web services. Doing so in JAVA, a plus Demonstrated understanding of Agile software development, Unit testing, DevOps practices, and can work closely with other teams to optimize your code Experience with relational data design and relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, PostGreSQL) Good understanding of test-driven development and automated testing using NUnit or similar frameworks Understanding of source code version control systems Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering. MS degree a plus. Specialized Knowledge and Skills The Software Engineer must be intellectually curious, and demonstrate strong interpersonal, Presentation, And Critical Thinking Skills. Highly Developed Programming Essential. Work Environment and Physical Demands General office environment Ability to travel a plus (when appropriate) Average 45-hour work-week, more as needed Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk IoT/ Telematics, is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to develop our next generation products. You will have an opportunity work with exciting, cutting-edge technologies that will that enable us to deliver innovative, fast, scalable, and reliable products to our customers. You will join the core team responsible for the development of our data exchange for connected cars and home that is one of its kind in the world! In this role, you will be working alongside a diverse group of talented individuals that are responsible for creating and maintaining high traffic, API/web products depended on by top auto manufacturers and insurance companies for their daily business. Design and develop high performance software libraries and APIs Implement highly scalable, performant, fault tolerant processing systems with technologies including AWS Be involved in all phases of the agile software development lifecycle Work with Product owners to gather detailed requirements for new products, services & tools. Proactively seek out and minimize pain points within the infrastructure and code base Keep up to date with the latest technologies and introduce them as needed Create next-gen solutions for unique and challenging use cases. Qualifications You must have demonstrated experience in several of these domains and technologies: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field 3+ years of experience designing and developing web/Rest based service using C#, .NET/.NET Core Excellent understanding of SOA principles and design patterns Excellent understanding and writing of SQL server procedures, Views, functions and designing skills. Experience in using AWS services like Lambda, SQS is a big plus Knowledge of Jira, Bitbucket, CI/CD is a Plus Development experience using Python is a plus Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering & Analytics Lab (DEAL) is responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Actuarial Associate, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, line of business experience, and communication skills. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 15-17. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting a wide array of internal customers. The role will have responsibility for managing all aspects of a line of business's data-infrastructure from ingestion to analytic frameworks to content generation. Some Anticipated Work Assignments Include Build and maintain robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data Support product implementation on a new and innovative technology platform with product requirements, actuarial calculations, methods, and validation Design, build and launch extremely efficient & reliable data pipelines to move data (both large and small amounts) in/out of our Snowflake Data Lake Assist with product development and implementation including modeling and assumption development Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team Perform other tasks on R&D, data governance, system infrastructure, and other cross team functions, on an as-needed basis Adopt an agile framework to schedule work, adjust as needed and continuously improve performance Communicate performance with relevant internal stakeholders Work with data analysts to develop reports and visualizations Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering Completion of CAS Exam 5 (Basic Ratemaking), ACAS or higher preferred Minimum 4 years of experience working with property & casualty insurance data, preferably supporting an actuarial/data-science function in one of the following lines of business (Commercial Property, General Liability, Commercial Auto, Personal Auto) Highly proficient with SQL and database concepts Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data Experience in preparing and conducting extensive business analysis and studies, process assessments, data analysis, and requirement specification Proficiency in Python, object-oriented programming, and data structures Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. jobTitle: Senior Technical Product Support Specialist- Client Services
jobDescription: Company Description ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Job Description The Client Services/ Technical Product Support Specialist will work closely with the Client Services, business and engineering teams to support Verisk customers using our core ISO platforms and applications. S/he will take ownership of assigned customer issues; research, diagnose, troubleshoot and identify solutions to resolve system issues, and follow standard procedures for proper logging of issues as well as escalation of unresolved issues to the appropriate internal teams. Using strong knowledge of technology and best practices, s/he must also be able to analyze calls and logs to discover any underlying issues or trends, test and evaluate new technology, suggest product / process improvements and contribute to the shared customer knowledge base.  Specific duties include:  Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues for mid-level to complex applications and platform services such as account and data management, authentication, search, entitlement, etc. Gather information and escalate unresolved issues as needed  Troubleshoot content and document extract issues   Perform Root Cause Analysis of technical issues   Monitor systems, processes, warning messages, etc. as required and take appropriate actions  Work with customers on software installation issues  Field questions on customer-mandated technical changes  Document and share resolutions across all support teams / levels and develop technical documentation to provide troubleshooting guides and facilitate knowledge transfer. Perform additional technical duties as required to support ISOnet applications and customers Qualifications BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or relevant field, and 3+ years of experience as a Technical Support Engineer, Web Application Support Engineer, or similar Software support role.   Strong understanding of software development processes and methods, design concepts and patterns and browser debug tools as well as ability to debug browser assets Solid understanding of the following technologies and tools, e.g. Core C#, Java, Bootstrap, Angular, JQuery or any client-side JavaScript, CSS, RDBMS, SQL, JIRA Excellent problem-solving skills and outstanding attention to detail  Able to manage and prioritize multiple open issues at once Excellent oral and written communication skills. Able to ask customers targeted questions to quickly understand the root of the problem and provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal. Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software, database queries and ISO products/applications a plus  Experience generating reports via Jira iql or similar Experience with web application client-side troubleshooting, familiarity with system and event logs, navigating application logs for troubleshooting along with cloud-based log mining software like Splunk is preferred  Familiarity with cloud hosting services like AWS is desired  Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux/Mac OS environments. Additional certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies is a plus. Additional Information Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are looking for a talented SDET with a deep passion for delivering quality to work closely with our growing development team. You will have the opportunity to set up new frameworks, create automated test scripts in a CI/CD environment, work with a variety of AWS services and continually optimize our automation processes. About The Day To Day Responsibilities Of The Role Design and develop test framework/tools to achieve the efficiency and productivity to ensure functionality, reliability, performance, scalability of cloud. Develop automation tools/web application for busines need using angular. Research the new tools in the market which can fit for our business need and full fill our stakeholder’s requirement. Using a wide range of cutting-edge technology to innovate while testing/developing. Design scalable infrastructure for test execution. Explore new ways to expedite testing life cycle by bringing in different frameworks. Qualifications Require minimum 2+ years of strong coding experience using object-oriented programing in C# or Java (or .Net core) Require minimum 1+ year of hands-on CI/CD DevOps development experience with enterprise grade cloud native software products and services Require minimum 1+ year of hands-on experience building and deploying web applications using Angular WEB development user interface Must have experience working with relational databases, able to write data queries to create, edit and fetch the data for both transactional and analytical validations Must have actual experience working with cloud infrastructure services, coding experience on building cloud microservices Must have experience with SAAS based automation framework development Actual professional experience (not academia) architecting systems built with Cloud Web Services, Microservices, Docker images and containers. Experience in developing and designing REST API's based web Services. Experience with web technologies: Angular, Node, JavaScript, CSS3, and HTML5 Experience with Dev/QA-Ops and understand what deployment means using systems like docker, AWS Require B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent quantitative degree; M.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent preferred Must be able to work remote until further notice with a return to office schedule of 2 days onsite and 3 days remote. Preferred Technical Skills Experience on developing automation framework for SAAS based projects. Hands on experience in AWS/Cloud technologies Hands on experience with Jasmine, Mocha, Playwright automation frameworks for web applications. Advanced experience working with any database technologies Worked in DevOps, installing, configuring, and integrating Automation scripts on Continuous Integration tools (CI/CD) like Azure for nightly test suite execution and working knowledge on testing and configuring Amazon Web services (AWS) Able to work in Agile team setup and address any automation requests from Product Management, Software Development Group, Client and Technical Service team’s w.r.t our software products in a timely manner. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Good analytical skills with strong attention to detail Experience in working with global teams. AWS or Azure Architect certifications are desirable Desirable Experience in working with large datasets Have AI/ML exposure on Cloud technologies/services Knowledge of insurance/reinsurance Additional Information Extreme event solutions at Verisk (formerly AIR Worldwide) provides risk modeling solutions that help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events. In 1987, Verisk founded the catastrophe modeling industry and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, supply chain disruptions, terrorism, pandemics, casualty catastrophes, and cyber incidents. Insurance, reinsurance, financial, corporate, and government clients rely on Verisk’s advanced science, software, and consulting services for catastrophe risk management, insurance-linked securities, longevity modeling, site-specific engineering analyses, and agricultural risk management. Verisk’s extreme event solutions team is headquartered in Boston, with additional offices in North America, Europe, and Asia. For more information, please visit www.air-worldwide.com. For more information about Verisk, a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, energy and specialized markets, and financial services, please visit www.verisk.com. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. Job Description Effectively lead and manage a team of developers/analysts in the requirements, design, development, test, and deployment of high-volume digital content authoring and management platform. Engage and manage globally distributed teams, and provide hands-on management, mentoring, and coaching of resources and drive annual goals. Decide on suitable strategies and objectives needed to meet system transformation goals including but not limited to the re-host, re-invention and buy vs. build decisions required Provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to analysts and software developers and effectively resolve production problems in a timely manner. Effectively communicate software solution expectations to internal customers, team members and other stakeholders. Propose, lead and implement scalable, sustainable and cost-effective solutions meeting internal and external customers’ objectives. Engage with senior management, peers and internal customers to plan and prioritize projects and resource allocation. Proactively communicate statuses, issues and escalations to senior management and stakeholders. Work with external vendors to source, negotiate and manage contract resources and solution services. Qualifications Expertise in Microsoft .Net, Sharepoint, C#, TFS, JS, Search Engines (solr, elastic search, FAST) and SQL Server At least 1-3 years of management plus at least 8 years of experience with building and operating high-volume content management and authoring applications. Ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences. Ability to deliver simple and elegant software solutions, digital content centric products, utilizing Agile development processes. Ability to lead teams of software developers and analysts, internal customers, infrastructure and operations teams and vendors to drive results. Proven experience in application analysis, application architecture and development. Strong understanding of web, desktop application and database concepts Demonstrated ability to articulate requirements, design, development, integration, test plans, migration/cutover plans and ongoing documentation of processes and change modifications. Ability to remain agile and adjust priorities based on workload, management directives and customer demands. Flexible management style; ability to quickly adapt to changing work environments and be hands-on as needed. Proven ability to build customer, business and peer relationships and manage business needs and expectations. Experience in developing content authoring and content management systems or products is highly desirable. Experience in cloud-based environment is desired. AWS experience or familiarity is a big plus. Experience in Budgeting and Forecasting a big plus. Systems architecture and development experience is required. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively to audiences at all levels. Ability to exercise executive-friendly communication skills. Job Description Takes responsibility for the successful delivery of the project. Serves as liaison between Development and Business to ensure smooth communication and prioritization of work. Leads Agile teams to achieve the objectives of the project. Works to continuously improve the team, both technically and culturally. Proactively takes the initiative to identify and resolve issues impacting the development team Identifies, assesses and manages risks to the success of the project, including the provision and use of contingency for those risks which are to be managed. Communicates with all stakeholders of the project based on their needs. Mentors junior agile project managers. Critical thinking skills, specifically the ability to identify issues, propose solutions and lead the effort in resolving the issues. Excellent interpersonal skills, demonstrated ability to use influence to keep teams focused and resolve conflicts Familiarity with basic development technologies and skills Ability to negotiate in reference to time management and deliverables. Proficient ScrumMaster, with demonstrated ability to recognize obstacles as they impede the team’s progress and to employ techniques to guide the team to continuously improve. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Data Engineering & Analytics Lab (DEAL) is responsible for the design and implementation of our core statistical data-systems including data ingestion, data integration, data transformation, data analysis, and analytic dataset construction. We’re an innovation group that is charged with visualizing the future of our organization’s operations and leveraging our expertise in data, technology, P&C insurance, and process optimization to provide a first-class analytics environment to our data-collection, data-management, actuarial, and data-analytics colleagues. The DEAL team is looking to hire an experienced Actuarial Associate, ideally having a good combination of an analytical/innovative mindset, technical aptitude, line of business experience, and communication skills. For internal candidates, this position is open to grade level 15-17. This is a hybrid role that will combine actuarial and data engineering skills and will be expected to manage multiple work-streams supporting a wide array of internal customers. The role will have responsibility for managing all aspects of a line of business's data-infrastructure from ingestion to analytic frameworks to content generation. Some Anticipated Work Assignments Include Build and maintain robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data Support product implementation on a new and innovative technology platform with product requirements, actuarial calculations, methods, and validation Design, build and launch extremely efficient & reliable data pipelines to move data (both large and small amounts) in/out of our Snowflake Data Lake Assist with product development and implementation including modeling and assumption development Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team Perform other tasks on R&D, data governance, system infrastructure, and other cross team functions, on an as-needed basis Adopt an agile framework to schedule work, adjust as needed and continuously improve performance Communicate performance with relevant internal stakeholders Work with data analysts to develop reports and visualizations Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users You will be part of a culture that embraces learning and innovation, values teamwork, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative (STEM) discipline with 4+ years of work experience in data\actuarial analysis & data engineering Completion of CAS Exam 5 (Basic Ratemaking), ACAS or higher preferred Minimum 4 years of experience working with property & casualty insurance data, preferably supporting an actuarial/data-science function in one of the following lines of business (Commercial Property, General Liability, Commercial Auto, Personal Auto) Highly proficient with SQL and database concepts Familiarity with rating manuals, loss cost (rate) filings, and statistical data Experience in preparing and conducting extensive business analysis and studies, process assessments, data analysis, and requirement specification Proficiency in Python, object-oriented programming, and data structures Strong technical and project management/process leadership skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills required Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Verisk is hiring a Sr Accountant to join our Finance team in Jersey City, NJ. In this role, you'll report directly to our Manager, SEC Reporting. Your day to day responsibilities will include: Direct contribution to SEC reporting team, including the preparation of quarterly and annual SEC filings (i.e. financial statements, footnotes, MD&A, etc.) Support manager in the preparation of periodic earnings releases and related materials required, including earnings script (effective partnering with Investor Relations) Preparation and oversight of all financial tie-outs (including financial statements, footnotes, MD&A, earnings presentation, etc.) by partnering with various functional teams Preparation and oversight of MD&A matrix Oversight of comprehensive financial analytics Oversight of footing and cross-footing of all aspects of SEC reporting for accuracy Develop expertise of our SEC reporting platform solution, RDG (ThunderDome), including XBRL tagging compliance Support manager in interactions with and fulfilling requests from management team, and external and internal auditors Preparation of KSOP/VEBA financial statements and support their annual audits Supervise and coach SEC staff accountant Assist with other ad-hoc projects as needed Take ownership of annual performance objectives and keep abreast of updates in SEC reporting developments Preparation of the Statement of Cash Flows Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in accounting from an accredited college or university, CPA certification preferred, but not required At least two years of technical accounting/SEC reporting experience (Big 4 or large regional audit firm experience strongly preferred), demonstrating the effective application of SEC and U.S. GAAP rules Self-starter and collaborator across various teams, including accounting, external audit, Investor Relations, business units, corporate tax, FP&A, Finance Systems and Reporting, etc. Quick learner, strong attention to detail, ability to self-review, and sense of ownership Proficient documentation, teamwork, communication, multi-tasking, and supervisory skills are required Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, and Outlook) Veteran Friendly! #hybrid Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description The Specialty lines Actuarial Product team is looking for ACAS or near ACAS to: Join our team and contribute their knowledge and experience with Property and Casualty insurance in a way that will help shape changes in the Cyber/Financial Lines (FI) industry. Be part of the team that leads the innovation and updates of the Cyber/FI product offerings. Produce quality results in a timely manner while maintaining customer focus in all their work. Serve as a customer-facing product expert for Cyber/FI. FI lines include Crime/Fidelity, D&O, EPL, E&O, and MPL (Medical). More Specifically, We Expect You To Lead projects independently that target on developing enhancements and innovations to actuarial products and procedures for Cyber/FI. Collaborate closely with other ISO divisions on new products that may be actuarial or underwriting focused. Provide actuarial analyses in supporting, maintaining and enhancing existing Cyber/FI actuarial products. Be a key contributor in the effort to develop a more modern rating infrastructure for class rated and specifically rated risks. Utilize your expertise to analyze market, industry, competitor, legal, and regulatory trends and use these to provide actionable insights that drive the business of both the company and its customers. Interact with regulatory authorities to support filings of loss cost reviews and new/enhanced products. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science or related majors. ACAS or FCAS desired. 3+ years’ experience leading team(s) and or projects, with strong records of building great internal or external customer relationships that focus on gaining actionable insights and forming collaborative partnerships with the goal of innovation, product improvement, or ease of use. Demonstrated ability to lead initiatives, work independently and as part of a team. Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills. Knowledge of market, industry, customer, and competitor trends Familiarity with predictive analytics modeling preferred. Strong computing skills desired, such as SAS, SQL, Syncsort, Access and Excel, --- some experience with project-oriented programming such as JAVA would be a plus but is not a requirement. jobDescription: Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk is seeking a Sr. Cloud Platform Engineer who will be responsible for the full lifecycle operation of Verisk cloud-based analytics platform. This platform includes elements such as a data lake, data governance, and analytical layers, as well as supporting CI/CD processes and common services that enable cloud application development and cost and governance controls. This person will also work closely with business-facing teams to define and prioritize features necessary to implementing business unit deliverables. This will include defining and implementing a roadmap of such features, aligning that roadmap to business unit deliverables. It will also include working closely with other team members as well as communicating to relevant stakeholders in the corporate IS&T team and business units. The Purpose Of This Role Is To Ensure effective cloud strategy is implemented across our analytics platform, esp. for governance and data security. Collaborate with other IS&T teams, including cloud operations and Infosecurity, to insure the proper and secure operation of our analytics platform. Ensure that our analytics platform, governance and technologies are available for our internal customers to consume in a timely manner, with clearly defined SLAs that meet business unit needs. Ensure we identify the requirements necessary for implementing business unit deliverables. Define and communicate a roadmap for implementing these features. Ensuring that the productivity and timelines kept by our team are continually being improved and optimized, by internal teams as well as by external resources Collaborate with finance to monitor environments for cost tracking/attribution purposes. The Key Responsibilities Of This Role Are Manage and operate the analytics environment to meet and exceed Verisk cloud governance and cost control processes with operational best practices. Lead the cloud implementation of our analytics platform and its services, collaborating with the development and data leads. Assist in the shaping of application and data access requirements. Work directly with internal customers on planning meetings to understand their requirements. Contribute updates as needed to project leads. Identify and propose solutions to data and analytics problems, using new technology when appropriate. Work with peers to implement and maintain data governance policies. Qualifications At least 10 years’ experience in AWS cloud architecting, implementing, administering, and supporting similar cloud-first environments. AWS certifications a strong plus. Able to collaborate with and lead a distributed technical team; able to work with peers leading data and analytics efforts. Strong understanding of data security, cloud security, and data governance principles. Experience with CI/CD (esp. Git) Strong service-organization, customer-centric mindset. Ability to understand and manage the demands of business users with diverse requirements. Analytics mindset with strong communications skills. Success Criteria Successful adoption of the analytics platform by business units, including positive feedback from business unit stakeholders Successful definition of SLAs and KPI, and their regular reporting Successful completion of business unit projects on the Nautilus ecosystem. Successful security patch management KPI, in coordination with our cloud operations team Successful deployment of customized analytics environments, as needed, for our internal analytics teams Operational excellence in the our analytics ecosystem, including high level of automation and scalability. SOC Type II certification and ongoing compliance for production cloud environments Usage and costs can be transparently attributed to business units. Smooth operation of CI/CD focused DevOps processes; adherence of analytics cloud account to Verisk Cloud policies Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description The Verisk Corporate Compliance team is hiring a Sr. Compliance Analyst. This new role will help develop and maintain all government contracting assessment tools while working closely with Business Units and Corporate teams to review documents and artifacts related to US Federal and State, and international contracting requirements. This role is based out of our Jersey City, NJ corporate headquarters. Verisk offers a flexible hybrid work environment with in-office work at least 2 days/week. Develop and maintain all government contracting assessment tools and databases in the GRC tool Develop government contracting Risk Registers Prepare oversight and monitoring reports to access compliance with GSA and other federal and state contracting requirements Oversee development of corrective action plans required to remediate any issues identified as part of oversight activities Work closely with Business Unit and corporate function staff reviewing documents and artifacts related to GSA and state contracting requirements Prepare PowerPoint training presentations and related training materials as required Develop government contracting policies and procedures Create and maintain reporting templates for compliance monitoring oversight and reporting Review all government contracts to develop oversight and monitoring plans Conduct compliance monitoring activities to assess compliance with laws, regulations, and Verisk Analytics and Business Unit policies and procedures Respond to Business Unit and government contracting officer requests for information Work with outside consultants to build the government contracting oversight program Review all government contracting certifications prior to submission to the relevant government agency/authority Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation Qualifications Minimum of 6 years experience in government contracting at the U.S. federal and state level, with extensive experience handling GSA contracts and California CMAS contracting, extensive knowledge of Federal FAR regulations, experience in compliance auditing and monitoring a plus. Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience, advanced degree preferred. Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint, GRC Tool experience a plus Strong organizational skills Ability to work collaboratively across all Business Units Strong written and verbal skills #hybrid Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description There’s a difference between saying you’re disruptive and being disruptive. In the world of software implementation, our competitors promise transformative solutions, but deliver solutions using practices developed decades ago. This tired approach results in a lengthy implementation process fraught with obstacles and is certainly unpalatable in today’s technology driven environments. For FAST being disruptive means delivering functioning Policy Admin Systems to our customers in as little as 12 weeks – sometimes less. Disruptive means practicing the Agile methodology throughout all phases of an implementation; utilizing true Service Orientated Architecture to install smaller software components and microservices; and engaging daily with our customers to provide unprecedented value. Our team has a sensational opportunity for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join a successful and rapidly growing software company in a highly visible position. Our ideal candidate will be a hands-on, agile thinker fluent in today’s latest cloud and security technologies. Responsibilities Consult with internal and external stakeholders to design, install, and configure solutions Lead various project rollouts from POC to implementation Provide direct hands-on support in the design, deployment, administration, and monitoring of production and development systems at scale in an AWS cloud environment Identify requirements for upgrading/scaling our cloud and infrastructure systems to improve security, reliability, and performance Quickly respond to operational issues, cloud, or network infrastructure, to minimize any interruption in services to customers Enhance CI/CD pipelines in support of dynamic cloud-based resources Support and mentor junior DevOps engineers in the performance of their duties Collaborate with Product Development and other internal teams to enhance software offerings Ability to participate in 24/7 hosting support environment Qualifications Essential Skills & Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related engineering 4 - 7 years demonstrated hands-on cloud and infrastructure technology solution experience 4+ years’ experience large scale cloud-based product operations (SaaS) Cloud operations expert AWS Solutions Architect (Associate) certification required Other cloud experience, such as Azure or Google, a plus Demonstrated technologist with broad experience across a variety of operations and services including DevOps, Pipeline Construction, Release automation and deployment Adept at evaluating problems accurately and displaying sound judgment Strong interest in automation and security Proven experience driving adoption of new technology into existing complex systems Excellent communication and presentation skills Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Job Description This role interfaces with the Product leaders, Reporting, Controllership, and other Corporate Finance teams. The Sr. Financial Analyst should be a self-starter who can work closely with senior leaders, deliver superior analytics, and own complex deliverables. The responsibilities include: Providing support in completion of month-end close activities, compiling financial statements, completing variance analysis, balance sheet reconciliations, and preparing and posting journal entries Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts. Lead monthly financial reviews with senior leadership team Develop financial projections and build financial models. Prepare models to support strategic decision-making. Understand key business drivers, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements. Perform research and analysis as required Work closely with the Billings team to ensure that there are no delays and revenue is accurate for the month. Prepare Ad-hoc Revenue and Expense analysis using pivot tables and v-lookups Develop and maintain financial forecasts and budget (monthly, quarterly, annually). Help prepare Senior Management presentations / meetings (Monthly Business Reviews, Quarterly Forecast review meetings, etc.) Ensure compliance with financial guidelines, company policies, and relevant legal regulations. Qualifications 3+ years work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, and/or corporate finance Bachelor’s Degree Comfortable with P&L Management and Construction Experience performing variance analysis against budget and forecast and writing explanations Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills. Knowledge of Tableau/Power BI is a big plus. Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and accuracy Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Should be able to present to the senior management Ability to work under pressure and within short time constraints in a complex system and business environment Basic Accounting knowledge Experience with Financial Systems: Smartview/Oracle Financials, Peoplesoft, and nVision a plus Team player, able to work in a collaborative environment Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Possible Research Areas Include, But Are Not Limited To Verisk Atmospheric and Environmental Research (AER) is looking for a Staff Scientist or a Senior Research Associate to perform and initiate research in oceanographic and climate science. Coupled modeling, including the cryosphere and land Seasonal to decadal prediction and predictability Ocean biogeochemistry and air-sea gas exchange Coastal processes, including marine extremes Relationships between climate and extreme weather As a new member of Verisk AER’s internationally recognized Research and Development Division, you will be provided (1) ample opportunities to collaborate with scientists at AER and other prestigious research institutions and (2) both individual and team mentorship to develop your own externally funded research program. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will contribute to ongoing research programs in ocean circulation, sea level and climate variability and change. You will develop new approaches for analyzing, comparing, and interpreting large and diverse datasets, including satellite and in-situ observations and numerical model output. You will lead high-impact peer-reviewed papers, give presentations at scientific conferences, and keep up with relevant scientific and computational advances. You will grow your own research program by establishing internal and external collaborations and applying for both public and private sources of funding at a rate commensurate with previous experience. Qualifications Advanced degree in a climate-related discipline, with oceanographic research experience. Strong scientific programming skills in R, MATLAB, or Python (preferred) (lower-level languages are a plus). Excellent writing skills and comfort with public speaking. Track record of research innovation, independence, and collaboration. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Join our Corporate Communications team in our Jersey City, NJ office. Verisk offers a hybrid work environment with in-office work 2 days/week. You’ll be responsible for creating, managing and contributing to internal communications strategies, campaigns and calendars. You’ll help manage and improve the efficiency and efficacy of the company’s internal communications channels such as the intranet, Yammer, email. You’ll also have experience working with a variety of stakeholders across an organization and working on the latest communications channels. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrow. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description We’re looking for an ambitious and driven Product Marketing Senior Specialist ready to apply their expertise in marketing strategy and execution for a marketing team within a fast-paced publicly traded company. You’ll have a proven track record in developing, managing, and reporting on marketing campaigns and offering marketing solutions to stakeholders across solutions/products to meet revenue goals. In addition, you’ll exhibit a deep understanding of markets and customers to devise and lead a product’s go-to-market strategy and demonstrate excellent leadership and project management skills. The Product Marketing Senior Specialist will define a marketing strategy and roadmap for solutions for Verisk Life Solutions. You’ll be working with a group of accomplished high-level professionals while deepening your knowledge and skills with an ever-expanding breadth of projects and the opportunity to make independent decisions. You’ll apply your talent in communicating the value of Verisk solutions and enjoy collaborating and building relationships with colleagues and clients. Responsibilities Market & Competitive Intelligence – Understand market and competitive intelligence to develop insights and strategies that inform product positioning and direction Customer Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, buyer needs and the purchasing decision process for the product, including key buyer roles (Product) Strategy – Define the market opportunity for a product through demonstrated knowledge of business goals for the product (product portfolio & roadmap, innovation plans, pricing models, etc.) Marketing Strategy – Deliver ongoing marketing planning process inclusive of objectives, strategies, tactics, budget, and measurement that secures BU leader and CMO approval Messaging & Positioning - Develop product positioning and messaging that differentiates Verisk Life Solutions in the market Sales enablement – Work with the product team to develop sales collateral to enable effective selling, and other on-demand materials in support of sales efforts. Campaign Development - Conceive of, lead, and launch innovative, integrated, and multimedia marketing campaigns to include email marketing, digital content, web landing pages, online advertising, podcasts, video, advertising, social media, etc. Deliver superior creative briefs that compel outstanding creative development. Marketing Analytics - Monitor and report on the performance of products in the market and communicate the results of related sales and marketing efforts Thought Leader - Serve as internal and market-facing SME/thought leader for the product Qualifications BA in marketing, communications, or related field. 3 to 5 years of strategic marketing and/or marketing/product management experience Demonstrated success with marketing strategy development and implementation across multiple channels. Clear understanding of the digital marketing landscape: marketing automation; demand generation; personalization; sales enablement/effectiveness; attribution reporting; campaign management Skilled at writing and socializing product-level documents: marketing plan, sales enablement plan, launch plan, solution handbook Successful track-record of cross-functional collaboration with teams, contributors, and stakeholders across multiple seniority levels Detail oriented with strong analytical and business problem-solving skills, including financial analysis, ROI analysis, and customer segmentation. Data-driven and results-oriented, with a perspective on how to measure and evaluate metrics for pre and post product launch, and define and measure metrics to measure the impact of marketing efforts Ability to rapidly prioritize and react to changing business needs and external market dynamics Skills Innovative and creative thinker: pioneer who embraces bold ideas Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: works quickly and nimbly; able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed, and motivated; demonstrates endurance Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description We’re looking for a Marketing Analytics Specialist to join our digital marketing team. This role will focus on the performance of our digital channels, including analysis into social performance, digital media/pr, email, search, web, and intranet. The candidate should: Have proven analytical and technical skills, strong people skills, great attention to detail, solid organizational skills, and the drive to always learn and grow Be comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously Be collaborative when working with data service and marketing teams The position is based in New York (Jersey City, NJ) and reports to the Director of Marketing Analytics. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated person to join us in testing solutions for Insurance/Reinsurance risk modeling. You will be responsible for testing the software in an agile environment. We are looking for a candidate who can comprehend new technologies, come up to speed quickly and adapt to evolving requirements. Analyze functional requirements and design specifications & create test plans and test cases, execute & validate the test results. Automate test cases, debug and fix automation issues. Create a robust acceptance & regression testing repository. Discover, debug, document and verify software anomalies. Document test artifacts; evaluate testing results and track them using internal tools/processes. Communicate critical issues and status updates in a timely manner. Address queries from Product Management, Software Development Group and Client Servicing team’s w.r.t our software products in a timely manner. Identify QA and testing issues, and generate solutions for process improvement Contribute to the training of new hires & ramping them up to speed. Work collaboratively with a global team. Qualifications Essential: Minimum of bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics. Minimum 4 - 6 Years’ experience working in an Agile software development team. Knowledge of C#, C++, Java or any other object-oriented programming language. Knowledge & hands-on-experience of data management tools including but not limited to SQL/R/Python and Excel. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Good analytical skills with strong attention to detail. Experience in working with global teams. Desirable Knowledge of insurance/reinsurance. Experience in working with large datasets. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Verisk is seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented individual to join our Marketing Team. The Sr. Strategist, Client Outcomes will build a new function in marketing to quantify client outcomes and craft a client reference program. In this role, this individual will identify client outcomes that build a strong relationship with Verisk. In this inaugural role for Verisk marketing, the ideal candidate will need to think strategically, write effectively and display strong analytical and critical thinking skills. This individual will also have excellent marketing skills and business acumen to work alongside sales and business leaders to develop a client reference library and program to creates client outcomes including media stories, speaking engagements and more. The individual should have significant expertise in account-based marketing and have demonstrated success delivering insights for large, global organizations and be viewed as a trusted partner and advisor to C-suite executives and senior leaders. The role is based in one of our primary offices - New York (Jersey City, NJ), Boston or Salt Lake City (Lehi, UT). Verisk offers a hybrid work environment with in-office work at least 2 days/week. Job Responsibilities Build a client reference program that delivers successful and measurable outcomes Craft and secure approval of the client reference program Develop tight sales, legal and client relationships to create (and maintain) client reference library In partnership with other marketing teams at Verisk and client secure marketing outcomes Partner across marketing to develop and implement initial target account strategy to support account-based lifetime client value Expand marketing relationship with sales team Communicate and educate the sales team regarding client reference program opportunities new and planned marketing activities across client marketing programs Demonstrate how our clients build Verisk brand awareness and preference Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required in business, marketing or related field Integrated Marketing Experience (7+ years) Demonstrated knowledge of best practices related to customer reference programs Excellent project management skills with the ability to drive end-to-end execution of client reference programs Strong presentation, written and verbal skills, especially adept at uncovering customer outcomes, quantifying their value and securing Verisk sales and client approvals Keen understanding of visual design and how to display customer outcomes through compelling infographics Data-driven mindset Strong analytical mind to architect a measurable, outcome-based customer reference program Experience creating and executing client campaigns using tactics that include earned media, speaking engagements Skills Innovative and creative thinker: pioneer who embraces bold ideas Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed and motivated; demonstrates endurance Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.
