About The Role Job Description Verisk is looking for a results-oriented, imaginative thinker and strong outcomes driven implementer to lead the marketing efforts that support Verisk as a world-class employer brand. The HR Marketing Manager will help bring to life the various activities required to empower our HR strategy, including talent acquisition and D&I (diversity and inclusion) initiatives. In this inaugural role, the successful candidate is one who can envision long-term strategy but can roll up their sleeves and get involved in every level of execution. You will be comfortable communicating directly with senior leaders and working in a highly cross functional role. The role is based in our New York (Jersey City, NJ). Verisk offers a hybrid work environment with in-office work at least 2 days/week. Job Responsibilities Employee Journey – Create compelling customer insights through development of target personas, their needs and how to position Verisk as the employer of choice Talent Acquisition Strategy – Define the market engagement opportunity for Verisk across prospective talent pools through demonstrated knowledge of recruiting goals and needs Marketing Strategy – Deliver ongoing marketing planning process inclusive of objectives, strategies, tactics, budget, and measurement that secures CHRO and CMO approval Messaging & Positioning – Create audience-centric positioning and messaging that differentiates Verisk to prospective employees Brand Alignment - Work with HR to complete Verisk’s brand migration across all HR systems and platforms throughout the organization, both visual (logo, colors) and verbal (why we exist.). Campaign Development – Create HR marketing plan to support HR strategies and go-to-market plans. Lead integrated marketing activities that may include events, email marketing, digital content online advertising, video, social media. Deliver superior creative briefs that compel outstanding creative development. Marketing Analytics - Monitor and report on the performance of campaigns and communicate the results of marketing efforts Thought Leader - Serve as the marketing partner for HR team, and new acquisitions Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required in business, marketing or related field Related marketing experience (7+ years) Integrated marketing experience (strategic planning and execution) leading HR marketing activities Excellent project management skills with the ability to drive end-to-end execution of marketing programs Strong presentation, written and verbal skills, especially adept at driving strategic marketing insights to deliver compelling campaigns Global B2B experience preferred Data-driven mindset Strong analytical mind to architect a measurable, outcome-based deliverable Strategy driven execution Someone who is always aligning tasks and activities with targeted outcomes Skilled at working collaboratively across marketing to drive efficiencies that allow us to optimize our resources by setting up replicable processes for effective engagement Skills Team player: high EQ, low ego, resourceful, frugal; treats resources as their own “Let’s go” attitude: optimist, contagious enthusiast, sees the upside Accountability matters: drives for results as coach and team player; bias to outcomes Exhibits aptitude: always learning and growing; constantly attempts new experiences Adaptable: able and willing to wear multiple hats without hesitation; resilient Grit: passionate, self-directed and motivated; demonstrates endurance Collaborative: demonstrated ability to nurture strong relationships with key stakeholders Creative thinker: able to quickly shift gears and create experiences applicable for different audiences, with different needs Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. About The Role Job Description Possible Research Areas Include, But Are Not Limited To Verisk Atmospheric and Environmental Research (AER) is looking for a Staff Scientist or a Senior Research Associate to perform and initiate research in oceanographic and climate science. Coupled modeling, including the cryosphere and land Seasonal to decadal prediction and predictability Ocean biogeochemistry and air-sea gas exchange Coastal processes, including marine extremes Relationships between climate and extreme weather As a new member of Verisk AER’s internationally recognized Research and Development Division, you will be provided (1) ample opportunities to collaborate with scientists at AER and other prestigious research institutions and (2) both individual and team mentorship to develop your own externally funded research program. About The Day-to-Day Responsibilities Of The Role You will contribute to ongoing research programs in ocean circulation, sea level and climate variability and change. You will develop new approaches for analyzing, comparing, and interpreting large and diverse datasets, including satellite and in-situ observations and numerical model output. You will lead high-impact peer-reviewed papers, give presentations at scientific conferences, and keep up with relevant scientific and computational advances. You will grow your own research program by establishing internal and external collaborations and applying for both public and private sources of funding at a rate commensurate with previous experience. Qualifications Advanced degree in a climate-related discipline, with oceanographic research experience. Strong scientific programming skills in R, MATLAB, or Python (preferred) (lower-level languages are a plus). Excellent writing skills and comfort with public speaking. Track record of research innovation, independence, and collaboration. Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Job Description You will support the timely approval and implementation of ISO filings and related issues. You will be expected to maintain awareness of current filing issues and historical issues, review/assemble filings in SERFF, work with field staff for review of materials, communicate filing activity to internal stakeholders, research filing objections to support field staff and contribute to the home office state filing team on day-to-day management of filing activity. Responsibilities Support timely approval and implementation of ISO's regulatory filings of insurance program coverage forms, manuals, pricing and related products. Build ISO filing in SERFF in accordance with filing requirements Communicate filing activity to internal stakeholders Research historical objections to support filed staff in managing issues Work as part of the home office state filing unit on the day to day management of filings Qualifications College degree, or equivalent experience 4+ years experience within the P&C industry. Experience in product development, pricing, or state filings and regulatory compliance are preferred Superior interpersonal, oral/written communication and negotiation skills, and a proven record of project management Experience working with insurance departments on filing issues and demonstrated ability to develop relationships with internal and external stake-holders and advocate on company’s behalf a plus Ability to think strategic and act tactical to advance ISO's and Verisk's interests Knowledge and understanding of the current P/C marketplace Understanding and use of ISO products is desirable CPCU and other industry designations preferred Based in Auburn, MA Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Designs, creates and develops software code, writes test cases, establishes design patterns and frameworks, and contributes to best coding practices Responsible for collaborating with a team of software designers and developers to deliver high quality internally designed software and processes within budget and on schedule. Participates in full software development life cycle delivering robust high-performance applications and services adhering to team and corporate standards, guidelines, and policies Provides work breakdown and estimates for small software development tasks. Reports status updates for areas of individual responsibilities in projects on timely basis. Guides and mentors more junior members of the team in regards to the object-oriented and functional programming paradigms / languages Facilitates the discussions regarding design processes and frameworks, etc. Promotes Agile architecture and development on the project Investigates the design implications of incorporating analytics into solutions and delivering information to users through a variety of interfaces Qualifications 7+ years of proven experience in designing, architecting, leading, developing, coding and testing of large-scale business applications and frameworks. Excellent experience with technologies like C#, .NET, ETL tools, AWS based technologies such as Lambda, S3, IAM, SQS, EC2, ECS, Redis, DynamoDB as well as deep understanding of relational and NoSQL databases, etc. Ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology, provide technical thought leadership Ability to drive the architecture of systems to provide a highly scalable and highly resilient design and infrastructure to support our products. Demonstrated excellence with N-tiered architecture, SOA, REST Services, JSON, XML, AWS, data engineering and productionizing the cloud-based architectures Experienced at developing elegant-yet-simple systems using best practices and design patterns Solid experience and understanding in the following technologies and tools: cloud-based design, AWS Services, continuous integration/continuous deployment, automation tool experience– Jenkins, Hudson, Bamboo etc. Highly experienced at leading technical solutioning and guiding project’s technical and architectural direction. This is not a management role, but rather an individual contributor technologist role. Excellent understanding of programming design concepts and software development processes and methods, Agile methodology, Scrum teams and best practices, etc. Superior organization skills, skilled at recognizing priorities and keeping a team focused on most important features Must have passion for development and latest technologies Experience with Test Driven Development, Unit Testing, etc. and Use Cases. Job Description We are looking for a Technical Lead to own a leadership role to guide developing and implementing software solutions. You will work collaboratively with multiple departments to ensure successful execution of solutions. You must be able to with minimum supervision on complex problems where analysis of situations requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. You will represent the organization on specific projects/teams and work directly with the business. Responsible for oversight of multiple development teams to deliver high quality internally designed software and processes within budget and on schedule.   Experience in content management solutions, developing on digital experience platforms (i.e. Sitecore, Adobe) Direct and coordinate business planning, proposals, projects, and overall support of the various activities Build strong and productive partnerships across the enterprise. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Job Description The User Experience (UX) Design Lead is responsible for creating compelling, innovative design solutions that demonstrate the power and value of rich client, web-based product experiences. The UX Design Lead is responsible for collaborating with Engineering and Product to conceptualize, design, and prototype innovative, highly usable applications, including UI design patterns and frameworks for next-generation analytics applications. The UX Design Lead is responsible for guiding their design team in the development of highly interactive prototypes to demonstrate the product vision. There will be a need for close coordination with all relevant stakeholders to ensure that the designs can be adopted and extended across product suites. Principal Responsibilities And Essential Duties Develop and drive the design strategy for claims solutions. Manage/build a design team, establishing design standards, training, and supporting the team in UX best practices. Work cross-functionally to plan, prioritize, and deliver information architecture, information design, visual design/page layouts, tools, services and applications to support a complete and cohesive user experience. Leverage modern web technologies to define innovative user interfaces and interaction models that result in improved user productivity and operational efficiency. Work closely with key stakeholders to communicate design strategy and underlying design rational. Collaborate with product teams and follow Verisk corporate design guidelines to develop UI common components and design patterns for the next-generation application suite. Make understanding end-user requirements a constant priority. Educate internal teams on best practices around information architecture, interaction and visual designs, usability and supporting technologies. Qualifications 5+ years of experience in design complex enterprise level desktop and web applications. Created seamless and consistent user experiences. People management experience required Track record of developing and delivering successful, intuitive, and compelling designs that contribute toward market leadership. Successful track record of delivering integrated, high-end user interfaces on schedule, on budget, and with exceptional quality. Deep knowledge of user-center design processes and methodologies. Experience with WCAG Broad knowledge and skills in visual design, information architecture, usability evaluation, and related UX methodologies. Solid understanding of interactive web technologies (Mobile Web, HTML5/CSS, DHTML, JavaScript, Flash, Flex, Ajax, Mashups) and industry trends and experience designing applications leveraging these trends. Experience gathering and documenting business, functional, and end user requirements.  Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to successfully develop and deliver shipping products. Experience in creating both low- and high-fidelity wireframes (from sketching to interactive prototypes). Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk Extreme Event Solutions is seeking an experienced, passionate and ambitious individual to lead client engagements and development of analytics in the residential and commercial mortgage industry. The successful candidate will leverage their experience and knowledge of the mortgage industry to develop a growth strategy and product roadmap for Verisk’s world-class models for extreme event risk, proprietary property data, and advanced technology platforms. Main Responsibilities Lead market penetration strategy for Verisk’s tools and data into the residential and commercial mortgage industry. Identify short- and long-term client prospects, create product vision with associated revenue and cost estimates, and contribute expertise to guide marketing efforts. Lead and support business development efforts for new projects, lead technical and scoping discussions with a focus on growth opportunities with mortgage investors, mortgage servicers and others. Lead client engagements using Verisk’s analytical tools and data. Working individually or as part of team, develop and execute project tasks and manage timelines and resource requirements. Collaborate with Verisk teams to meet client needs, adapting tools, data and workflows to achieve the unique goals of the mortgage industry towards measuring and monitoring risks from natural disasters and climate change. Deliver technical presentations and develop technical reports, coordinating across product and technical teams, sales and marketing, and other Verisk entities as required. Represent Verisk in a range of forums including internal and external conferences, industry events and client meetings. Qualifications Desired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Deep subject matter expertise of mortgage analytics with particular focus and experience with financial risk management Excellent written and verbal communications skills, including project and relationship management Ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences Ability to manage cross functional teams and develop product requirements, use cases and specifications Knowledge of catastrophe modeling tools, data and workflows, and familiarity with climate change regulatory reporting are a plus Requirements Minimum 10 years of experience in a technical development or consulting capacity focused on mortgage risk analysis Demonstrated experience in leading new initiatives to drive growth and profitability BS/BA required, advanced degree a plus. Degrees in economics, science, finance, engineering, or mathematics preferred. Candidates with related degrees and quantitative experience will be considered. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description Verisk Extreme Event Solutions (VEES, previously AIR Worldwide), a member of Verisk Analytics, is the scientific leader and most respected provider of risk modeling software and consulting services. VEES founded the catastrophe modeling industry in 1987 and today models the risk from natural catastrophes, terrorism, and pandemic outbreaks in 90 countries. VEES offers the opportunity to work with advanced technologies, global clients, and hundreds of the most innovative, talented minds in the industry. As a weapon effect modeling engineer, the primary responsibility will be to study the impact of various incidents (conventional blast, chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear weapons) on the built environment and human beings. The outcome of the research will be translated to model weapon impacts on large insurance portfolios in terms of monetary cost due to property damage and human casualty. The candidate will work closely with a team of specialists to perform a probabilistic risk assessment by various possible weapon attacks, and present and explain results to technical and non-technical audiences including VERISK clients and government officials. A successful candidate should have a strong technical background in science, engineering, or mathematics, have passion and desire to learn, and is expected to be a highly motivated, detail-oriented, well-organized, self-directed, and excellent team player. As a researcher at VERISK, the nature of our work varies from month to month and year to year, and you will have constant opportunities to learn and grow expertise in new areas. Responsibilities (main Responsibilities, But Not Limited To) Simulate the impact of conventional blast, and release of chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear weapons on built environments and human beings Use the above research to develop solutions for risk assessment of insurance portfolios Represent VERISK to explain view of risks to technical and non-technical audiences Author technical writing for internal and external publications Qualifications Experience with 3D CDF analysis, preferably used blastFoam to estimate blast wave propagation, and/or its effects on buildings and human in urban setting Experience in using DoD simulation tools for blast effects and plume simulation due to release of hazardous materials Familiarity with C++ and data mining skills using tools such as R, Matlab and others Ability to communicate effectively through verbal and written mediums with technical and non-technical audiences Strong data archiving and documentation mindset Experience with GIS applications (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, etc.) a plus MS with 2+ years of relevant experience or PhD in science, engineering, or mathematics Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. Job Description Wildfire has caused significant economic losses in recent years and led to numerous environmental changes including an extended period of drought, loss of vegetation and alteration of soil properties. In this position, you will have an opportunity to directly work on a wildfire modeling that helps insurance companies to assess and manage risks. The role includes developing and enhancing damage estimation by wildfire for insurance portfolios by incorporating knowledge of wildfire mitigation, insurance regulations and state legislation. The candidate will work closely with a team of engineers, scientists, statisticians, and specialists in the research department. Candidate best suited for this position is expected to be highly motivated and detail-oriented team player with sophisticated problem-solving skills. Main Responsibilities Analyze wildfire data to build basis for wildfire damage and loss estimation Build vulnerability models to assess damage to buildings, infrastructures, and industrial facilities subjected to wildfires as well as wildfire smoke Represent VERISK to explain view of risks to technical and non-technical audiences Author technical writing for internal and external publications Qualifications Knowledge of wildfire risk mitigation, wildfire related insurance regulations and state legislation Hands-on experience in fire risk assessment or post-fire damage assessment Proficient in programming with Python, R or similar. C++ programming capability is a plus Demonstrated experience in statistical and probabilistic modeling Familiarity of GIS data process, analysis, and visualization Ability to communicate effectively through verbal and written mediums with technical and non-technical audiences Requirements Master with 2+ years of related experience or PhD degree in Agricultural, Civil, Fire Protection, Mechanical, or other relevant engineering disciplines. Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list. Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Overview Job Description The Research and Modeling group at Verisk Extreme Event Solutions is looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented research engineer to join our team. The research engineer position will be responsible for developing, enhancing and managing the vulnerability component and overall model performance of Verisk Extreme Event Solutions’ atmospheric peril vulnerability models that cover multiple regions and perils, including hurricane, straight-line tornadic winds, storm surge as well as precipitation-driven flooding. The candidate will work closely with a team of structural engineers, meteorologists, statisticians, hydrologists/hydraulic engineers, and specialists in financial application of probabilistic risk assessment. We are seeking candidates with a desire to use their problem-solving skills in applying sound engineering principles to solve unique and challenging problems in the fields of civil/structural engineering, risk assessment and many interconnected scientific disciplines. It is expected that the candidate will be well-organized, able to perform high-quality self-directed research, have outstanding written and verbal communication skills, and be an effective team player. Main Responsibilities Understand key features of any interested region’s (worldwide) building inventory and its impact on vulnerability subjected to atmospheric hazards Investigate the impact of building codes’ design and construction specifications on building’s and their components’ vulnerability for countries worldwide (in Europe, Latin America etc.) Development of vulnerability functions and monetary loss curves for structural and non-structural building and infrastructure components subjected to hazards such as hurricane winds, hail, tornadoes, storm surge, precipitation induced flooding for the regions of interest. Collect, analyze and efficiently manage a wide variety of data (such as building characteristics, damage and loss data) used in the development and validation of catastrophe models. Implement the research of building vulnerability into Verisk Extreme Event Solutions’ portfolio risk assessment models, and validate the output Investigate property damage in the aftermath of flooding, including statistical analysis of historical damage and insurance claims data Provide technical support regarding model development and communicate results internally and externally to staff and clients. Qualifications Ph.D. in Wind Engineering, Structural Engineering, Building Science, Civil Engineering, and/or other relevant fields Deep understanding of and/or ability to research international building codes and standards across various countries Experience in probabilistic and stochastic risk assessment and modeling, particularly in the field of structural engineering Proficient in C/C++, Python, R, SQL, MATLAB Knowledge of data mining skills and/or statistical analysis tools Excellent communication skills to convey findings to internal and external stakeholders Knowledge of GIS applications is a plus Insurance industry experience is a plus Additional Information In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.
